We had a room at the front of the hotel and our window overlooked the street, which we liked.Absolutely loved my stay and when I come back I'm booking this hotel again.

We had a snowstorm coming and didn't want to drive home late from the train, so stayed last-minute at the Broadway at Times Square. Had some trepidation I must admit - we don't usually stay in Times Square. BUT it worked out fine and actually better than fine. Dinner, the theater, BB Kings afterwards, and dim sum the next day were all quite close, which was nice since it was snowing and raining. The lobby is small/non-existent, one person who was nice at the desk. There is a luggage storage room. The room is simple but bigger than some, we had a comfortable King bed. Doors are those annoying slamming type but other than street noise it was pretty quiet. Breakfast ends at 10:00 so we missed it but there are nearby options for coffee. Great reading lights at each side of the bed, very important and not often found. Bathroom has a fan, another vital detail often overlooked. Lotions/soap in environmental dispensers. BAsed on our one night, you'll be fine here!

The staff was friendly and attentive and our room was clean and quiet. The location is right off of Times Square, we felt safe and were within walking distance to the subway and other attractions. We aren't interested in fluff, after all we are here to be out experiencing the city. We would recommend this hotel to all of our friends and family.

This hotel has is all, price, location and comfort. A fantastic location to visit Times Square and the Theater District, and just three blocks from the subway station that gets you easily uptown, downtown and anywhere in Manhattan. Don't let the reasonable price fool you, our room was quiet, the bed comfortable, breakfast tasty and the staff was helpful throughout our stay.

This hotel is a gem. If you are in town to do all the tourist things then stay here. You can walk to almost anywhere. The hotel is clean and quiet. The staff is so nice and helpful to everyone. The rooms are on the small size but are not tiny. We will be back

Great stay. Was given an upgrade without asking because the staff at the desk was amazing. There is also free breakfast that I was unaware of, but most welcome-hot and cold NOT just danish and coffee! The room was small but comfortable and clean (a MUST) and size doesn't matter when I am just going back there to sleep after an amazing night. This hotel is on 46th Street and there are MANY amazing places to eat and drink just along that street. You won't regret staying here!

We found this hotel to be really nice and the staff friendly and helpful with any enquires we had. The room was really nice and the bed was very comfy and made for a good nights sleep. Breakfast was really nice, good choice of selection, the donuts were very tasty. You couldn't hear any noise from Times Square and is the perfect hotel to stay in to get around the city.

I have stayed in NY many times and this is a very well appointed budget hotel with lots of additional and unexpected amenities: Free breakfast (bagels, waffles, doughnuts, bananas, juice and tea or coffee); free wifi; free tea and coffee available 24/7 from the little help yourself breakfast room. This saved us quite a few dollars and time. I had a small quiet room on the ninth floor and it was perfect for one. My travelling companion had a larger room with fridge and microwave on the third floor. The decoration is recent and the lobby very nice to meet up before heading out to explore. Everyone is friendly and helpful and the desk staff organised a car to take us to the airport at a very reasonable price which saved us having to take our chances getting a cab in the rush hour. The hotel is very centrally located half a block from Times Square and a subway hub. I will certainly stay here on my next trip.

I had a very nice room and bath. It was clean some nice touches like (2) USB ports and (2) plugs at each night stand and the desk. It had a refrigerator, Microwave, coffee maker, and safe. The room was clean and clean smelling not overpowering like some can be. This was a pleasant surprise. I will use this property again if i ever need to be in this area. Got a stamp for the parking garage that made it only $26.00 for 24 hrs. This is the best lodging value I have found in New York City. If I come back with my wife, I will ask for a room with a view on the front side. The breakfast was limited, but OK. The soda machine did not work. Had to go out on the street to get a water.

Very good location in the heart of Manhattan. Staff was friendly. Place was clean. Nice breakfast bar so that helps with the budget. I would definitely stay here again. Room had microwave, small fridge and coffee maker.

We stayed in this hotel for 6 nights and could not fault it. It is not the height of luxury but if you are looking for a clean, affordable accommodation that is central to everything, I would highly recommend.This Hotel is 100 yards from Times Square yet there is very little noise. It is clean and staff are helpful. You also get a free continental breakfast. There are numerous Deli's nearby if you want something more substantial.

This hotel was fairly priced and located less than a block from Times Square. It was small, clean, and the people were very nice. Considering how close it was to Times Square, it wasn't really very noisy and we had a great night's sleep. Highly recommend for a short stay in NYC!

This is a great budget hotel right off off Times Square. It is not luxury by any means, but a great place to rest your head. Room was very small, but already booked for my next trip to NYC. Breakfast offered was so so. It was nice they validated parking across the street for $26, a steal in NYC. We were able to check in at 11AM, but they also have a luggage storage room in case your room was unavailable.

Easy to find. V close to Times Square. Arrived before the 3pm check in but we were checked in early with no problem. Room, initially, felt small, but was plenty big enough for us. Bed- so comfortable, mmmmmmmm. Bathroom- plenty of hot water and a decent size. I would’ve preferred bath sheets, but I’m fat and bath towels were too small. Breakfast was good- bagels, bread, jams, fruit, coffee, tea and juice. I think I saw eggs too. Staff- excellent.I will come here again.

Saturday 01/20/18 we stayed at The Broadway at Times Square Hotel and a pipe burst in the ceiling at 3am while we were sleeping. The water was leaking on the bed as well as our belongings. It took the staff over an hour to move us to a different room, & they charged my card not only the full amount but an additional $25 that was not listed. After 2 emails and 4 phone calls they said they're generously giving us 20% off and we're lucky because they moved us to a bigger room. I'll be filing a complaint with the better business bureau.

I had a great time staying here! Easy to check in. Even though check in wasn’t until 3pm I was there at 11am but they kept my bags for me so I could explore the city, and even then i still checked in early at 1pm!The room wasn’t big but was everything I needed as someone who was spending a lot of time exploring and just using the room for sleep; comfortable double bed, TV, shower etc. The staff were very friendly and when I booked a taxi on my last day they were more than happy to help, booking it for 7pm and then very kindly allowing me to change it to 3pm when I can back early from my trip. You do need to leave a $10 deposit and then the rest of my journey was $55.The location is the big seller for this hotel though. Right off of Times Square, EVERYTHING is easy to get to. I saw five broadway shows during my 3 day stay, as well as Radio City Hall and Rockefeller Center, and could walk to all within 5 mins. The Empire State Building and Grand Central Station were about a 15 minute walk away and I only had to get the subway to get to Brooklyn or to Statue of Liberty.I would 100% stay here again.Note: do not allow your taxi taking you to the hotel to be confused with the hotel on the next street “Hotel @ Times Square”. The similar name cause confusion on the way in and due to NYC traffic and my 2 large bags it added 20mins onto my journey plus an angry taxi driver, even though it was only the next street!

We stayed at the Broadway at Times Square on October 24th and 25th 2017. The hotel is very close to Time Square and the staff was very friendly and helpful. We got our two day bus passes at the hotel for a cheaper price than purchasing from the vendors on the street. The hotel is located about 100 yards off of time square. The hotel offers breakfast which is good but has limited items. There is a deli across the street and a TGIF Fridays a couple doors down from the hotel. The hotel offers a clean, friendly and affordable place to stay when visiting New York for Broadway shows or site seeing. The hotel will help set up shuttle service to and from the airports if needed. The rooms were clean and the beds were comfortable. We enjoyed our stay at the Broadway Times Square and will stay at this hotel again in the future. Location, Location Location !!!!!

We stayed at this hotel for 6 nights earlier this month. It was a basic smallish room, but was comfy and warm and exactly what we needed for our stay. The included breakfast was great as it included toast, bagels, cereal, fruit, doughnuts, yoghurts, eggs, coffee, tea, juice etc. so plenty to see us through until lunch. The hotel is in the perfect location, just a 30 second walk to Times Square and 5 minutes to the Rockefeller centre. Very close to subway stations and bus stops too. There is a great little deli across the road and an abundance of different shops/restaurants/cafes/diners all within a 5 minute walk. Surprisingly it wasn't too noisy, we heard the occasional siren, but didn't expect it to be silent given how close we were to Times Square. The hotel staff were very helpful and organised us a cab back to the airport for our flight, much easier than trying to get a yellow taxi at 7 on a Sunday morning! The only downsides were the towels were on the small side and the bathroom got cold pretty quick, but we worked out just to leave the door open - no more chilly Showers! Would definitely stay here again as it ticked all the boxes for a great price!
user_name:
JennieH564
Bury St. Edmunds, United Kingdom

review_body: Very good location. Great value. Rooms are small but not as small as I expected. Staff was friendly. Breakfast included good assortment of foods. Nothing fancy but not too shabby. I would stay here again without hesitation. Clean rooms also.

All the important checkboxes were ticked during our stay in Jan 18. The hotel staff were super helpful on arrival and ensured a cot (crib) was delivered and set up in our room. The room was super spacious for NYC and super clean. Everything (except a mini fridge) you need was provided, if you were to have an extended stay there was also plenty of space to unpack your suitcase!! Breakfast was included and had more inclusions than you would expect (coffee, juice, baked goods, yogurt, eggs... etc.). The location is fabulous, literally moments from the centre of Times Square! Highly recommend this hotel. Oh; and most importantly it could be the most comfortable bed I have ever slept on!

The hotel is in a great location just off of Times Square. You're not far from anything and the subway is only 2 minutes away if you need to go further afield. The hotel itself is bang average. The rooms are basic but our bed was king size and very comfy and we had a fridge and microwave. The staff were very friendly and incredibly helpful, generally able to direct you anywhere and answer any question and the housekeeper was absolutely lovely!The flaws that were a bit of a problem for us were the single-glazed windows and the breakfast. As we stayed during the coldest January America had seen for 25 years, the single glazing did little to hold in any heat and if the heating went off for just a minute, the room would instantly get draughty and cold. The breakfast was basically bagels, doughnuts and cereal, so if you're looking for a full breakfast spread, I would go elsewhere. On the first day, the butter we got from the counter top smelt and tasted a bit cheesy, but the day after we got it from the fridge and it was fine. The final flaw would be the noise. My boyfriend and I are heavy sleepers so managed to fall asleep to it just fine but I can imagine for lighter sleepers, the sound of sirens going past at all hours of the night and morning (not helped by the single-glazing) would not be ideal. Altogether, a decent hotel if you're just looking for a place to sleep. Friendly staff but needs a few tweaks.

Just a place to get a good nights sleep. No ambiance but a good bed in a clean (but small) room. Clean and quiet. Great location with deli and Irish pub across street and church next door. Right at Times Square and Broadway. Staff friendly and price very reasonable for NY. We’ll be back

we have been here a couple of times and would come back. Rooms are small but clean. Bed good. Staff helpful and friendly. No complaints. Great location if want to be near theaters. Easy walk to subway for other activities. our room had a bath tub which is great to soak in after walking all day. breakfast is decent. coffee available all day.

My adult daughter and I stayed at this hotel for four nights while we were in town to see shows at Madison Square Garden in mid-November. I visit NY often and have stayed at several other midtown hotels (i.e., Michelangelo, The London, Helmsley Parklane, Essex House, Hilton) so I have a reasonable basis for comparison and found The Broadway at Times Square to be an excellent value. The common area and our room were immaculate, the staff was friendly and courteous and the location was perfect! We had a corner king room on the 3rd floor overlooking 46th street. It was small but adequate for our needs and we were just steps from Times Square, Radio City, Rockefeller Plaza, shopping, and many restaurants (highly recommend Havana Central which is just a couple of doors down from the hotel). Madison Square Garden was an easy 10-15 minute walk from the hotel. There is a business center in the lobby where you can use the computer to print boarding passes and the desk clerk arranged sedan service back to JFK for us at a flat rate of $65 which was very convenient. Overall, we had a great experience and I would not hesitate to stay here again. An excellent, budget friendly hotel!

All the staff were very friendly, even the waiter in the breakfast room. The hotel is just a few steps from Times Square and the subway system. Down the street is a fun Cuban restaurant which should be on your list, anyway. Bathroom was very clean with plenty of towels and washcloths. One problem is that the heater/AC faced the side of the bed so constantly blew onto me during the night. Having the bed positioned on a different wall would definitely improve the comfort.

This was my second stay at Broadway @ Times Square, and I'll definitely be coming back. It's the perfect hotel for short trips to NY centered around the Broadway district. Every theater is walkable, which is especially great at night when others are trying to hail taxis or catch Ubers.Pros: CLEAN rooms, shower was high enough for people who are 6 feet tall and also clean, great location (a block from Times Square), coffee machine in the room, decent light breakfast available for free, rooms are usually a better price than anything comparable in the area, lots of outlets and charging spots available in the room on tables & desks, plenty of good lighting in the room (overhead and lamps), and a comfortable bed.Cons (none of these are show-stoppers...if you're staying more than a couple of days, they might add up):Small rooms and hallways, not all rooms have refrigerators and microwaves (mine didn’t!), only one slow elevator, my room only had a desk chair--no other chair, lobby was not very comfortable or inviting, paper-thin walls (if you’re unlucky, you’ll have lots of people letting their room doors slam shut, and you’ll hear every one), bathrooms have shower gel dispensers instead of actual soap.WIll I be back next time I'm seeing a few Broadway shows? Absolutely!

the hotel was clean, but had an old smell which gave me concerns on the cleanliness, not sure how often they clean the carpet or drapes, didn't mind it being older and it was an excellent location to times square and all the theatres, the breakfast was nice and the staff friendly, I work at a hotel and wanted to take the cover off their ac/heater unit to check to see if they clean the filters, also, they might want to change their cleaning products to something that smells better, I couldn't get the internet the first night I was there because I was on the back side of the building, they moved me the next day to the front side and it worked.

If you are visiting New York , this location is ideal. Times Square is a 5 minute walk, where you find the TKT's booth and many theatres in either direction. Along with hoards of people.We had a 5 night stay here in mid November. The staffs friendliness was apparent from the offset . Given queen room 700 , which although compact and dated, ( the paint work could do with being freshened up and the carpets could be brighter. ) it was ample for the short time we were going to be in it. The room was extremely quiet, no street noise and warm . Too warm , as we had to turn the A/c heating off. The room had ample storage with a safe , coffee and tea maker, iron & board, very comfortable bed and if you wanted, the linen and towels would be changed daily. The bathroom which was large enough, had a low bath with shower and dispensers for shampoo, shower gel, soap and body lotion. There was also a diffused night light incorporated in the hairdryer, great for reducing disturbance if visiting the bathroom through the night.  A nice little feature was the cube clock, with 2 USB ports and 2 A/c outlets. The room door with keyless access, had a deadlock and security door stop.  In the evening, we were always met by a security guard at the entrance. The elevator was not the quickest, sometimes you had to wait couple of minutes , as it served all 9 floors and lower level. The floor tiles down the staircase were immaculately clean as was the reception area, an achievement in its self.  Down in the lobby is a business centre with 2 computers, printer and fax. Also next to reception is a small fitness centre, with cold water dispenser and cups. Free Daily papers are also available here.  The breakfast area is kept clean and well stocked by a very helpful Jovianne, who works tirelessly to ensure his guests know how things work and what is available. Mainly breads, cereals, bagels, eggs , yoghurts, fruits and refreshments. Enough to set you up for the morning.  For getting about, the Orange line subway is 1 block up on 47th Ave , a 200 metres walk from the hotel, this will take you to Central station; where you can access all lines. There are some great little bars for food and drink on E 44th Ave, we used O' Donohues, the staff came over more friendly than some and they remembered you! Finally after storing our luggage until mid afternoon , reception pre booked a private taxi to the airport , a flat rate of $ 65 . Well done to all concerned for making our stay memorable and pleasurable!

Clean rooms and common areas. Very near Times Square and the aggitation of the streets. It has irish pubs and restaurants near by. The cost of these restaurants is above average but if you walk West bound you can find more restaurants. The hotel includes a nice breakfast.

Previous Tripadvisor reviews and favorable rates caused me to stay here for a recreational weekend. It is a semi-modern, clean, boutique hotel with one person at the front desk and another as a combination bellhop/doorman. The staff were bright and courteous. The free continental breakfast of hard-boiled eggs, cereal, bagels and donuts was adequate. The coffee seemed to be always available; and rooms had a refrigerator, microwave, safe, TV and adequate shower. The location is both in the middle of the action, yet on a relatively quiet block. I asked for a quiet room and was offered a rear room on the second floor, which was both quiet and convenient to the lobby without needing to rely on the hotel's only elevator, which might have been a frustrating factor if I had stayed on a higher floor. This property is a great option for a recreational trip to the Midtown/Theater district. It is not a 4 or 5 star property, but it because of the location, service, cleanliness and value, I am comfortable rating it a SOLID 4 stars

This hotel has everything you need. A substantial breakfast, pleasant staff, location perfect. I like the fact they have computers there if you need to print anything off like tickets.On top of this it was very quiet considering it is just round the corner from the hub of Times Square. Would definitely return

We booked 2 rooms with 2 double beds in, the check in was swift with pleasant staff. The rooms were tired and in need of updating but they were very clean and comfortable. The bed was divine, so comfy and the bed linen was fresh and crisp. The location is superb, literally a 5 minute walk to Times Square. The free breakfast is a really good touch, fresh donuts, muffins, bagels, bananas and yogurts. There’s a toaster and tea/coffee/juice available. All plentiful. The breakfast and reception area is very modern and newly renovated. The rest of the hotel just needs to follow then it’ll be a fab hotel. I would definitely return.

Great price for the location with a rooftop bar for your convenience!!. Centrally located and easily accessible to time square and rockefeller center. Great eats and shops nearby too. I'll be coming back. I LOVE NYC..

Let’s just get this out of the way right up front. The rooms are very small. But if you came to NYC to sit in your room, then this is not the place for you. However, if you are looking for a hotel with the perfect location for just about anything to do in Manhattan, then this is your place. The rooms are clean, the beds and bedding are nice, and the bathroom and shower are good. There is free breakfast every morning. They have both cold and hot selections of food, as well as coffee, tea, juice and milk. The staff is very friendly and has good recommendations for restaurants and entertainment. Small rooms aside, this is a nice choice for a good price in NYC.

A bit of belated review as I stayed here in August 2017. I arrived from the airport and realised I had left my bag in the shuttle bus, which had my phone, purse, passport, etc. in. The staff, especially Jack, was absolutely amazing and so helpful. They were able to contact the shuttle provider and arrange for them to bring my bag back, and Jack even walked a few blocks to meet the driver and get my bag. He went above and beyond, he was honestly a lifesaver! When we finally checked in, we weren't disappointed, the rooms were lovely and the bed was very comfy. The location could not be better, it's a minute from Times Square. Yet the rooms are so quiet you would never know how close you are! Would definitely recommend this hotel and definitely stay again.

A very convenient hotel, close to Broadway plays, great restaurants and in mid town. Easy to get to Uptown and Downtown visits via bus, subway or taxi. Small room, but ample storage with frig, microwave, safe and breakfast included. Comfortable bed, friendly and helpful staff and quiet room in back of hotel. Good location for getting around the City.

I was very happy with this hotel. Sometimes you don't know what you are going to get when you reserve a room at an unknown (to you) hotel. We were given a room at the front of the hotel overlooking the busy street, but I didn't mind at all. I was just excited to be able to be so close to Times Square. The room was a little small, but clean and adequate and the price was right. I recommend this hotel if you are looking for a hotel close to just about everything.

A quick two nights in New York worked great with the Broadway's location. Actually found it through Tripadvisor. Staff was great, helped immediately with a bag left in a cab--WINNER! Room was clean, but if you know New York, it was every bit as small as expected. But I'll take clean and functional every time, despite the only elevator being an adventure in time and space--luckily we were on the 2nd floor. Complimentary breakfast and papers made the mornings nice helped a bit with cost. If I was staying longer, I might shop the market a bit more, but "relative" price and proximity to a lot of things makes the Broadway a great find.

The hotel was very clean, the staff were very helpful, and the location was great for sightseeing. What more can you ask for in New York? The hallways are narrow for anyone with disabilities, and the rooms are typically small as you will find in the city. The bed was comfortable. I'd have no hesitation staying here again. We had great experiences using Uber or Lyft for transportation.

My family stayed at Broadway a couple of days before our cruise out of Brooklyn. Check in was easy and we were upgraded to a king bed at no extra charge. We were on the top floor with a nice view. The bed was very comfortable and very quiet. Breakfast was perfect. Times Square half a block away. Check out was easy. The only concern was the steps were very hard on my mother's knees. A ramp is really needed. But all in all we were quite pleased with our stay and highly recommend Broadway to anyone visiting New York.

We stayed for 3 nights and this hotel was situated in the perfect location. They are about a block away from Time Square, but not close enough for the "buzz" to bother.Staff are friendly and helpful. Our room and bathroom was small, but sufficient.Wi-fi works perfectly. Hotel is close to restaurants etc.Basic Continental breakfast are served which include Dunkin DonutsOnly "complaint" is the noise of the compressors. Our room was next to the building next door's compressors on their roof, so this woke us up couple of times during the night.

We stayed here for a night before our cruise out of NY. The hotel was clean, they staff was nice and friendly. It is nicely located right off times sq.. Within walking distance to everything in times sq.. The rooms are small and the view out the window looked at a brick wall. But we didn't care, because we were only sleeping there. When in NY, you don't go there to stay in a hotel room. We would stay there again.

We stayed at the Broadway at Times Square hotel for the second time in September 2017. It did hot disappoint. Great service, nice clean comfortable room and good breakfast. Excellent location just off Times Square near theater district. The staff was exceptionally helpful and friendly. Nightly price is reasonable. We'll return>

We arrived about 1 a.m., having notified the desk of our late arrival plans. When we got there, they thought they didn't have a room ready, but were going to place us elsewhere for the night, then have us move back, on their nickel. We weren't thrilled, but after more than 10 calls, the desk couldn't find another place with an opening, so they explored options within the facility. Magically, they found a room which we went to and had for the following four nights. I'm guessing someone was coming in even later than we and we ended up with the room, but I didn't ask. I didn't want to know. We had the room as planned and onward.The room was small, but comfortable. I believe, based on the map, every room is slightly different in size and shape. The bathroom is comically tiny, but works well if you are used to your partner's routine, and my wife and I have it down. All the 'stuff' worked as it should, but the smallness of the made temperature control an interesting issue. We did fine, but anticipating a quickly heating or cooling room is imperative. We had no noise issues. Breakfast was reasonable and the space was more than sufficient for the traffic. Desk help was always available and was indeed helpful. Location was the reason for our choice and it was close to Times Square, so that made us happy. There was construction on the adjoining building so navigating scaffolding was necessary every time we came in or left. We noticed the majority of folks at breakfast were European, with English, at least American English, not in the first two languages spoken. No problem, just an observation. We might try another hotel in the area next time, but we'd also be more than comfortable at the Broadway. We'd just schedule our flights differently, if possible.

Hotel was not as good as we expected When we got there at about 8pm due to the traffic as the United nations was on They had cancelled our booking and gave the room to someone else so they said They found us anouther room but it was smaller than the one we had booked The breakfast wasn't much And the room over looked the front of the hotel and was very noisy we had to buy ear plugs But the location is perfect right in the centre for everything

ProsGreat location. Broadway theaters, 6th ave restaurants, music, 5th ave stores, Times Square activities.We had a dlx rm with a king bed. Fully refurbished, 200 sqft, full bath.Good housekeeping service. I had 2 requests that were fulfilled immediately.ConsNoise isolation by the windows is not adequate and 46th st restaurants have music till 1am.

This hotel is poor for a New York hotel. The room was at the back of the hotel and despite a quiet room it was still noisy. The room was dark, in need of a deep clean on the carpets as well as the bed linen being ironed. I did actually wonder if someone had slept in the bed before me! The bathroom again was dated. Cold shower and hair (not mine) in the bath! Expensive for a hotel that ok has a great location but literally that's all you pay for.

Just returned from a week in NYC. This little gem is ideal, the breakfast is so handy and very filling, the staff are very good Jovianne, Antonio, & Garry, are extremely helpful, if I ever return to this crazy city I will be staying here again .. Donie-Jack

Booked this outstanding small hotel through an online site and was thrilled. It is truly just steps from Time Square and theaters. Room was clean and comfortable and the staff friendly. Frankly, I was super impressed as the back stairwell was spotless! Most hotels/motels have stairwells that need to be cleaned, but this hotel's is spotless. Speaks to the pride the owners have in their establishment. The breakfast is sufficient but would have been nice with hot bacon and scrambled eggs. Outstanding value for a Time Square hotel. Thanks.

My sister was visiting from Chicago so instead of taking the train an hour and a half each way from my house, we decided to spend the night in the city. We picked this hotel mostly for the price and were pleasantly surprised by the fantastic location. This place is perfect for Broadway shows-it's right around the corner from the Tkts booth. We checked in early with no problem and loved our rooms. They are compact (think cruise ship) but, everything is provided including a coffee maker and a plethora of usb ports and outlets. The room is modern and clean including the tiny bathroom. The breakfast was a nice touch - I thought the bagels were really good. We checked out and were able to store our bags for the day at no charge. Everyone we spoke with at the hotel were so nice and really went out of their way to answer our questions. I will definitely stay here again.

Not much good to say about the hotel. The lady that checked us in, a Sikh gentleman who sometimes was at the front desk, and both of the bellmen we met while staying there were nice. The lady who checked us in went out of her way to check with housekeeping when we had arrived to see if a room had been finished. The other person at the front counter when we tried checking in early took 2 seconds to look at the computer and tell us no. When we did get to the room it was underwhelming. It was "clean" but there were other issues. The one good thing is we didn't get bedbugs (which was a concern when we saw the room).While we were standing at the front counter waiting to hear about a room we noticed a sign posted that water would be off in the hotel starting at Noon that day with no end time provided. We were assured it would only be off for three hours (To be fair, this time period is between standard checkout and checkin). While waiting to get on the elevator we heard one of the front desk staff say it would be 3 or 4 hours. They then followed that with should be no more than 4 hours. We were heading out to Central Park for the afternoon so it didn't really matter too much to us but was a point of concern such that we looked for other hotels nearby to transfer too if the water was still out when we returned. The water was on when we returned but the lines had not been flushed in the rooms and the water was very, very brown and had a bit of an oder to it. We let the water run in the sink and tub for a while and it cleared fairly quickly but put us off drinking it. We went and got bottled water at Duane Reed to use for toothbrushing, contacts, and such. The room stunk of must and mildew. The AC unit smelled musty at best and like urine at the worst. If the AC unit got turned off or the temperature turned down too low the smell would get pretty bad. The carpets in the room don't look to have been steamcleaned since President Bush was in office (43 or 41, I couldn't say). The bed sheets did seem to be clean. They looked and smelled laundered and the bed was in decent shape. We didn't get bed bugs so, all in all, it was okay. The bathroom and towels were clean. We had one housekeeper the first day we stayed who was pleasant. The gal that was there the rest of the time seemed to have a perpetual frown and a matching attitude. She was NOT happy one morning at 9am when she knocked on the door wanting to clean the room. When we asked to come back later she wanted to know when we would be gone and wasn't thrilled when I gave a time range. Same with the guy down in the breakfast area. The issue with the water had put us off eating the light continental breakfast they offer and we went out for breakfast anyway but still yet another surly person. I thought we could save some money by moving from the Marriott after a conference. This will teach me to try and save a buck. You get what you pay for.

Loved hotel and Hospitality..nice free breakfast and free wifi.. Great location. Would stay again for the right price. Had an issue with my room door not locking..they couldn't fix or upgrade..but they did give me a slight discount.. Good thing room locked from inside.

We had tickets to a show and decide at the last minute to stay over in NYC (we live about 1.5 hrs away and can chose to drive home, but decide to splurge) We searched for a last minute deal and ran across this hotel. I have to say I did come on TA and read the reviews (always!) before booking, which were positive for the most part. Even so, I must say I was pleasantly surprised by the great location, clean and up to date room, free wifi, etc. Of course the room could have been bigger and more luxurious, but not at this very reasonable price point. I feel we did get more than we paid for and will come back again next time we have theater tickets. A very positive experience.

I previously posted a review of this hotel but somehow it went missing on here so I'm giving it a second go.I'll keep it brief but just to say that we travelled as a family of three in July and the transfer, by taxi from JFK took just over an hour (traffic dependant) and cost $57 and a small tip.Our room was on the 8th Floor and was more than adequately sized for the 3 of us for our 4 night stay. It was clean compact and had a safe, tea/coffee maker, hairdryer, tv and plenty of storage for clothes. You had a bath with a shower too and all your towels and toiletries also.The hotel did a continental style breakfast with everything you would expect.... croissants, cereal, doughnuts, tea, coffee, juices and boiled eggs and yoghurts etc. It was included in the price and was a very nice touch.Hotel staff that we encountered were very friendly and helpful. The front desk arranged a taxi pick up for our return to the airport so that was one thing less to worry about.The location is fantastic. Leave the hotel, turn right, walk 100 yards and bang, Times Square! From there you can either walk or get transportation (tour buses and taxis) to all the sights and attractions you don't fancy walking to.New York is amazing and we jammed in as much as we could in those four days, but as far as the hotel goes, I would not hesitate to come back and stay here. It was fabulous. Enjoy!

This is a very convenient hotel with short distance to most. The hotel is clean and with good beds, small rooms for 4 people, but after all it is Manhattan. The breakfast is decent, little variety but enough food. Service at the hotel was very good, the staff gave a lot of advice. There are several places right by the hotel for a quick and cheap dinner, if you do not want expensive restaurants every night. Recommend this hotel if you want to live easily and centrally.

Great hotel, nice rooms, aircon and fridge bathroom decent. Breakfast was great! Loads of options and the staff work really hard. Very close to Times Square if you like the hustle and bustle and very close to subway stations. Liked this place and would stay again.

Hello the hotel is very convenient in mid city, time square at the corner, restaurants, broadway, shops, coffee stores and subway right there! The staff of the hotel was very good, room are clean, wifi connection in all hotel. The breakfast is simple and the same all days (they can do better) on weekends if your room is front of the street can be a lit bit noise. Its a boutique hotel; no crowded. Best

The location is awesome, you're actually in the center of everything- 5 min. walk to Bryant park, 10 min to the Macy's, 15 min to Empire State Building etc.Stuff is friendly. Room was clean but a bit hot.Some rooms have windows with no view looking at the backside of the next building. Poor building.P.S I still haven't got the deposit I payed for the room while checking in

Right down the street from the theater, to see Hamilton, and the service was outstanding. When we had a slight issue, it was special for us, in our room, Anthony was able to take care of it instantly. Smiles all around and great staff.

I was in town to see Warpaint and I loved my little room within walking distance of the Nederlander Theater. Besides the courteous and accommodating staff, delicious continental breakfast and clean and comfortable room, I was amazed by the absolute all-night tranquility of my room. I would not hesitate to book a room at this hotel again the next time I am in Times Square.

We attended Charlie and the chocolate factory, very well performed and the stage was very well settled.We enjoyed a lot the artistic part, but what we did not like at all were the huge lines to go to restrooms or to buy a bottle of water, that was a mission.

I had stayed at their sister property The Hotel east of this hotel on 46th Street. Both hotels indicated sold out so I called the reservation number and they were able to accommodate me at this location.The staff is very nice and helpful, the location can't be beat, the rooms are clean and nicely appointed. They are very small, but all we did was sleep and shower here, then off into the city!The fee breakfast is a bit heavy on the white bread high carb offerings, but they do their best with limited space.
user_name:
Greg U
St. Paul, MN, United States

review_body: Spent 3 nights at this hotel. Chose it for decent pricing and location in the theater district. The first night was a disappointment as my wife was bitten by an insect ( looked like a deer tick ) and I found another walking on the bathroom floor. I killed it and there was blood on the floor. Spoke to the hotel manager who changed our room and game me a 10% cost reduction. The entire staff is excellent. Kudos to Julia the morning front desk clerk. She's a sweetheart. The rooms are on the small side but all I want in NYC is a clean room and a shower. At around $270 per night including taxes the Broadway is a fine choice. There is a complimentary continental breakfast. Nothing extraordinary but much cheaper than a $15 bacon & egg meal at any restaurant nearby.Had I not had the insect issue I still would grant this hotel a four star review. Would I go back? Not sure. I wanted the Edison which was fully booked and the Broadway at Times Square is a decent alternative.

We stayed here for 2 nights in June 2017. The Location is excellent, you go out the door and you're practically in Times Square. The room was small but clean. The only thing I noticed was a sort of musty smell in the corridors, which reminded me of wet carpets. We had breakfast included and found bagels, jams, cream cheese, boiled eggs, cereals and donuts. We had no view as the small window led to a sort of shaft however we booked through a third party. Wifi was great in the room as well.

Not a bad price for being 1/2 block from times square..hotel a bit dated, but clean, quiet and comfortable. Very good value for the area. It kind of reminded me of a microtel, but 6 stories of tiny. Simple but good free breakfast.

The staff was very helpful and friendly. They directed us to the parkade used by hotel guests (much cheaper than other parking), which is about 3 buildings down and across the street. The room was a decent size with a full size tub and shower and closet with a safe. Although our view happened to be a brick wall, we pretty much only slept and got ready for our next adventure anyway. The hotel is located less than a block from Time Square, tour buses, subways, restaurants, shopping and shows, but it was surprisingly quiet inside. After check out, they offered to store our luggage for the day at no charge so we could leave our vehicle in the parkade until we were ready to leave town. Overall, a great experience for our first time visiting. We will be back!

I stayed with my family at this hotel went to room , room was small but we managed . We came back late at night front door will not open called the hotel front desk no one answering the phone 20 rings. Then some one answering the phone as if he was drinking at job. Went to room around 2 am i got a knock on the door a woman there . I told her its the wrong room. She said if you need company . I said no just leave i called the front desk again no answer. I kept calling then again the same person he said he will send someone to check . Again around 3:30 am knock on the door this time a guy , I did not answer the door till he left. I went down to speak to manager i saw a couple have sex in the stairs. there was guys standing in the hallway they saw me said keep moving on or they will hurt me. I went to desk no one there . Wanted to speak to manager no manager. I kept calling after i left no call back. They know what is going on but will not call me or email me back. This is not acceptable for this place . I will be calling BBB to complain to file a report on them.

I have just come home from a 6 night stay - with my teenage daughter- at this charming hotel located in the middle of Manhattan. Close to Times Square, Broadway, almost all subways, several local busses available close by and also "hop on- hop off " busses close by. We were able to stay 6 nights due to the nice price. The staff is utterly friendly and the beds very comfortable. We slept well which is important when you have walked all over New York every day. Hotel is also in walking distance from MOMA. We were able to get tickets to a matine of " The Bronx tale" 40 pct off price, fairly good seats when ordered and paid for 45 minutes before the show started at the ticket sale at Times Square. This was actually our second stay here, as we visited NY a few years ago, and came back to same hotel due to the sweet staff and the location.

Located 1/2 block off Times Square, the Broadway is probably the best hotel deal going in that area. The rooms were clean and VERY comfortable, the staff was uber-helpful and friendly, and the location was perfect. There were restaurants (of every kind) on 46th Street (just steps away from the hotel). Also, right next door is the lovely Anglican Church of St. Mary the Virgin - gorgeous. The Broadway is your ultimate BEST BET!

My aunt booked the room for us and it was a great location in NYC. Time square, accessible for subway, a lot of people to interact with.Rooms are nice, its just very good and I cannot say any negative thing about it. Great job guys!

We booked this hotel months in advance. Did not prepay. Because this hotel was less expensive compared to other hotel prices in the same area, we were able to afford to stay 4 nights instead of 3. Upon entering we were warmly greeted. The hotel lobby and breakfast area are up to date, clean and nicely decorated. Breakfast was good, and it is included, as well as free wifi. All of the staff were so friendly and helpful! Most remembered our names, or at least our faces. We felt very safe at this hotel.The room was updated, clean and met our needs. The view, was of a wall. But, considering the price, cleanliness, breakfast and location.... we did not care, we were tired from sight seeing all day. Nice Irish Pub and a small grocery store are across the street.

I was at the Broadway at the times Square the third time and the hotel is most convenient and resonable as compared to others around the same Location .Moreover Ivionne at the Reception is very helpful and friendly, my compliments to the hotel to have such a wonderful staff.I was not getting an extension for a day through the booking sites but she kept it in mind that I had requested to stay for a day more ,and as soon as she had a cancellation she held the room for me ,saving the task to move to another hotel for a day .Thanks again for that.

The best thing about this hotel is the location for the price. Only a 3 min walk from the center of Times Square down to the street where the hotel is located. The outside of the hotel is currently undergoing some construction so you might have a bit of a hard time finding the sign of the hotel. We arrived around 11am, way too early for check in. So we waited a little bit and the staff tried her best to find us a room that was finished with housekeeping and she did! We got the king size bed room. The bed was big enough to fit 3 people. Room & restroom was on the small side and there was nothing fancy just simple but comfy. There's a few pubs right across the hotel that's open late at night!

This was our second visit to NYC and we went back to the same hotel. Both stays were delightful. The location is fantastic, right in the midst of Times Square. The rooms are very tidy, comfy and safe. While the rooms are small, it doesn't matter as we weren't there to sleep in the city that never sleeps. One great perk is the complimentary breakfast, all managed by the most delightful staff. The staff is very friendly and accommodating. When we visit NYC in the future, this will be our hotel.

This hotel was perfect for a one night stay in NYC . The proximity to Times Square and the broadway shows was excellent! The rooms are small but we had a corner room and it was fine. We also had a microwave and fridge. Bathroom was good size. The hotel was all around clean. The staff was very helpful and friendly. Breakfast was included. The breakfast room was very spacious and selections were adequate for continental style. We were able to store our luggage before checking in and after checkout. The only thing I found lacking were vending machines or a small concession to purchase bottled water etc...Would stay again!

Small hotel, good location, clean and comfortable. Excellent breakfast room with free daily breakfast. Cereals, fruit, yoghurts, juice, pastries and breads. Room can also be used at other times if you have your own food, very handy as plates, cutlery available for use. Friendly reception staff happy to answer any queries. Only negative, outside signage very small and our taxi driver had great difficulty finding hotel.

Stayed here 4 nights and had a quiet comfy room. Very close to Times Square and the subway. Felt safe and secure. In room safe and free wi-fi. Good free breakfast and coffee. Soft boiled eggs/toast/bagels/fruit/yogurt. Would stay here again.

Right on the door step of Times Square and a great place. Room was not huge and no view out window but we only wanted a room to sleep in and we had the view by exploring Manhatten itself.Staff were so friendly and helpful - nothing too much trouble. There was free wifi and facility to print documents if required. The hotel offered free continental breakfast but we never took advantage of this. The room was spotlessly clean and fresh clean towels daily. Large king size bed which was comfortable. There was an iron and ironing board in your room and a free safe along with a tv and tea/coffee making facilities. Usual bathroom toiletries in the bathroom also along with wall mounted hairdryer.You are right in Times Square and fab. Bars/restaurants across from the hotel too if you don't want to walk far from the hotel. We asked re transport to JFK airport and a private car picked us up at time arranged for set price of $65 - we left the hotel at 4pm on a Friday and it took a good hour and half in busy traffic - worth every penny as didn't fancy battling through crowds with 4 bags to catch public transport.Would definitely return to this hotel if we ever return to New York.

Broadway at Times Square at 129 West 48th St is one of four boutique hotels by Apple Core hotels. Stayed the week of May 9, 2017. Small rooms but very adequate. Queen sized beds were wonderfully comfortable.Well maintained facility,free Internet, helpful staff. Breakfast included. Reasonably priced.The location is excellent, just a few blocks to Times Square, theaters, restaurants, etc. Also very close to both the Times Square and 49th Street Subway entrances. A real find in this busy and expensive city!

One of those hotels where everything just WORKS! Someone with a great hotel brain has ensured that the little things are all taken care of ... the USB plugs by each bedside ... small plastic cups in the bathroom ... place for your bag etc etc.Couldn't recommend it more highly.!

The location is hard to beat as it literally takes you a couple of minutes to be standing dead center Times Square. For the area the price was also pretty good and they had a free continental breakfast in the mornings. The gentleman who worked the desk in the morning and early afternoons was quite nice, remembered our name and on the last day when we need a car to the airport he took care of it for us. My only complaint and it is more because it just wasnt expected was the size of the rooms. I knew it wasnt good when the elevator door opened and the opposite wall was literally 3 ft away. We had a hard time making the turn out of the elevator into the hallway, with our suitcases, were you are meet by a door as soon as you make that turn. The hallways were one way streets and when we opened the door to the room it was no better, as it was tiny. I think if you get the ones with a king bed they are bigger (they have to be a king bed wouldn't fit in our room) so make sure you reserve a king bed. You had a bed and enough space to walk around it and that was about it. But in its defense I will say it was clean, the bed was ok and when you are in NY its not like you stay in your room anyway! So for the price and location I can live with the room size!

You're in the heart of Times Square at this small, clean hotel. Staff is helpful and efficient. Rooms aren't big but big enough and comfortable. Basic continental breakfast, but free breakfast is rare in New York so can't complain.

I have stayed here many times and will do so in future. It is my best-kept secret. I have stayed in many grand, expensive, inexpensive and mid-range hotels, Guesthouses and B&Bs all over the world. If you are on a tight budget in NYC and you are looking for great value, excellent service and location, this is it! It's small and quiet and I prefer it this way. It has everything I want and more and it is budget-friendly!

I did so much research on which hotel to stay at for my 5 day trip to NYC. We wanted to be centrally located in Times Square but not pay a crazy price. I feel we made a fantastic choice!In doing my research, I didn't find many hotels that offer free continental breakfast and this one does. Granted, it was VERY basic. Lots of carbs and not much else but it was free and gave us a start to the day. White bagels, white bread, donuts, muffins, waffles, 2 cereals, yogurt, hard boiled eggs, watered down juice, apples and bananas. It was ok. But again, it was free. Would have been great to change up the fruit options like maybe oranges one day. Also, maybe some whole wheat options instead of just white bread everyday.Also, we really wanted our room to have 2 beds and many of the options only had 1 Queen or King bed. This hotel had 2 beds so that was another plus.Everything was clean and updated. The lobby was pretty contemporary. Our room was small but livable. Most of the room was filled up by the 2 beds. But they still squeezed in a table w/ TV and a desk and chair.The location is fantastic. 1/2 block from Times Square. But at night, trying to go to sleep, you wouldn't know it. I never heard a thing. Never had a hard time falling asleep. Absolutely no view out the window but who cares. We were only in the room to sleep. The view was of the wall of the neighboring building.We arrived a little early before check in time and our room wasn't ready so they had a guy to help check your bags into a storage room until the room was ready. That way we could head out into the city to explore a bit and then come back later to settle into our room.There was a little sign in the bathroom to hang your towel up if you didn't want it washed or put it on the floor if you did want it washed. So the first morning, we left our towels hung up so we could save water by reusing them. We returned to the hotel later that day to our towels missing and replaced by new folded ones. Why put a sign that says what to do if you are just going to replace them everyday? This happened each day even though we followed the instructions to hang them up.There is shampoo and shower gel in the shower. Only thing is that the shampoo was so liquidy/runny that I would squirt it in my hand and it would run off into the tub before I could get my hand to my head. Maybe the hotel should invest in a little higher quality shampoo.All the staff we encountered were friendly. Ran into the cleaning ladies a few times and they chatted with us and were very friendly. Made sure we had everything we needed. The guys at the front desk were very helpful. They helped us get a taxi to the airport the day we departed. There were a few times where multiple people were at the desk needing help and they managed the crowd well.Overall, this hotel was perfect for us. We didn't need anything fancy. Something affordable (for Times Square NY standards), clean and great location. This hotel met ALL my expectations.

Ewww.I'm literally writing this review from inside the second room I've been in at this hotel today. They first put me in room 402, and you could smell nothing but mildew in the room. I asked for a new room, and they obliged, moving me to 607. Initially, that was better. You couldn't smell the mold when you walked into the room.But heck...sit close to the bathroom (the rooms are small; you're going to sit close to the bathroom) and that's literally all you can smell.This place is pretty gross. There's no two ways about it. For $225/night, this place is worthless.
user_name:
enokimushroom
New York City, New York

review_body: Had a great 11 night stay at Broadway @ Times Square ,end of April beginning of May, arrived at 2am in the morning and was able to get straight into our room.The hotel staff were great Jovannie and Ivonne on reception were so helpful with queries we had , and Anton? was also very helpful in the breakfast room , keeping it well stocked and was great to be able to get a coffee anytime . Debbie in housekeeping always had a smile for us and the rooms were spot on.Plenty of choice for breakfast . Great location so handy for walking everywhere and close to subway.

Definitely not what I expected for a hotel in Times Square. The room we stayed in was small, outdated, and dusty, and dirty. Our room faced a brick wall and the room was super dark. The breakfast area was very simple filled with donuts, coffee, bagels, cereal, and waffles. The staff was always friendly and helpful. Jovanni was very very very friendly and always had a smile on his face. I witnessed how he was surrounded by several people at once and he stayed calm and friendly- helping one at time including myself.

I have stayed at the Broadway at Times Square Hotel in the last year. very good.stays The rooms are small but very comfortable The hotel is clean, safe, and Just 2 minutes from time square our luggage was properly stored and secured while we went out to enjoy NEW YORK CITY

We were met upon arrival with friendly, helpful staff. We were a bit early for check-in so our luggage was properly stored and secured while we went out to enjoy NEW YORK CITY!!! They provided very nice breakfast selections, along with protein bars and coffee on the go! We walked almost everywhere, as the location is excellent!! When it was time to check-out they had transportation waiting for us; which was so much better than the scary taxi ride we had on the way in from the airport! Would stay there again! Price quite affordable.

My wife and I have stayed twice at the Broadway at Times Square Hotel in the last year. Both stays were very good. The hotel is clean, safe, and incredibly convenient. The rooms are small but very comfortable. The breakfast is basic but good - coffee is hot and plentiful, bagels are some of the best around, the staff works hard to keep things well stocked and nice. The staff are always friendly, helpful and courteous. This is a good place to stay in Times Square.

Hotel is very close to Time Square so location is perfect. Hotel is clean and very comfortable but our room was very dark - there was a small window but through our window we saw the wall. The staff is very nice and helpful. It was a nice weekend. :D Good place to stay!

Small but friendly hotel. Superbly placed for Times Square, the theatres and sightseeing buses.Our room was spacious, had good amenities and was clean and comfortable. The breakfast is ample with lots of choice.Very friendly staff. We would definitely stay here again.

We have just returned from a stay of five nights, and we loved this hotel. The staff are very friendly and helpful. Breakfast is included and is a great start to the day. The rooms are clean and the bed was really comfortable. The location of the hotel is excellent. If we return to New York we would not hesitate to stay again.

Four of us (two couples) have just returned from here. Our friends booked it and it was a great choice. Only 30 seconds walk from Times Square, 5 mins from the Rockefeller, 5 mins grand central, 2 mins 5th Ave, 10 mins ESB. The price was very good for this location, free wifi throughout, free continental breakfast inc' eggs and porridge. Tea/coffee available free 24/7. Anthony looks after breakfast, a lovely guy from Poland. Please take time to have a chat with him and don't be tight with the tips! You're saving $20 a day in breakfast compared to most hotels! The reception staff were also helpful, friendly and efficient. The hotel is clean and the maids will change your beds daily if you wish. There is a TGI's next door, Irish pub opposite. To say the hotel is only yards from Times Square it's remarkably quiet. I've only been home 10 hours and am missing it already!

This was the perfect hotel for us! I cannot even begin to tell you how great the location of this hotel is if you are seeing a Broadway show, wanting to hang around Times Square, or shop on 5th Ave. The convenience of this location contributed to us having such a great few days in NYC. We stayed in room 706. This is a King room with a fridge and microwave. The room is small by American standards and large for European standards. This was not an issue for us at all because we were out of our room more than in. Our view looked out to a church steeple and some entertaining pigeons. Our water pressure was great. The water never got cold. Our AC worked perfectly. The TV was nice with sufficient channels. The room was clean. Was this a five star hotel? No. Was this a clean and pleasant place for me to sleep while seeing NYC? You bet! The price for where you are staying and what you get can't be beat. The breakfast consisted of cereals, doughnuts, toast, bagels, apples, bananas, waffles, coffee, and juices. The breakfast attendant couldn't have been nicer (don't forget to tip). Breakfast started at 6:30 am. It went through 10 or 10:30, I can't remember which. The front desk staff members were also more than helpful. They were very pleasant and eager to please. They answered several questions I had about attractions and directions. I was able to store my luggage on check-out day without a fee. There are two computers for customer use in the lobby with a printer. I was able to check-in to our airline and print our boarding passes before leaving. There is one elevator that was fairly efficient for the most part. There are several pubs close by. There is a TGIFriday's next door. We were there for Hamilton and we could honestly see the Hamilton marquis from our hotel steps. Awesome trip. Would stay here again.

Hotel was nice in a great area. Down 1 block from Times Square. Staff was very nice and friendly. Rooms are very small. We had 3 people in the room and had to arrange it to fit all the luggage and stuff to make sure to get around. The breakfast was ok. I only ate it 1 day we we're there. Alot of homeless people near the hotel at night.

The room was small, but that's expected. One oddity was that there was a cabinet in place for a microwave and mini-fridge, but neither were there. The cabinet, however, remained, and took up precious square footage. If they're not going to provide the appliances, then remove the cabinet! Breakfast (provided) was fine, nothing great but nice to have.

I brought my 15 year old daughter to NYC for spring break and had never stayed in the city before. The hotel was perfect - great location within half a block of Times Square. The staff was so helpful from the front desk, to the wonderful gentlemen who helped me with my luggage coming and going. I will definitely stay here again. Thank you!!

The location of this hotel is just off of Times Square and strangely quite considering it's location. The staff were all helpful and friendly and the room comfortable. The windows open which is always a plus. The breakfast is bland but ok and fills a gap.The room calculated to roughly £200 a night though which we found pricey. However, I guess you pay for the location

My family and I arrived at 1am and were told that they did not have a room for us anymore (despite having a guaranteed reservation). They booked us in a lousy hotel in Korea town who only had a king size bed for us. Now that's what I call customer service.

Had checked this hotel on line as it looked close for the show we were going to attend.WONDERFULLY surprised how convenient it was to everything. Jovannie Juha checked us in, was very helpful and extremely pleasant as was everyone we encountered at this property. Hotel was very clean and welcoming. Would definitely stay here again and highly recommend to anyone wanting to be near the theatre district. ALSO....it was super quiet for being so close to Times Square. AAA+++

The room was small and claustrophobic. Thank goodness I was only there for a night and spent as little time as possible there. The 2 small windows had signs saying 'do not open'! The view looked like a wall. The TV didn't work - only audio, no picture. The bathroom in the lobby that I used was interestingly very nice. The only nice thing about the hotel.

Booked this hotel with Travelocity after reading the great reviews. We were not disappointed! The Broadway is located half a block from Times Square, a very short walk. So much to see and do in that area. Perfect for Broadway shows nearby, lots of restaurants, subway and many Tourist attractions. We stayed at the Broadway for one week. From the time we walked into the lobby to the time we departed, we felt comfortable and welcomed. The staff at the Broadway is so friendly and helpful. From the staff at the front desk to the staff cleaning rooms, they were all friendly. The hotel is very clean, smells good and the continental breakfast was great. Fresh bagels, donuts, breads, oatmeal, fresh fruit, yogurt, waffles and pancakes and more. We especially loved Antonio, our breakfast server that took care of everything there. He made sure everyone got what they needed and so very friendly! Thank you Antonio for starting our day with your wonderful smile! Our room was just right for the two of us. It was clean, the bed was very comfortable. Yes, there was noise from the outside road but its New York and they honk their horns all the time! You just get used to it. We will definitely come back and highly recommend the Broadway at Times Square Hotel. Thanks also to Jovannie for all your help and advice, another great employee from the wonderful staff.

This was a trip to celebrate mine and my friend's 50th birthdays and our daughters 18th's, and after reading reviews about hotels in New York I have to admit I wasn't expecting much. However, I needn't have worried, this hotel was excellent. We booked two rooms and both were spacious, very clean, and even though right by Times Square and all the hustle and bustle of New York, surprisingly quiet. The staff were excellent and very friendly. Breakfast was included and was more than adequate and a very welcome addition, especially considering the price of eating out in New York.I cannot praise this hotel enough and will be recommending to anyone who will listen!! Excellent location close to everything, reasonably priced, clean, good sized rooms and friendly helpful staff, what more could you want? Even the taxi they arranged for the return trip to the airport must have had the nicest taxi driver ever!! If your considering this hotel just book it, you won't be disappointed.

The room was decently sized for Manhattan. No doors banging into furniture, it had a decent desk, microwave, & a mini fridge. The bathroom was clean and had good pressure. The staff was pleasant and helpful. The included continental breakfast had everything you need to get started. It is right next to Times Square. That means it will potentially be loud 24 hours a day. If you can't handle that or if you can't sleep with earplugs, then don't stay in this area. The room door is not very tight, so light leaked in at night. It wasn't enough to keep me up or bother me, but you might be different. The wifi isn't the best, but it is included. I had to reset my adapter several times because the gateway flaked out and required us to reconnect. All in all, a solid hotel if you're staying near Times Square.

My daughter and I just spent five nights at this hotel on a mother-daughter get-away for spring break. We had a room on the seventh floor, with a queen bed. If I have to say anything negative about the room, it is that it was very small, but we really weren't spending much time in the room anyway, so it made very little impact on our overall enjoyment of this trip. On the plus side, the staff at this hotel are wonderful - everyone always had a smile on their face and a friendly greeting. The front desk staff were always ready to offer a hand with anything we needed and generally everyone was very accommodating. The breakfast that is included in the room was a huge plus, as we found NYC to be quite expensive for restaurant eating. It is stated to be a continental breakfast, but we found it to be ample, with lots of choices from fresh fruit and yogurt, to boiled eggs, to waffles and pancakes, and, our favourite, amazing bagels. The rooms, though small, were very clean and the bed was quite comfortable, with good pillows. There is also a safe in the room for our passports and other things that we didn't want to carry with us all the time. The fitness room looked good, although we didn't use it, and the business centre, which is also complimentary, was very handy for booking some sights and tours in advance and printing off our tickets. Add to this the location, which allowed us to walk to almost all of the sights and theatres that we went to. I wouldn't hesitate to book this hotel again for our next trip to NYC.

We stayed for two nights at Broadway at Times Square and were pleased with our choice. The biggest pro - the location! Literally steps away from Times Square and the theater district, as well as the subway. We were on the 6th floor and were shocked at how quiet our room was, given how close to the hustle and bustle the hotel is. Second pro - two queen beds.Most NYC hotels seemed to have plenty of rooms with two full beds, but this was one of the few that had queens, which was necessary for our family of four to sleep comfortably. Third pro - the breakfast. While not fancy necessarily, there were plenty of simple, filling options that saved us an estimated $20-$30, had we ordered those same options at a restaurant. The decor is old school hotel versus a more trendy look, but the rooms are clean and comfortable. As other reviewers have mentioned, the rooms are small - but what rooms aren't in NYC? We found the hotel to be a solid value for the money spent.

I have stayed at this hotel twice now and won't stay anywhere else. I ask for a quiet room and thats what I get. No view but I get the best sleep. Good mattress & pillows no outside noise. Coffeemaker in room and all employees are friendly and helpful.

room is small, but well priced for such a good location. Everything was clean and comfortable. Lots of restaurants (and Times Square) nearby. Short walk to corner parks and subway and Grand Central. Receommended

A friend and I stayed here for 4 nights in November 2016. It is in an excellent location, just a minute's walk to Times Square. Whilst it is very central we had no problem with noise at night.The room itself was really good, USB charging ports, TV in room and the room was a decent size with plenty of storage. The bathroom was also a good size with hairdryer and a shower over the bath.The breakfast was pancakes, waffles, cereal etc. The dining room and lobby looked recently refurbished and there was also a small gym available if you felt walking around the city all day was not exercise enough!The reception staff were helpful and booked us on a day shopping trip.If I return to NY I would not hesitate to book this hotel again.

I have no idea why this hotel is a two star hotel. It should be a 3 at least! The room is a bit small (to be expected in NYC) but there's everything you could need and it's very clean. The staff is very attentive. I took my niece for a quick getaway to see theater and was extremely happy with our choice of hotel. The best location we could have asked for!What a good value!

The hotel is a great location if you want to be at the heart of Manhattan. It's right near all the Broadway theaters, shopping, restaurants and bars. The hotel itself is clean, neat and the staff is more than accommodating. They also offer a voucher for the parking lot across the street for $26 for 24hrs if you choose just an overnight visit like we did. The rooms were a little small but clean.I would recommend this hotel to anyone who is visiting New York city.

My mom and I recently stayed here, and this was a great find, with a friendly staff. Our room was nice, of course on the smaller side as is pretty standard in NYC hotels, but the fridge and microwave was a great perk (only in certain rooms), and we had a nice view. The wifi worked very well throughout our stay. Also liked the complimentary daily breakfast. Only suggestion would be to look into possibly adding a 2nd elevator, although the wait was not too long since the hotel didn't seem to be at capacity during our stay. But I think that would be helpful. Otherwise I'd definitely recommend this hotel.
user_name:
missddc
New York City, New York

review_body: My favorite part about this hotel was the excellent parking deal they have with the parking garage across the street. It's only $26 for 24 hours, which I think especially for this location is an amazing deal. The hotel is right in Times Square, so the location is perfect also. The staff was extremely friendly and helpful - and I mean everyone from the people at the front desk to the people working in the breakfast area. I don't know about their rates for the rest of the year, but I thought the price per night was great, especially since it also includes breakfast (which is also decent - toast, bagels, waffles, pancakes, cereal, so plenty of options). The size of our room was good considering it's New York City, but we had a king bed, so I'm not sure if all rooms are like that. We had no concerns regarding the cleanliness, although overall aspect is a little dated. I would come back to this hotel.

If you are in New York to see a show, this is a great place to stay. Front desk and housekeeping staff were extremely friendly and we were able to check in 3 hours early. Convenient location and very clean. Room was not spacious but certainly had everything we needed. Would return.

This lovely hotel is perfectly situated just a couple of minutes from Times Square and close to all the other usual tourist haunts. We asked for a quiet room and were duly obliged with no traffic noises being heard at all (no views either of course but what are you going to see anyway!!). The room was smallish (most NYC rooms are) but it was well equipped with a bath/shower, very comfy bed, coffee machine etc etc. Breakfast is included and we dined on waffles, pancakes and doughnuts (not very healthy) every morning and the breakfast "man" was absolutely lovely, as were all the staff. There's a gym (we never used it!!), free wi-fi in the rooms and a computer in the lobby. The cleaning staff were also great and there's a handy luggage room were you can safely leave your luggage on your final day. Highly recommended.

Why one star? 2 weeks have gone since I left NYC and here I am checking my account only to be surprised that they charged me another $250++I have now been charged on my card a total of $850++ for a 3 night stay considering that it's should just be $150++ a night at most. The hotel itself is in a block right next to Times Square. Perfect location. Rooms are okay, clean and with comfy beds. One tiny elevator, I can't imagine how it is on busy days but happy to be lucky to be there when it wasn't busy.I give this hotel one star rate because money is important and if they charge you irresponsibly, that's just not acceptable. I do not recommend any hotel that robs you.Be warned and be careful using your card when booking/staying at this hotel.

Hotel clean and well located. Typical size for NYC. A bit smaller than your "normal" room. Staff in housekeeping were wonderful . That said we were here during a blizzard and were met prior to the weather by a desk clerk who said he wasn't coming to work during the weather!? Made me feel very welcome....NOT! Then we we checked out 4 days later my rate had been increased from $159 to $210 for the last two nights. This wasn't what I was quoted. I could have stayed at a nicer hotel for those rates!!! Very disappointed.

Although we didn't really get a good view of NYC from this hotel, it was ideal from what we wanted for the holiday. We were pleased to see that the location of the hotel is very close to times sq and within walking distance to Central Park & Rockefeller and Empire State. We barely had to get transport! Great location with some good restaurants around & the breakfast was ideal for something quick! The room was lovely and equipped with everything we needed, although we wasn't in the room much! Definitely recommend this hotel to anyone looking to do the tourist bits of NYC as it is very close to everything!

I came to NYC with my partner to see Hamilton at the Richard Rodgers. Since the tickets were so expensive, we needed a moderately priced hotel to balance the budget, but wanted to be near Times Square. This hotel met all expectations. It was a smaller hotel that is literally a block from the Richard Rodgers- you can see Times Square from the entrance of the building when there isn't construction going on next door. The room was NYC sized, and we did not have a view from the window (it was just brick outside). However, this is balanced by its proximity to everything- Times Square, Rockefeller Center, Grand Central, and train/subway lines all around it. It could not be more convenient for a trip to NYC. We were able to leave our stuff in the room and pop in if we needed anything without going out of our way. The front desk staff was great. They were very kind and accommodating and after the first day recognized my partner and I and greeted us on our return. The maintenance guy was a bit grumpy when we needed help in our room (the bathroom window didn't shut all the way, and in the middle of 20 degrees weather I needed it closed!) Breakfast is simple- pancakes/waffles, cereal, toast/bagels, yogurt, and eggs. I mostly used the free breakfast to start my day and then ended up eating well for lunch and dinner. But for simplicity and to save money it was great having the option right there. I'll stay here in the future any time I come to NYC for fun. It's a great little hotel near everything we needed.

My son & I enjoyed our stay at the Broadway at Times Square Hotel! The free breakfast & free wi-fi were a plus! And we were able to walk to all of our destinations (mainly Broadway theaters..) because the location was near everything! Clean rooms, comfortable bed & pillows and the water would get hot fast! Would definitely stay here again!

I loved my stay at this Hotel. I loved the location. The bathroom had lots of shelf space and was larger than the bathrooms at 5 star Hotels. My bed was comfortable, and my room had a fridge and a microwave. The staff was friendly and accommodating. I stayed in room # 307. which was quiet and away from the Street. I would tell all of my friends, family and co-workers to stay at this Hotel, if visiting NYC. The price I paid for 6 nights was a great bargain, compared to other Hotels in the area.

You really can't beat the value for this location. Located half a block off of Times Square, it's a really cute boutique hotel. The room was small but very clean with a refrigerator and a microwave. Breakfast is also included in the price!The service here was great. We arrived early in the morning and was able to store our luggage.
