Hotel was close to Times Square, very small room with no refrigerator. I have stayed in several hotels in NYC and this one was adequate for our needs. I do have to say the Sunday breakfast included the best fresh donuts I have ever had-not sure if this was special for Sunday morning or what. I enjoyed hearing the pigeons cooing outside our window. We had to open the windows because the room was very warm-quiet at night despite being so close to Times Square. The only thing that annoyed me was hearing a door slamming in the morning since our room was right next to the elevator.

This is a good hotel, not a great hotel. There are plenty of better hotels in the area, but they all cost substantially more. I don't know that you can get a better deal for such a good location, which is why we booked. I'd rather spend my money out on the town than on my hotel room. Yes, you'll pay more than you would for a comparable hotel elsewhere, but this is NYC near Times Square. Our room was small but very clean, the bed comfy, the A/C cold and the bathroom was newly updated. I stayed here before when it was a Comfort Inn and they have updated it nicely. Will stay here again!

Excellent staff , excellent location , clean and friendly. An added bonus was the fact that all phone calls within USA were free . This ,together with the free in-room wi fi , was a most convenient service. The buffet breakfast was very adequate and the dining area was spotless . We would be very happy to go there again.

You couldn't ask for a better hotel when in town for sightseeing. The location is just around the corner from Times Square, the staff was very nice and helpful and the room was perfect. I took my son up for a short trip to see the city and catch a Yankees game and it was a great trip topped off with a stay in a great hotel. The room was small but very clean. No real view, but didn't matter as we were just there to sleep. The bed was very comfortable and the hotel itself was quiet. The staff was very helpful and friendly. The breakfast was included and it was more than what I expected (pancakes, cereal, donuts, pastries, juice, bananas etc. As far a parking, we stayed at resource parking which was about 200 feet away and only paid $26 for the 24 hour period (instead of the normal $60). This was a discount because we stayed at the hotel. We would definitely stay here again !

we found the hotel on trip advisor and are happy we did. the area was soooo convenient to everything the people at the hotel were accommodating and pleasant. service was quick to check in and check out. breakfast was real ny bagels, yogurt, premade waffles donuts, muffinsk, cornflakes and raisin bran, bananas ad coffee, apple juice . the rooms were a good size for ny hotels and looked brand new and clean. loved having a fridge and microwave and safe also. four of u used this hotel and would totally go back. parking was only $26 a day and a one minute walk.

The hotel was SO incredibly close to Times Square and the shows we wanted to attend. The staff was friendly and the room was well kept (the rooms are small, but hey, it's NYC!) The hotel's deal with the Parking Garage was stellar! And the hotel let us keep our luggage in storage after check-out so we could enjoy the city until the evening hours. I was a bit worried from some of the other reviews, but it was really just great. I had my two teenage daughters with me and I felt safe at this hotel and the neighborhood. We will be back!

I was with my wife .. Very clean .. Just few steps from time square ...nice irish pub in front of the hotel ..and real nice american brekfast .. Close to subway ..very helpful staff ..as written good value for money

I stayed there recently and booked online through booking.com. I got there to check in and the hotel seemed nice when I got to my room it was so tiny it was basically only a bed. The bathroom was extremely small and they did not provide toothpaste. We had a window in our room but no view, the window looked into a small alcove and provided no outside light and was very strange. However for the price I suppose what should I have suspected. It was clean and the location was perfect. Overall my stay was pretty good besides the small room.

Only 1/2 block from Times Square, this hotel was very clean, staff was friendly and helpful and breakfast was standard continental fare. I would recommend asking for a room away from 46th Street as New York sanitation workers can be very loud at 5:30 am! We will book this hotel again!

Stayed for 1 night with my 2 kids in a 2 queens bed room which was tiny but I imagine everything is in NYC besides food portions. We had very clean and comfortable beds, plenty of towels in the bathroom and shampoo and soap galore, TV and amenities. Staff was very pleasant and helpful. A few negatives that didn't affect our comfort at all: TV remote didn't work, the coffee maker had coffee but no paper filters and the carpet was very old and not so clean. Breakfast was cool, not too much selection, but good enough-some cereal, bagels, doughnuts, waffles and toast. We all got what we wanted. Great bang for the buck and most importantly just a stone throw away from Times square! Will return next time!

Nice small hotel just off of Times Square. Unbelievable location...close to theaters, subways, etc. Room was small (though what I expect in Manhattan), but clean and decently appointed. Free breakfast was fine, but nothing amazing. Staff was friendly and helpful. We had a room away from the street, which was great, as it was very quiet. Bed was comfortable. My only nitpick is that there wasn't sufficient towel rack space in the bathroom. It was an amazing value for what we got. We would definitely stay there again.

This hotel is about a half block from the main area of Times Square!! It was perfect for walking everywhere. The hop on hop off bus was within 10 minutes as was ST. Patrick's Cathedral and Rockefeller Center. I loved being able to tour during the day and then stop at the hotel to change and charge up the phone before walking to a Broadway theater. Also the Intrepid Museum is only a 20 minute walk straight down 46th Street. It's a small hotel and breakfast is included. Everything was very clean and I had a deluxe room with a fridge and microwave. The rooms are small like most NYC hotels but the bed was very comfy. Across the street is a 24 hour deli that sells all kinds of food at a reasonable price plus there are about 5 restaurants on that block. Staff was very nice too, I will definitely be back! The only minor negative was that the pancakes were kind of cold but that could be fixed by warming them up in the microwave. The donuts were great, there are also bagels, hard boiled eggs and yogurt.

Traveled with a friend and my 9 year old daughter. Had a room with 2 queen beds which worked perfectly for us and were very comfortable. Not much more space in the room due to the bedding. Shower was great - very strong. Breakfast is included which is quite substantial - not just Danish and coffee. WiFi was free! Location is fantastic and there is a great café steps away with excellent lunches, pastry and coffee.

Girls trip to catch up on Broadway shows. We were very impressed by his friendly everyone was. Room was clean, but small. Perfect location. A nice free breakfast was great! Highly recommend for medium budget.

We stayed at this hotel for 5 nights during our recent visit to New York. The hotel is located just off Times Square but is reasonably quiet. Our room was at the back of the hotel so we enjoyed a good night's sleep. The buffet breakfast was quite sufficient with plenty of choice and Anton was so pleasant and helpful. In fact, all the staff were really friendly and efficient. We would definitely recommend this hotel.

Small room,but very comfortable bed. The staff very kind and useful. My spouse and I are very thankful for advice and services provided by greeters.Location is amazingly at Times Square . We look forward to revisiting the same hotel

My 17 year old daughter and I stayed here for 4 nights. Perfect location for seeing Broadway shows--we saw 6! All within a 5 minute walk. The room was small but clean and comfortable. The staff was friendly. I accidentally left some credit cards in the safe, and they went down to the post office to mail them back to me at no charge!! I will definitely be back here in 2 more years to do the same trip with my next daughter.

Hotel was a little bit smaller than I expected.Also, it was a little difficult to find the exact location but you could recognize it as you find out the hotel symbol. It was a little older but amenity was good,staff was kind.It was quiet so I could sleep deeply.Also you can keep your luggage in the hotel for a while even if you checked out.

This hotel is classed as a tourist hotel but, was surprisingly good quality and value for money. The check in was very simple with no hassle. Our room had two double beds and although there was little space it was adequate for our the three of us during our stay. Tea and coffee available in the room, lots of fluffy towels and toiletries and everything was spotlessly clean. Complimentary breakfast was very good. Cereal, toast, bagels, fresh fruit, waffles, pancakes, cakes, doughnuts, yoghurt. Lots of choice for everyone's taste. Tea and Coffee was available 24/7 in the dinning area.The hotel is a 2 minute walk from Times square, 5 minutes for the local subway. All the staff were incredibly friendly and helpful. A special mention to Jovannie Julia on reception. He is very knowledgeable of the city, booked some of our sightseeing trips and sorted out taxi for return journey to the airport. Thanks Jovannie, the helicopter ride was fantastic!
user_location: Yorkshire Dales National Park, United Kingdom
user_name:
Heather B
Yorkshire Dales National Park, United Kingdom

review_body: My daughter and I have been staying here for at least 10yrs. We go to the city once a year for our Mother/daughter two night stay to see shows, shop etc. the location is great! The hotel is very clean, nice, and includes breakfast. Not only that but the staff is wonderful too! The manager (Jovanni) and doorman (Sidibi) are terrific! They remember us every year and makes us feel " at home"! I highly recommend this hotel, it's a good deal!

I spent some time researching New York hotels and thought the price for this one considering the location was brilliant, and it didn't disappoint.We absolutely loved the location, just being steps away from Times Square was amazing and we were able to walk to most of the sights. We were on the 7th floor and the room was lovely, quiet and very clean. The staff were very friendly and always willing to help. The breakfast included pastries, waffles, donuts as well as young hurts, cereal, toast, fruit etc. We really enjoyed this, especially as I noticed most other hotels didn't offer breakfast so it was definitely a bonus to have this. We definitely recommend this hotel and would happily stay here again next time we visit.

At first glance, the hotel seemed to be perfect. The room was a steal at $109 night. It is so close to Broadway and there are many stores and restaurants in the area. The room had EVERYTHING that is on my wish list- a refrigerator, a microwave, a safe and it was very clean and neat. There is a complimentary breakfast in the morning that is great if you are not carb-restricted. There is coffee/tea all day.My problems at the hotel were not dramatic, but for me, a working internet system is key during all of my travels. The internet was terrible. In addition, the room that I had faced 46th st. There was so much noise with trucks, trash collections, etc at 5:30am and late at night(near 1am). Do not get any room that is situated like room 501 is situated. I would like to see someone in charge respond to the trip advisor.

Comfortable bed, comfortable room, just 1/2 block from the middle of Times Square, a block or two from theaters. Really a good spot for a NYC trip. Friendly staff, nice continental breakfast to start the day.

A very small, clean, decent hotel in the heart of chaos. The room was nice, but small. I had 2 plumbing issues. If i turned on the shower to the right temperature the whole room vibrated. So I had to either take a cold shower or a too hot shower. Obviously I took the cold route. I told the front desk that I had the problem and also that the toilet ran incessantly. The next morning I told them the problem had not been fixed. The 3rd morning I just let it bang and bang. My friend said to me "did you hear all that construction at 8 this morning?" and I explained what was going on. I waited for the manager to come in and told her that I felt that if they couldnt fix the problem they should have let me know. She knew nothing about it so I brought her up to the room and let her hear the noise. At 6 that evening she was still waiting for a plumber. The next morning it was fixed. I asked if my bill could be reduced somewhat because of my inconvenience. The front desk girl said no.I went to get my car and they rang up the bill and I said that I was told the parking was $26/ day not $55. He said I needed a stamp from the hotel. No one told me I needed a stamp. They only told me the parking was half price if I was staying at the hotel. I asked if he could cancel my transaction and rerun it if I went back to get a stamp. He said no. I hate feeling cheated. Life is tough enough without having the deck stacked against you. The bellman was very grumpy and said he hated working there. He said he is underpaid and can't wait to find another job. That's not my problem and I don't want to hear his woes. The property is right in the heart of Broaday and times square.

We couldn't believe what a great price this hotel was with the location between 6th & 7th Avenue right at Times Square. We thought there has to be a catch. Definitely no catch, great location, room ideal and clean and lovely staff. Will definitely be back.

For a three night stay and to have Times Square almost at your front door at a reasonable price , and if your not looking for luxury , this is the perfect place to stay . I have given it top points for service , cleanliness & location . There are two Irish pubs across the road from it , the one closest to Times Square has the better feed . I had a fourth floor room overlooking the street , it was great . Something for the ladies , if you get up early , & walk further back down the street you will come across a lot of flower shops getting there morning deliveries . No problems getting my shuttle from here to JFK either . It was 5 AM though .

I wrote a review of this hotel a couple of years ago, but thought it was worth commenting again. This is a fabulous small hotel in an ideal location, usually with a very good price. The rooms are small, but nicely furnished - and at least some of them have fridges and microwaves, which is a very nice touch. There's free wifi. The location is ideal - far enough from Times Square to not be too manic; central enough that it's very easy to get anywhere by foot or by subway. And if you do have a hankering for the craziness that is Times Square, it's a two minute walk. Another reviewer mentioned street noise...I just stayed for two days with windows facing the street...I didn't find it troublesome at all. Finally, the staff are great - very nice, very helpful. I've stayed several times in the past and I'll definitely be staying here again.

We stayed at this hotel for two nights and we didn't have a good experience at all, we decided to book this hotel after going through the reviews here - the location is awesome, you are right in the middle of Time Square. We got the room 202 located on the second floor and facing the street, which means, we were unable to sleep both days we stayed there. Noise, cars horning all night, people passing by talking, screaming and a whole more... A truly nightmare! The next day I asked to change the room and I was told the hotel was completely booked and they wouldn't be able to accommodate my request. If you decide to stay here, make sure to get a confirmation that you will have a top floor not facing the street, otherwise I would look for another place to stay.The hotel provides breakfast but is poor.I wanted to give 1 star, but I have to be fair... Location and a good free wifi deserves 2.

We booked a one night stay when in town to see "Hamilton". The hotel was one block from the theater...awesome! The staff was accommodating, and were not the least judgmental about our online discount web site purchase. The bellhop was amazing. My husband was recovering from ankle surgery, and he helped us up the stairs with his knee scooter and bags every time we entered. The staff welcomed you when you arrived, and chatted with you as you left. The room was small, but very nice and very clean. Coffee and tea were always available in the very large breakfast area. Check out wasn't until noon, and they let us check in early. Free wifi, close to everything, would definitely stay again!

I have stayed (and reviewed) many hotels in New York City. I did not pick this hotel to stay in - a relative did but I enjoyed my stay very much. This hotel, (not to be confused with its sister hotel - The Hotel at Times Square) was off of the crazy Broadway but is a very convenient location if you are going to a Broadway show. The rate was reasonable and check in was a breeze. We were given an upgraded room because our room style wasn't ready when we checked in - EARLY! That was nice. In fact, everyone employee we encountered - the check-in and check-out clerks, housekeeping staff, the breakfast room attendant- were all very nice and professional. The hotel is small and the hallways are tiny. I was glad I didn't have a big suitcase. That might have made it hard to navigate out of the elevator. The room was a normal NYC size room. The bed was very comfortable. It wasn’t the most luxurious room I’ve every stayed in but it was clean and had everything you needed and more. It came with free wi-fi, a microwave and refrigerator which I wouldn’t have expected for the rate. We were lucky to get a room at the back of the hotel so we didn’t hear any street noise. The lotion, soap and shampoo were in refillable pumps which I had never seen before in a hotel and have mixed feelings about. On one hand, it is very smart and eco-friendly for a hotel to have. But on the other, I do like having a bar of soap in the shower. I was disappointed that the windows didn’t open. We love fresh air whenever possible. There isn’t a restaurant or bar on premises but the free, extensive, continental breakfast was all we needed to get started in the morning and there were plenty of places all around for our meals and nightcaps. I highly recommend this hotel for anyone staying in Times Square. It provides a great value.

Upon arrival to the hotel, I was unsure of staying here. It was very small and reminded me of some brownstone in Brooklyn. However, when I walked in, I noticed the hotel was small yet very nice. The hotel was up to date, hallways were small, but the rooms were very spacious to be located in NYC. The best thing about the hotel was the location. The hotel is literally one block from the middle of Time Square! And it is in the middle of everything! Will def stay here again.

Great location!! We really liked how close the hotel was to Times Square and the theaters. We saw 2 Broadway plays and both were very close by. Room was small but very nice. Had all amenities that we were looking for. Bed was very comfortable. Free breakfast was a nice addition too.

The staff at this hotel are amazing and so helpful.We stayed 3 nights and the room was very clean and spacious.Breakfast was the usual for a New York hotel with plenty of choice.Very central position 1 minute walk to Time Square.

On a long weekend stay with a couple friends and we stayed at the Broadway @ Times Square. The location was great, they had comfy beds and it was surprisingly, quiet. The shower wasn't super strong, but it was hot and I was able to wash away the city grit at the end of the night. We loved the staff as they were super helpful and always greeted us with a hello and a smile. The entire staff was nice, as we met with the housekeeping person on our way down to the lobby. She knew what room we were staying in and started a conversation with us. It was a small room, but clean and cozy.

As with most people who visit Trip Advisor, you look to get what you hope is a balanced review from the hotel you are looking for.At the time of the original booking, I would have to say there was a mixed thought between the two of us whether we would stay at the hotel during our visit to New York. We had the benefit of reserving the hotel by way of free cancellation through booking.com up to one day before arrival so we did have that to fall back on.We made the right decision to fulfil the booking.Most hotels you attend will normally have a welcoming reception which looks very smart. This one was no exception. On the same floor was an area to use the Internet and print were required free of charge. Further down was a very small room which houses a running machine, bike and cross trainer. We never used it but would of if we hadn't done so much walking !!Staff were in attendance at all times and were very helpful.The main seated area was the breakfast room. This does have UK football on match days which was handy when we ate our breakfast one morning at 1000. Breakfast is included within the price and is excellent and offers the following :Toast (make yourself)BagelsFruitYoghurtPorridgeDonutsTea, Coffee and juiceAll help yourself but a member of staff was normally round so it's nice to drop him a couple of dollars as he does keep the area clean.Tea and coffee is available anytime free of charge.Our room was on the top floor and whilst looking old was clean and acceptable. Lots of plugs available for charging phones, laptops etc. TV was good as the reception was quality with a large amount of channels on offer. There was a heater in the room which was AC or Heat with the latter being on as it was -17 outside during our stay. There was a large wardrobe for the storage of clothes as well as your cases. Within this area there was also a safe which was free and very easy to operate.WIFI is available in the room with no restrictions on the number of items which connected. Signal was excellent throughout the stay with the odd refresh of the connection if you wanted to FaceTime.Bathroom was today albeit it cold but when the door was closed you couldn't feel how cold it was. It did however ice up on one morning giving the water we bought a nice cold taste. It was a very small bath so more a shower use but it was very difficult to get the shower to work to a temperature which wasn't burning hot.Location wise, what can you say - excellent !! Come out the hotel , turn right and walk 200 yards and you are on Times Square. Access to the majority of Broadway shows within 10 minutes, subway within two minutes. 5th Avenue was a 10-15 minute walk left out the hotel with Macy's about 12 blocks away but lots to look at on route.There are a number of bars opposite the hotel and all sold food. We didn't visit these but noticed that the prices appeared reasonable for the area and they did have happy hours every night. There is also an excellent deli offering fresh sandwiches should you not wish to venture out or if you are waiting for a transfer to the airport.I would definitely recommend this hotel to anyone. So much so, we will be booking there next time we stay and my wife has recommended it for her girlie trip next year. Having visited NYC on three previous occasions it has been the best value for money especially with the $10-15 per day saving made for free breakfast and wifi.

We stayed here for a weekend en route to Dubai. The location is great, just steps away from Time Square and the Subway stations. You can even walk to Madison Square from there as well. Reception was great, the breakfast was plenty and although the rooms were small and some lacked a view, it was cozy and comfortable. No street noise from our room. Would recommend!

We didn't have high expectations for this hotel, but were very happy with the whole experience. We had a room on the 4th floor, very quiet, no noise from the elevator or the street.We had a large king bed, and big bathroom. Breakfast was more choice than anticipated, and would recommend staying here. We got quite sick of staying in Times Square, so 3 nights was plenty. Glad we had 3 nights in this particular hotel though, the housekeeper was lovely.

Our first time satying at this location, It was great!I will be sure to go back it was clean, they were friendly, and not expensive. Location was perfect for a show in NYC. Cute bars and shops all on the same block. We parked at Ikon which was perfect.

My fiance and I stayed at Broadway @ timesquare hotel for two nights, 2/29-2/31/16. We had the best time & especially enjoyed the continental breakfast and A+ service provided by Jovannie Julia and Sunnie. A room upgrade was even offered to us on the 2nd night of our stay. The kind gestures, top notch service and breakfast was enough to convince us of a second booking very soon.Live your best life!MelMelisha & Collin
user_name:
Melisha P
Bay Shore, New York

review_body: We stayed here the weekend of Winter Storm Jonas--we had originally booked for one night, but due to the weather, it became two and then three. Extending our reservation was easy, and what could have been an awful weekend (we had tickets to Hamilton, which was canceled) was made much more bearable by this hotel, and especially the concierge who helped us find something to eat in the middle of a blizzard.The room was clean and perfect for us, and the free breakfast downstairs was better than expected. I would absolutely recommend this hotel, especially for anyone coming to the city for a show. The location couldn't have been better.

This hotel was perfectly located, very clean and the staff was very helpful and polite !!! The Breakfast was just enough! We were two blocks from time square and all the action! And only a few blocks from all the theatres!

My main concern staying at any hotel in New York was Bed Bugs! Well, as soon as I entered my room I immediately check for any unfriendly passengers, and to my pleasant surprise my room was very clean, I felt right at home and I will definitely select this hotel again.

Stayed here for 6 nights in January & would recommend this hotel to everyone.Location is perfect right next to Times Square, street noise was not a problem as the street was pretty quiet for the area.The free breakfast was perfect for a quick bite before setting out for the day, certainly saves you $20 from nearby diners.Wi-fi was excellent, it never dropped once & the free use of PC & printer in reception was great for printing out tickets etc.We were given a free upgrade to a king size room which was extremely good for the price. Huge comfy bed, microwave, refrigerator, coffee making machine & nice powerful shower.Finally a word for the staff who couldn't have been more helpful, from taking in the many packages that I had delivered to take back to the UK, to organising a return bus back for us to Newark Airport, nothing was a problem for them.Thank you to all at Broadway @ Times Square Hotel, if/when I return to New York this will be the only place that I stay!

Great location very near Times Square. Staff very polite and helpful. Decent breakfast. Tiny halls, only 1 person at a time! Very tiny rooms. Pulled up edges of bedding and not clean. You get what you pay for.

I like the location is very good and I visited between 29/12 until 3/1 .. The street to time square will closed in 31/12 the hotel will give you a paper with your staying is paper you will need to show the police men on the street to let you go in side when you are going out or in to hotel because the hotel was in time square and they're more than million people there .. Good hotel when I search to found a hotel I didn't found any hotel available expect is hotel and it is was good small hotel

My husband and I stayed mid-week in early December. We were very pleased as we found the hotel to be very clean and very close to Time Square. The staff were very helpful and accommodating. We arrived a couple of hours before check in but they put us in our room right away. The room was on the small side and did not have a view (we were on the back of the hotel which was beneficial for sleeping) but we did not need a large room as it was just the two of us. The bed was comfortable and the room had all the amenities that we needed. The free breakfast was continental but it was appreciated. The hotel lobby, workout room and dining room are not large but we were not there to hang around the hotel. The location was great as it was so close to Time Square and within easy walk to Rockefeller Center, Herald Square and 5th Avenue. We would definitely recommend this hotel and would probably stay here again next time we go to Manhattan.

I was pleased to find a small boutique hotel with a friendly staff, a few blocks from Times Square with free breakfast...at an affordable rate!It's an older hotel, but very clean, and the guality of the room was fine and appropriate for the rate paid...truthfully I was expecting the quality of the facilities to be of lesser quality then they were.Staff was friendly, we had one small maintainence issue that was handled quickly and efficiently.Breakfast was free but "budget hotel" average...but finding a free breakfast in Manhattan doesn't happen very often, so it's hard to complain about that.Overall I was very pleased with our experience...for a budget offering my expectations were nicely excedded.

We stayed three days on a trip to see Broadway shows, all of which were just a few blocks away. We could walk everywhere (except the Metropolitan Museum; we took the subway). We were close enough to Times Square to be near everything, but removed enough that it was quiet (except for the bells from the neighboring church at 7:30 Friday morning). And the staff was friendly and helpful above and beyond the call of duty. Rooms were clean and comfortable. I will stay here again on my next theatre trip!

Visited this hotel from Jan 3-6th. It is right in around the corner from Times square. Took us literally less than 1 minute to walk there. We hot-wired and got this hotel at like $100 a night which was pretty great considering where it is!It is right beside a T.G.I.F's restaurant if you get hungry and across the street is a variety store and a bunch of bars! LCOATION:Perfect location. Right around the corner from main square in times square! Make sure you don't miss it. The sign for the hotel is small so keep your eyes peeked. Its right beside TGIF! ROOMS:Rooms are a good size with a bed, and a desk and the bathroom is normal! Read lots of reviews complaining about the size of the room. This room isn't any smaller than any other hotel room i've stayed in. The hallways and elevator are tiny but the rooms aren't bad. It has a bed and the bathroom has a toilet, and shower ... all you need. The rooms also have a small tv and a radio/alarm clock! We didnt get a nice view but thats okay! We were in room 300 and we actually had a view of a brick wall ahaha BREAKFAST:Continental breakfast from 6-10 am in the downstairs room (small - all there is, is a lobby and the breakfast room).Lots of choices for breakfast!! There is pancakes, waffles, fruit (banana's & apples), toast, jam, bagels, muffins, cinnamon rolls, cereal, oatmeal, boiled eggs, etc. There is also coffee, and tea which they have all day in the kitchen/ breakfast room. We always took a couple bananas and apple for the road!! GYM:Right off the lobby. Very small. Only has 3 machines. A treadmill, bike and elliptical. Went all 3 days i was there and never saw anyone using it. Also has a water machine in there so you can fill up your water bottle!! So you don't need to buy one when you are out. Just reuse yours and fill the water up there.Overall a great stay! The front desk staff is very nice and the one gentleman that woks in the breakfast hall is super nice and helpful! Had a great stay at this hotel and would definitely recommend it to anyone staying in new york!! * ALSO THERE IS FREE WIFI *

Most of the staff made the difference in our experience, from reception to the concierge and the man at the cafeteria at breakfast, to the cleanliness of the rooms. The room size was relatively generous by New York standards, and had enough space to store luggage. Midsize, not as busy as the big hotels. The corridors are narrow but never a deal breaker. Will definitely return to stay the next time I will be in New York.

We chose this hotel for our first trip to NYC. I'm so glad we read the reviews and decided to stay here. Upon arrival to the hotel (we got there at 10am) we were greeted by the attendant at the front desk. There was a snafu with our reservation but he was more than willing to help us with the issue. Not only was he able to get us the room we wanted, he allowed us to check in early. I cannot express enough how friendly the staff was. We were greeted every time we entered and exited the hotel by every employee we passed. The room was a bit small but very clean. The bathroom was a good size. Be careful in the shower, it was a bit slippery. The mattress was lumpy and soft but very comfortable after a day of walking for hours. When we return to NYC we will definitely stay here again. Great stay at a great price.

Small and inconspicuous sign outside, but all luxury inside! Staff very friendly and helpful. Room was small but very clean, modern and quiet. Great value with breakfasts included in the total price. (fresh fruit, eggs, pancakes, pastries, cereal, great coffee and more!) No need to take a cab or subway from Penn Station. Everything was a 2 to 15 minute walk away! Close to all theatres, TKTS, museums, NY Public Library, etc. Will book same hotel next time!! Thank you for making my first time to NYC so memorable! Worth every penny!

Excellent Reception, room clean and well furbished, plenty of fresh food at breakfast,no noise even from the practicing bands for the New Year celebrations. At all levels the staff were helpful and very friendly and we would certainly recommend and return.Pity there is no bar for that late night drink.

We stayed here on New Year's Eve Weekend. The hotel is in a fantastic location...literally, "a stones throw" from the Main Stage at Times Square New Year's Eve Celebration. We had short walks to Rockefeller Center, St. Patrick's, Radio City, & Saks 5th Avenue. The bed was a "higher-end" bed that was comfortable and clean...much like you would find at a higher-end hotel. The room was small but it was fine because we didn't spend much time there. The continental breakfast was also sufficient...hotcakes/waffles, hard boiled eggs, bagels with toaster, yogurt, cereal, coffee, orange/apple juice and banana/apple. They also serve coffee all day.My only complaints are that we were on the 7th floor and it took 15 minutes for the hot water to make it's way up to us. Also, the bathroom window was a little cold and drafty but we got thru it. The staff were very friendly and helpful. I would definitely stay here again on another visit to NYC.

Great location and great staff at this hotel just 1/2 block off of Times Square. Lobby was renovated in the last few years and it expanded the seating for the morning breakfast. Love coming here, we come back often, only place we stay in NYC.

Greeeeeeen narrow entrance, helpful on the desk, horrible room, soooooo small, no window as in pic, we could push our door and open it, quite noisey, other guests shouting etc doggy looking people here and scruffy, I would not stay here again.

This was an awesome location for us!!! We came in to see the rockettes foe a morning show. We came in the day before to.do.some.sight seeing. The location was in walking distance to times square, Rockefeller center, and 5th Ave shopping.... the staff was very friendly and the room was great for the price. The hallways are super narrow and there are a couple.of steps to get in and out of the bathroom and the room... there is only ever one person at the front desk so it got a little . congested at times but would definitely stay again!

We loved this small, perfectly-located hotel, and will never stay anywhere else again.The rooms are small (it's NYC), but immaculate. Bed was very comfortable, and we both have back issues! Refrig and microwave were very convenient. Coffee maker in room, but also downstairs in breakfast area. Individually controlled heat and air are important, and not available in many similar hotels. All staff had a warm and friendly manner, and fixed any problem immediately. Breakfast was also available daily, which saved lots of money. Great security right in lobby. There are doors that portion off parts of each floor, thus reducing any noise. We were near elevator and never heard anything. Our room did not face the street so we didn't pick up any street noise. It was a lovely stay at a great price! We will absolutely be back.

I picked this hotel based on TA reviews and it was fine for the one-night business trip I just completed. Have to say that the pictures look a bit nicer than the reality of the place. The staff is very nice and accommodating. I forgot my toothpaste and they were kind enough to provide a sample tube, which I appreciated. My room was small and did have the king bed as promised, but not much extra room. It was not too noisy from guests but anytime a door slammed with the spring-loaded door closer, it reverberated like a gunshot throughout the hallway. I was on the second floor and there was noise from outside early in the morning that woke me. I would say it was reasonably clean. The one thing that did surprise me is that this is the first and only hotel I've ever stayed in that did not have a toilet paper holder. The roll of TP was sitting on the toilet tank, but no toilet paper holder. Strange. It is kind of hard to find and the sign is not very big. It was not bad, but not sure about a repeat.

The hotel is what is it states. Nothing special, but a great location which meets the needs of of tourist not planning much time in the hotel. Rooms are small and basic but this is New York - Times Square. Clean enough but could be cleaner but beds need replacing. Breakfast is enough to get you started for the day and not spend money especially if you have kids - not sure what the milk was!!!! There are 9 floors and we were on the 9th but you can still here the nightlife and sirens. Hey, enjoy, this is Times Square and part of the experience. A special mention to the very friendly staff. Trip advisor only allows me to rate average then very good, but I genuinely would rate as Good.

The hotel was ok, clean and comfortable for our stay. It is in an ideal location close to times square and it was nice to have a mini fridge and microwave. What I was most annoyed about though is that the hotel take a pre authorisation of money from you for the cost of the room + some addtionalities. On check out I was told that I would then be charged and they would take no additional money, well they are wrong. They then proceeded to take the same amount. So instead of being £190 that they have taken they have taken this and are holding an additional £180. I went back to the hotel to question this after departure and they assured me it had been refunded. I waited a few days due to xmas banking and still nothing. Emailed them, was told they would respond in 12 hours. 48 hours later and still nothing! I would advise you put it on credit! Extremely annoyed and disappointed they didn't tell me this on arrival and on checkout. If this was a week break, you could be £1400 short instead of £700!Room view looked onto other building and scrap yard.

We are here for Christmas week. They have security which is a plus. The location is good BUT we stayed in a few other hotels on the next block and they are SO much better. Small windows in room with no view at all. Rooms here are small-understand small...you walk in and hit the bed! They "upgraded" us to a suite and that was adding a fridge/microwave cabinet in the already small room. No reason for a desk, pull that out so you can walk around and have some place to put the luggage. Crazy small. One elevator that is very slow. When you get out of elevator...smallest ever hallway we have been in. Very Very small, one way, could not go past maid with cart. Maid service so far hit and miss. Came today at 4pm. For the price , you can do better one or two blocks over. If you book with a outside travel company , print out records and call the hotel before you come and make sure they received payment. They make you deal with any issues. If the hotel is having issues with some travel websites then maybe they should pull their names off them instead of having guests be put in the middle. After two days and 2.5 hours on the phone is was straightened out so print out your reservations. Sorry, we tried but won't be back, too many other options in surrounding blocks.
user_name:
jenn012_10
New York City, New York

review_body: I stayed on this hotel on Sunday night for $125 against using my Marriott rewards points at Marriot on times square.I booked via bookings.com where it showed that $400 room available on sale in $125.Initially i felt that Marriott on times square is simply overcharging for their location, but without any offence to BroadWay @ times Square Hotel i realized that marriott is not over charging at all.This place was definitely not worth $450 and for sure every penny worth of $125 i actually spent here.Positives:Neat and Clean RoomsGreat Location (30 steps from times square)Friendly StaffNegatives:Small size rooms (whih is OK for $125 at times square)

This hotel was perfect for what we needed. Room was clean, bed was comfortable. Wasn't planning on having a refrigerator and microware so that was a nice surprise. Free Wi-Fi, use of computer/printer in lobby, continental breakfast. Great value for the price!

We booked last minute and were very pleased with everything. Yes the room is small but who cares we were there for a show in New York. The room was clean and more than adequate for our overnight stay. The staff was very accomodating and we would go back in the future

We had a lovley stay in this hotel.It's not ultra modern but it is spotless and has amazing staff especially joevarnie the receptionist.Nothing too much trouble.Even took the time to book a table at a nearby resturant. And may i say that we did not realise how difficult it is to eat in a good resturant if you do not have a booking.He booked transport to the airport after discusing all the diffrent options with us. Free internet, tea coffee in rooms and free breakfast. We were looked after so well.P.SI have never slept in a more comfortable bed in my life.

Great location 1/2 block from Times Square, theater district and other tourist locations, Okay room, very tight but updated, breakfast was a really bad even compared to other modest priced hotels. Staff tried hard to make the stay pleasant. In NYC you don't spend much time in your hotel room so the room/hotel felt safe clean and our room was quiet and was okay for a weekend.

I genuinely can't think of any serious negative criticism. Value for money is good particularly for location, it’s not cheap but nothing in Manhattan is and this hotel is competitively priced. The room was quite small but was fine for me and as I was on my own, I only booked a queen room so expected it to be a little on the small side. It was well appointed though, very clean and had everything required and expected. The bed was particularly comfortable and I found the hotel to be quiet (although I was on the top floor). The Staff were very friendly and helpful. For example it was no trouble to arrange a car for me to the airport.The Location is where this hotel shines, it is perfect for Times Square, theaters and attractions. I'd noticed other reviews people complaining about breakfast here and there on reviews I had read and true there's no fry up available but there's plenty of good fresh food on offer to get you going. A lot more than you'd get in a French style continental breakfast that's for sure.

We stayed at the Broadway in early December 2015. The locations is perfect - 1/2 block from Times Square, close to 5th Ave., Rockefeller Center, Broadway Theaters, etc.; all within walking distance. Given the loud activity in this part of NYC, our room was very quiet. The rooms Broadway at Times Square are not large but are comfortable and clean. The breakfast offerings were sufficient for having a bite before starting to take in the sites. We certainly would stay here again when in New York.

We were very impressed with our stay. Location is GREAT! Our room was very clean, a little on the small side, but we do not come to NYC to stay in the room. Staff was very personable and helpful. We will definitely stay here again!?

The location was perfect for walking to most of what we wanted to see. The rooms were clean, staff was very pleasant, price was "reasonable." The location is really what made this such a nice place. The rooms had a small refrigerator and microwave. Breakfast, nothing really fancy, was included. Since we were in the front of the hotel we could hear some street noise at night, but nothing too obnoxious. We were able to leave our luggage there after checkout to spend the day exploring. I would definitely recommend this hotel and would come back again.

This pretends to be a boutique hotel while it is a small rundown conversion. The lobby looks promising but rooms are tiny not well kept. Furniture is old and scratched. Very basic amenities. Not worth the money except for location. Maybe I was assigned a bad room but it is nore than likely from the look of coridors that this is no exception

Room was clean, comfortable and well appointed. Mattress neither too hard nor too soft. Everything worked. 1/2 block from the heart of Times Square. Very friendly and welcoming staff. Validated parking. Don't let the low rates lead you to think that anything is substandard. Downside? Only that the rooms are small, but that is typical for New York City. And there is only one elevator, so sometimes there is a wait for it to come. Still, save the extra money that you might spend on another hotel and spend it on a nicer dinner.

Quiet hotel in the middle to the city. Right off Times Square and Perfect for overnight or weekend stay. Friendly staff and Breakfast was included. Close to the theater and many restaurants. It was a great stay!

This hotel was such a great find. Perfect location 1/2 block from Times Square, yet perfectly quiet. Very affordable with a friendly staff that goes above and beyond to make sure everyone has a great visit. Rooms were clean and very comfortable.

For a New York Hotel, you couldn't have asked for more! The location is less than a third of a block from Times Square. The price was very reasonable and the staff was perfectly friendly!! My boyfriend proposed to me while in NYC on the Brooklyn Bridge and they were just as excited for me as I was. The room as small, but very comfortable and all that was needed. We had a king size bed, microwave and mini fridge as an added bonus! The bathroom was bigger than expected and easy to accommodate two of us. The breakfast needed a meat and eggs, but it was still nice to be offered at the hotel. Made life a little easier in the city that never sleeps! I would suggest this hotel to anyone traveling to NYC.

The hotel was very easy to find and right off the main stretch of Times Square. We got there early and our room was not ready so they allowed us to store our luggage. We came back around 3:00pm. Check in was very quick. We had a room with 2 beds and it was obviously small, but it's New York so what do you expect. The bathroom was small as well, but enough room to put things on the counter. The breakfast area had more dry food than hot. There was a good selection of cereal, muffins, and fruit. There was also yogurt and oatmeal. For a hotel in New York, having a continental breakfast was awesome. I would stay here again.

It is a small nice hotel in the heart of Time Square.The rooms are clean, small but specious enough not to feel claustrophobic. As long as you are not planning to stay in the room for too long it will be great location.

Booked this hotel for early Dec for a short visit to NYC and I cannot get over how fantastic the location is. The hotel is literally 1 minute walk to Time Square and short walking to Rockefeller Center, 5th Avenue and subway stations. The room is small but it has everything you need and the bed is very comfortable. The rate we booked was very reasonable and affordable and I can say it was the best money I have spent for accommodations in NYC.Room rate included free Continental breakfast which is ok but sufficient. Free Wi-Fi is great and connection is very strong throughout the hotel.Staff are friendly and very helpful. We drove from MA and parked the car across the road with good discount from the hotel. The only feedback I have is that water pressure is very weak. I would stay again and definitely will recommend anyone to stay here.

I stay at this hotel almost every time I visit NYC, which I've been doing for over 25 years. Just got back from a two day stay and I just might not book here again. I reserved 2 rooms at the hotel for this recent stay when I was there in August. Two days before my arrival this past week, I received my customary "Pre Arrival Confirmation" stating I was confirmed for my 2 rooms. Upon checking in, I was told by Julio that my reservations were canceled due to my credit card being canceled and that there were not 2 rooms available. He said there was nothing he could do. I had been using that credit card continuously so I honestly could not understand how this would happen. This, despite the fact that I had my confirmation from the hotel, and this, despite the fact, that I stay at this hotel a minimum of 4 to 5 times every year. I was very upset and embarrassed. Julio said he could try to find us another hotel but I didn't want another hotel. Plus, it was the day of the Christmas Tree lighting in Rockefeller Center (Dec 1) so it would probably be a bit difficult. When I spoke to the manager, she finally did find us the two rooms I had reserved by changing someone from one room to another. I called my credit card company and they said my card was never denied by any company, including this hotel. Later that afternoon, we observed the SAME thing happening to another guest. Maybe it was the hotel's fault, not their guests! I still am unhappy about this, especially since I brought 3 friends with me. I was not treated like a guest and the manager and the hotel did nothing to make me feel like I should return.

So you are staying near Times Square for the day after Thanksgiving and your just hoping to get some sleep but breakfast too and validated discount parking down the street! This place was perfect for our needs and the staff was excellent and friendly and the room clean and comfortable and quiet! Staying again if we can! Location was phenomenal for Times Square and Theater and Dinner. Was a gem of a place for us!

I'll describe the breakfast as that value was of interest to me but I couldn't find what they served: Cereal, bananas, apples, yogurt, hard boiled eggs, bagels and pancakes. Not a lot of protein available. Overall the hotel was a pleasant stay. The room was big enough to hold the beds (2 queen in ours) and a small desk. It didn't have much extra space but that's typical in NYC. It was very quiet as it was on the back side of the hotel. No view. HVAC regulated the temperature well without a lot of noise. The wifi would not work reliably for me anywhere in the hotel. It connected but I could not get anything to load. Same for my wife.The location of this hotel was excellent. It was steps away from the center of Times Square. Price was good although I booked on a discount website that doesn't show your hotel until after you book and it ended up being cheaper on the hotel's website. I was able to use a price guarantee to refund the difference but next time I'll just check now that I know this place exists!

I stayed here a few years ago and it was fine, but other hotels have offered better value since. When I needed a hotel for a pre Thanksgiving theatre visit this popped back up. They have dropped their chain affiliation and upgraded the hotel. All areas were in good repair and well decorated. The wireless was fast and free, and the continental breakfast was very nice and was served in a new enlarged area. All the staff was friendly and helpful, and my room was larger than NY normal. The bed was one of the most comfortable I've encountered. The bathroom was large enough for a tub unlike some other budget hotels in the area that offer showers only. All in all, a great stay with no negatives to report. There are a few steps at the entrance but they do have a mechanical lift they can deploy if necessary.

The Broadway was a very good hotel and I enjoyed my stay. The room was small but very adequate and the atmosphere was cozy (save for the very thin walls). The location was fantastic and the staff was very friendly. Would recommend for the traveler who just needs a budget-friendly place to crash while exploring NYC.

This hotel was in a great location, about ten steps from Times Square. Continental breakfast was included, and you could have free tea and coffee 24hours. The staff were extremely friendly and helpful, and when we arrived early from an overnight flight they were quick to accommodate us with an earlier check in. I'd highly recommend here

Great hotel! Conveniently located to Times Square. Great staff! Bonus luggage storage post check out! The free breakfast is a great "extra" considering most hotels don't even offer such a perk. Parking conveniently located across the street, validated only costs $26 per night.

Very nice. Rooms are small but very clean. Staff very helpful. Location was FANTASTIC, less than half a block to the middle of Times Square and easy walk to Central Park and more importantly Tiffany's. Good value. Would definately stay here again.

I stayed here for one night while in NYC for a short work related trip. The room is small, but adequate and similar to others in the city. The location is wonderful, close to the subway, Grand Central Station, and all the sights of Times Square and that area. The water pressure and water temperature was a bit hard to control. My room had no natural light. I didn't mind, but that might be an issue for some. The room has only a small shower stall, okay, but not luxurious. My one complaint is that the bathroom fan comes on with the light. I found the noise annoying. The staff were very friendly, the breakfast good (as hotel free breakfasts go), the wifi free. Overall, about what I would have expected for the price and I would stay here again.

If location is important to you this is the hotel to choose, only 200 yards from centre of Times Square and near to all the major theatres. The staff were so helpful with advise and were just nice people to be around. The continental breakfast was just what the doctored ordered, waffles, toast, bagels, boiled eggs, yoghurt etc and as much as you wanted....there is no bar but there are lots of bars nearby. There is a small gym but never went in it. The rooms were fine I would just say they needed som more light, maybe stronger light bulbs but this did not affect my stay. We will definitely going back to this hotel again and I could not recommend it enough of you want to be near where everything is going on....location, location, location.....

For my very first stay in New York City, I found this little gem of a hotel to be perfect in every way. The hotel itself was clean, rooms, although a little on the small side, were more than adequate and well appointed. The beds were quite comfortable after a long day in the city and the bathroom had everything you could possibly need with very nice towels. A continental breakfast was offered downstairs every morning from 4-10 am. (coffee, toast, bagels, toaster pancakes & waffles, cereal and fruit) Very friendly staff that were very helpful. The best part was the location and the reasonable room rates. We were within walking distance to most broadway shows, bus lines, Times Square, The Rock and many others. There were 3-4 restaurants on the street just steps from our front door. We opted to park our car in the garage across the street for about $26 per night and bought The New York Pass that provided Grayline Bus tours and admission to over 80 museums and attractions. I would recommend this hotel to anyone who might be leery about their first visit to the Big Apple. We felt right at home at the Broadway at Times Square.

Stayed here recently for 1 night. Arrived right around the 3pm check in time and there were quite a few other people also checking in. The process seemed a little disorganized and out of control as people were essentially just hovering around the 'desk' and there was no orderly line. Another employee arrived and helped to expedite things. Dropped the bag off and wouldn't return until after midnight so I can't comment on too much. The hotel is clean, but the rooms are small which is very typical for NYC though. Had a room with two double beds and there was barely room to walk around. Bed was comfortable and the bathroom was decent size. They offer free wi-fi which is pretty amazing as most of the big chains still charge for that service. I didn't partake, but they offer free breakfast and it smelled pretty good as I was leaving the hotel. Nothing special, but it's clean and comfortable and for the price it is really a great value when you factor in free wifi and breakfast. Can't beat the location as it's just steps to Times Square. Would stay here again if this was the area I wanted to be around.

Free continental breakfast that was actually pretty decent, easy location to everything, clean room, comfortable bed. Very close to Central Park and great restaurants. Downside is it's also very close to Times Square, which can be easily avoided if you know your way around enough, but it's also still Times Sq.

A pretty good hotel that is right next to Times Square without the noise, traffic and people. This quaint hotel serves a basic bkft. Minimum amenities but it's a good deal. Rooms were clean but very small and dimly lit. Bathroom was bright and adequate. Walking distance to all the theaters too.

We had lots of awful problems with the payment. First, when we arrived we couldn't pay with a card with the microchip because they accept just the swipe of the card. Then, we asked to pay with another prepaid card but immediately, not at the end of the stay. However, the hotel didn't charged the card that day, they just took an authorization in the card and the available balance of the card reduced. The big problem was when they actually charged the card (when we were already come back home from a few days) and the balance of the card went higly negative because the hotel didn't cancelled the previous authorization!! This way, I received communications and had problems with my bank!! Finally, the day they actually charged the card, the exchange rate €/$ was worse than the first day, and for this reason I've been charged 50€ more than what I would have paid the first day, when I explicitly asked to pay!!! To conclude, I discovered myself all these problems about the payment just when I had come back home and checked the balance of the card, because the staff never told me or explained me anything about what they were doing with the card!! I'm very upset and I'm sure I never come back there!

The location can let you forgive any inconveniences, like small room, no fridge, and no view. But it's only few minutes walking from the Empire State, from Madison squares garden,and from the theaters and it's inside the shopping area where every thing is available, also the staff is highly friendly and helpful.

Pleasant front desk, clean room and quite floor. Someone tried to register with a Expedia reservation and spent 2 hrs at the front desk trying to get a room. There is one guy storing luggage and he is the same guy who hails a taxi and cannot do it all. We found it a positive experience in a truly no frills way but with a "Hampton Inn" type of breakfast. Would consider it again

The best location....1/2 block from Times Square....we used to stay at the sister hotel 1 block away (Hotel at Times Square) but for now on only here. GREAT service oriented staff...special kudos to Jovannie and Ivonni at the front desk, Ibrahim (Sidibe), the bellman and Antonio (Polish) in the breakfast room. ALL were so professional, customer oriented, kind, helpful etc. etc etc. We stayed on 3 separate reservations this trip totaling 10 nights plus had our Aussie friends here in NYC for the first time. We all loved it. Room was quiet and very comfortable, breakfast simple but more than adequate. Can't get a better location if you want to be near the theater and Times Square district.

Didn't get the superking room I had booked as there was a problem with it. Got put in a room with 2 double beds instead and told I would be moved the next day. Ended up not getting moved until the last day of my 3 night trip due to "misunderstanding". Complained to manager who was so rude, laughed in my face and refused to give me any money off the bill and accused me of lying saying I was told to pack my bags so they could move my room after the first night. Sent email of complaint to the company because of the inconvenience and rudeness of the staff and said I did not agree for them to take any money from my card until it was resolved. They ignored me and took it anyway. Emailed again threatening legal action then they responded offering 10% the 2 nights I had to stay in the wrong room. Shockingly bad customer service. There was someone else complaining in reception when I left as well as they had given their room away. The hotel is pretty basic and breakfast not nice. All in all a complete disappointment and would never stay again.

The room is of a reasonable size for NYC. The bed was very comfortable, the bathrooom was of a good size, everything was very clean. The room had a good sized fridge, a microwave and safe, a closet with hanging room and a chest of drawers. The WIFI worked well. The location was fantastic with many attractions within walking distance.The staff was very helpful.We had a quiet back room .Some people who stayed in the front rooms told us that there was noise from the bars and restaurants across the street. The breakfast was not fancy but plentiful: cereals, bread, bagels, pancakes, waffles, yougurts, orange and apple juice, mufffins, apples and bananas. The bread, bagels, muffins , cereals all had kosher certification.Although there was only one elevator we did not experience any delays.Note that if you ask they will give you a senior discount . We would happily stay there again.

Great hotel,very clean, very nice staff and very well located . The rooms are small but very cozy, the bathrooms are meticulously clean.Great rates if you consider that the breakfast is included. It is a nice place if you are staying with kids or alone. I recommend!

The staff were awesome. Very kind and friendly. The room was clean and the bed was very comfortable. I will definitely stay there again. Very close to everything I wanted to see. They get 5 stars from me.

Booked this on recommendation of family. Pricing was fair for New York, rooms are quite small but we expected this and location is great.We stayed for 5 nights mid September.Room was clean and bedding was comfortable, even though there was a previous guest's sock down beside the bed, not sure how long it was there. We were on the 2nd floor and there were no noise problems at all. The room was very dark though.Breakfast was a bonus, was only continental but sufficient to start the day. Could get tea & coffee from breakfast room 24/7.Staff were very friendly and knowledgeable. Had a huge problem with their Eftpos machine, it took 2 payments for our room within 1 minute of each other. When I asked the front desk staff about this their reply was that it was a problem by my Bank. So at my expense I called Australia to verify what had happened with these funds. Was told that it wasn't a bank problem but an Eftpos glitch. They still did not believe me so they decided to close off my account which then took another 5 days of accommodation, so now I've paid for this room 3 times, $3000 overpayment. Even though it was a pending transaction it is still deducted from your available balance. By this stage it's a weekend and the person I needed to speak to was not back till Monday, we checked out Sunday. I sent quite a few emails regarding this problem and FINALLY 2 WEEKS LATER the 2 original payments were released back into my account. With all this happening I did not enjoy my visit to New York. I feel that this was not treated with a priority by the Hotel management. Still to this day, 1 month later, I have not had an official apology.

overnight stay in NYC for a Broadway show. The proximity to Times Square and the Theatre District is perfect. Not overly expensive. Room was very clean and comfortable. Nice continental breakfast in the morning. Free wifi and a good selection of television channels. Would definitely stay there again.

I have read before a review that this hotel does not respect reservation but thought that it was a simple mistake to a random customer. IT IS NOT. reserved for my wife and daughter birthday celebration weekend and got the surprised that there was not reservation in place, even do we have the confirmation document in hand. Front desk lady was rude by saying it was not their fault. I am still pissed to have my wife looking for another hotel while she and my daughter supposed to be having a good time now. DO NOT RESERVE in this hotel!!!

The location is good - near Times Square. However, the building is dull, and the rooms, especially the bathrooms, are below standart. Some, but not all of the he staff are helpful. Breakfast was also disappointing. Overall, this establishment reminded us a youth hostel and not a 350 USD a night establishment.

Broadway at Time Square offers an affordable, clean, friendly stay with breakfast and wifi included. My husband and I arrived right at check-in but had to wait about 20min for our room. Staff offered to hold our bags behind the desk if we wanted to start exploring right away. Staff is super friendly and communicates clearly. We asked for late check-out which was no problem at all. Once up to our room (King w mini fridge/microwave), we were happy to see it was exactly as pictured, no surprises. Mini fridge is big enough for large bottles of water. I was able to put a restaurant to-go box in there w no problem. Bathroom was small. No way around that. Enough room for 1 at a time. Toiletries offered but I didn’t use. Towels were thin but did the job. Bed was comfortable. But to be honest by the time I laid my head down each night I was so tired I think I could have slept anywhere. Breakfast is included w your stay. Bagels hit the spot. I didn’t try anything else but I saw yogurt, cereal, fruit, some hot options (although prob came from the freezer), coffee, and juices. The workout room is barely large enough for two machines. If you HAVE to get your run in you can but do not expect a full gym. Mostly foreign guests, no restaurant or bar on site, safe in room can fit an ipad. Broadway at Time Square is perfect for the traveler who does not plan on being in their hotel room often but rather out and about. I am pretty sure this place was renovated recently from a hostel, I felt like it was a Hostel on steroids. NYC is a city to be explored. Spend your money on the millions of good restaurants, shows, stores, vendors, and bars instead of spending all your money on a room.

My mom and I just spent a night in NYC at this wonderful hotel. All of the staff were extremely pleasant to deal with. It was about 1/2 a block from Times Square and a short walk to many other famous places to visit. We had 2 queen beds in our room that were very comfortable. We heard no noise from outside (although we brought a sound machine with us). Our room was on the second floor. Heard a door closing next door 2x but that was it. Very clean and no evidence of bugs. The bathroom was clean and had a big windowsill that doubled as an extra large shelf next to the sink. The water was hot when we wanted it to be. We were able to store our luggage before and after check in/check out and had our parking validated for a garage across the street for only $27 a day! The street never made me feel unsafe and there was a TGI Fridays next door (but MANY other places to choose from a short walk away). You have to keep in mind that unless you have a huge amount of money to spend, most rooms in NYC are small. I was pleasantly surprised by the space our room offered. Breakfast was ok but included with the room fee. Clean and spacious place to eat. Waffles and pancakes to heat up in the microwave, muffins, cereal, and great bagels. Great stay overall.

My wife and I stated here as we were visiting from the UK for our friends wedding in Central Park. This hotel is a little gem and so so close to Times Square. The staff are friendly and helpful. Rooms are small but as you are next to all the action it is to be expected in NYC. Breakfast is ok and enough choice for what you need to start the day. I would recommend this hotel to anybody wanting to be near the action of Times Square and not pay ridiculous amount of money at other hotels. We would definitely stay here again. Thanks.

We stayed here for 4 days prior to a cruise. The hotel is only a half block from the center of the Times Square action. Despite the closeness, the room was quiet. The room was quite small but efficiently laid out. The bed was comfortable and service was excellent (calling a taxi, explaining what lines to use on the subway, etc.)There are also many restaurants and theaters within the vicinity. Price-wise it was the best deal we could find in NYC and met our expectations.The only reason I gave it a 4 was room size but since we were rarely there it didn't matter to us. We would use this hotel again.

The location of this hotel is great and the staff are helpful and friendly. The rooms however are very small, cramped and are a little claustrophobic. The breakfast room is spacious and comfortable but the offer is quite basic. The fitness room is too small and has very limited equipment.

Wife & I had a 4 night stay in Midtown. The hotel was a pleasant surprise. - Good price. Great location. Helpful & friendly staff. Free breakfast. Clean rooms. Fast WIFI. We will be back next time we do a NYC trip!

We recently spent two nights here and enjoyed the room, breakfast and staff.Located near Times Square and the theatre district, perfect location. Subways are 3 blocks away.Front desk and door person friendly and helpful.We will return.

Given how expensive all hotels are in NYC, I really can speak of good value with this hotel. Firstly, the location was perfect if you want to be in the heart of Time Square, yet set back from the noise. The room was modern, clean and offered all amenities, including a microwave & small fridge; it wasn't a large room, yet offered all the space needed for two people; I found the bed, and particularly the pillows super comfortable. The staff were friendly and helpful. The addition of a continental breakfast was a nice touch. All in all, this is a great hotel worth consideration for someone that values comfort, quiet, clean and value. I'd stay here again

This hotel is small, but clean and comfortable. Staff was very friendly and helpful in every way possible. The rooms are on the small side, but very comfortable and clean. Very quiet hotel. The best part is how close you are to EVERYTHING!! Step outside and there is Times Square, Broadway, Statue of Liberty, Theaters, you name it and you can walk to it or reach it on a short subway ride. It made our trip so easy and fun!!! I would stay here again. No question. + you cannot beat the price for this location.

If you're traveling on a budget and are looking for a no-frills place with friendly service, this is a winner. Being in the heart of Times Square it was surprisingly quiet and comfortable. The staff was very attentive and friendly. Having stayed in NYC often for business, the queen room was larger than expected. The bed was not the most comfortable but the room was clean and accommodating enough for two people. Our stay included sight-seeing and a concert at Radio City Music Hall, which is just a few blocks away. Overall, convenient, inexpensive (by NYC standards) and great staff.

We had a corner room which was spacious and had two large windows where we could see but not hear Times Square. We were walking distance to Broadway and many other places that we visited. It was clean and the concierge was most helpful for planning places and times to dine. We would return.

We stayed Saturday September 26th.The room was cleancomfortableWe were able to check in early and felt safe in the area around the hotel..The breakfast was plentiful with various fruits, eggs, bengals and yogurt. We were pleased with our stay and the helpful staff that keeps this gem running.

Stayed here because it was the only place available in the area. I was told I should be able to check in at 11:00. I arrived at 10:00, but didn't get to check in until 2:00. They could not accurately tell me when I would be likely to have a room, so I had to just wait in the no frills lobby. Once in the room, it was very tiny (as expected in NYC). It seemed clean, but could badly use an update. I was tired and wanted room service, only to find out that there was no kitchen. Again, the location is great and the people are friendly enough but there is no luxury.

Small room, not impressed. It was clean, but outdated. Our view was of the back of a neighboring building, while I assume is pretty average in NY. We made the mistake of visiting while the Pope was in town and our Uber driver was unable to get all the way to the hotel to drop us off from the airport. Front desk clerk was friendly and informative.

Staff were helpful and hotel was in a good location but massively expensive for what we got. A very very small shabby room that we could barely move in! Breakfast was extremely sparse to say the least. I know it's not like for like but we are staying in the Venetian in Las Vegas for a similar price...no breakfast but an amazing room!!!

I booked with Expedia.ca and received a confirmation number issued by this hotel.I phoned the hotel directly some time prior to my intentioned stay to find they rudely told me to call Expedia, they do not know of a reservation and would not take the number as proof. I would phone hotels directly every time a reservation is made with a third party.

Just home from a 4 night stay at this hotel and we couldn't be happier with our experience. Staff at this hotel (particularly the guy called Joivannie, not sure on the spelling sorry) were so helpful as our airline lost our luggage on arrival. The hotel gave us a loan of phone chargers, let us use the hotel phone for free to call the airline and also organised a car service in order for us to get our luggage back. The hotel is in a perfect location, just off of times square. Depsite the noisy location, the street where the located is located is quiet which was perfect for us. The room was immaculate and the bed was amazing! We don't go on holiday to scrutinise the hotel room but it really was brilliant. Free breakfast included in our stay and there was plenty of choice every morning, as well as a member of staff on standby at the breakfast area who was really helpful!! Loved the boutique style of the hotel as we felt it offered so much more than any of the larger hotels. Can't fault this hotel at all as it was everything that we needed and the check out time of 12pm was ok too as there is a luggage room with an attendant so all of your luggage remains safe while you explore the city. Would definitely stay here again if we ever come back to New York. Just want to say a big THANK YOU to the staff on the front desk for being so helpful when we lost our luggage as it was really appreciated.

All the personnel at the Hotel are extremely helpful and friendly. Our room was clean and had all the amenities as advertised. The one drawback, the queen bed was really just a double bed, but not a problem. (They list queen beds as 60-70 inches, when 60 is a double). The continental breakfast was just that but good and the dining area was nice an clean.It is only one and one-half blocks from Times Square and is in walking distance to all the subways, theaters, Rockefeller Center, etc. Free wi-fi which is really good. Also has small fitness center.
user_name:
Vivian D
Volente, Texas, United States

review_body: Nice hotel, very clean. Our room was not that large, but clean and very appealing as was the bathroom. No view to speak of from the room we stayed in, but we were out in the city most of the time and certainly didn't pay for that kind of view. VERY close to Times Square - nice walking distance of a block to a few blocks depending on your theater/selection/restaurant. Nice continental breakfast in the morning.

I chose this hotel because of the location and reasonable price for a New York hotel. When I arrived to check in there was 1 employee at the counter, this person was responsible for checking guests in, answering questions and to assist with booking bus tours. The employee was helping a guest with a bus tour that took over 20 minutes while myself and a couple of other people waited to check in. I realize the hotel is small, however, should be more than 1 employee covering the counter. Each time I passed through the lobby, just 1 employee. The room was clean and small which was fine for just myself. Breakfast was included, which just okay. The location was very convenient. I would consider staying here again for the price.

We chose this hotel for our weekend getaway because of its close proximity to the Imperial Theatre in New York. It was lovely, and we would definitely stay there again. The front desk staff was very friendly and helpful. The room was compact (but we weren't moving in, just spending the night), very clean and quiet with a nice shower and continental breakfast. We felt very safe and comfy. Highly recommend for senior travelers. Did I mention there is an Irish pub across the street?

We wanted to try a hotel that was close to my son's college (Columbia), but also be closed to everything else. Found this hotel on Trip advisor and read the reviews. All the reviews said that the place was very clean. That's the number one priority when selecting. Rooms would be small, but that would not be a problem. Well, the room was very clean and small. So the reviews were correct. The people working there were friendly and professional. One of the reviews did mention that it was a little noisy.
