Since we were only staying over one night and we were exhausted when we came back to the room we did not notice any noise. Well, you got to remember it's close to Times Square so any hotel in and around that location will be very busy. I would definitely go back. The total price, which included a continental breakfast was $278 for the one night. The hotel actually gave us an upgrade which I think it was a queen size bed to a king size bed. The bed was very comfortable. So I think that is not a bad price for NYC. If you want to be around all the action Broadway at Times Square Hotel is a great place for a great price.

Wouldn't stay there again. Small lobby area and breakfast items were scarce. A huge mistake was made on our credit card and it was up to us to find a resolution. Also our traveling companions reserved and expected two twin beds but we're informed there had been a leak so two single ladies had to share a king size bed. Not a fun way to start our trip. When I overheard the front desk person quote 2 men a rate $75 less than our friends I was told that last minute guests get better rates than the ones quoted 2 months earlier

Fantastic location for time square and all the main sites to see. Booking was quick and easy and breakfast was good. As others say get there early as it does get busy. Room a nice size with New York not the biggest but clean tidy and good use of the space. Staff very friendly and good luggage storage until departure.

I stayed in this hotel in the middle of August. It was very good experience: room is clean and big enough. I think it will good for couple also. Free breakfast is good continental. For me it was enough. Staff is nice and helpful. Hotel is just few steps from Times Square. Very central position. I will highly recommend this hotel

We stayed at the Broadway at Times Square for an overnight family trip to NYC. The hotel is clean and it's a great location (half a block from Times Square!). Breakfast in the morning was decent- yogurts, bagels, muffins, cereal, frozen waffles/pancakes, cofee, tea.We stayed in a room with two double beds. Good size for a double in NYC. Only strange part of the room was the AC is low to the ground and is so close to one of the beds that it gets very chilly if you are sleeping in that bed.Overall a nice stay!

We stayed here last year and loved it. We stayed for 5 days. This hotel has a fantastic location, just steps from the center of Times Square. The staff were amazing, and so helpful. We had breakfast here only one morning as there was a lovely cafe just 5 minutes down the road. The rooms, while small, were extremely clean and there isn't very much outside noise. We would definitely stay here again. Try Carlisle's Italian Restaurant it's amazing, but needs to be booked in advance.

The hotel is clean and seems to have been renovated recently. They have friendly staff and the location is near Times Square. So what is the problem you say ? Well, the rate quoted for the room initially for a weeks' stay was from $ 124.99 to $ 224.99 per night and each day had a different rate. At first I thought that it might be because of the weekend but upon reflection the $ 124.99 and $ 224.99 both were on a Sunday so that ruled out the time of the week as a varying factor. The only thing that made sense was the expected occupancy factor. Since I made the reservation only a few days before arriving I was given a lower rate the first Sunday and a $ 100.00 more the second Sunday and each day in between a different rate.This practice I find very annoying and objectionable that I am paying a different rate each day for the same room and same amenities. I discovered the answer. I would call reservations every day to get a price quote for the remaining days of my stay and if it was a saving of $ 100.00 or more I would check out the next morning and then check back in - same room.On one occasion the front desk told me they could not check me back in because the hotel was full, to which I replied "no" I just checked out. They checked me back inAt times it is annoying to have to play this game but when the savings are substantial a tourist can well justify the process. If only the hotel would give a fair price up front for all the days a tourist is there then the feeling of being ripped off would go away.The last time I booked in for three days and I ended up checking out three times because of the large pricing fluctuation. Possibly if more travellers engaged in this process the hotel would reconsider their objectionable pricing structure and make it more palatable.

The hotel staff were AWESOME!!! Extremely friendly & helpful! The staff took very good care of us! 2 blocks from Times Square & extremely quiet! The parking rate for our car was the BEST we found! FREE breakfast (bagels, yogurt, toast, muffins, coffee, etc.) were VERY nice & the dining room was extremely clean! We wanted a fridge & microwave - we had them! Our room was VERY nice! We would rate it a GOOD 9 1/2!!! We will definitely stay here again!

Half a block from Times Square, 10 minute walk to the Rockefeller Center, great subway locations, 5 minute walk to the theatre, couple of pubs right the street...what else could a person need! Small room of course, but the bed was fantastic and the TV was top quality. Breakfast was simple which is fine with me. Wi-fi worked great. Every employee we talked to was courteous and helpful. Price was extremely reasonable considering the location to all the sites.

My wife and I stayed at one of the other Applecore hotels just down the street in May and it was a great stay. Broadway at Times square Hotel is outstanding. The hotel is just off Times Square. Front desk staff Jack was awesome. Staff member Sivibi who took care of luggage and gave us information awesome. Rooms were very clean and housekeeping was available when we needed anything extra during our two night stay. Do not waste money on the high rise hotels . This hotel is reasonable and will give you what you need in the city that never sleeps.

We stayed here in May, and although the rooms are dark, for NY it is a good value. Great location, and the free breakfast saved us a lot of money. We had a suite; a bed in each room, so my daughter had some privacy. I would stay here again. Got some wrong advice about which subway to take to the Statue of Liberty, but fortunately I asked someone else and we got there fine.

Me and my wife stayed there on 8/8/2015 overnight to see a show and take in the sights. It was perfect being literally 500 feet from times square. Staff was friendly and very attentive. The hotel validates the parking at the lot across the street for $26 which is GREAT for NYC parking on a weekend. Breakfast was included and great. Room was on the small side but very clean and had everything you could need in a room. stayed on 4th floor in the back of the hotel which was quiet. Would absolutely stay there again.

Very nice boutique hotel 500 feet from Times Square. Our room (king size bed) was small (as expected in NYC), clean and quiet. The staff was very helpful, knowledgable and polite. Parking is discounted, the lot closest to the hotel will not accept motorcycles and are extremely rude. The hotel manager arranged for parking at another lot very close to the hotel.

The moment I stepped into the room the smell of mold/mildew overwhelmed me! You could visibly see mold growing on the air conditioner so when it blew air, it blew mold spores into the room. The bathroom was so moldy it was sickening! It was growing in the sick and sides of the cabinet as well as floor and tub area. We complained and the management offered to spray the room. We checked out!

Trip with my daughter and I for her birthday. Location is 1/2 block off Times Square - between Broadway & Avenue of the Americas. Hotel staff were excellent from check in to leaving. Room was clean, a bit small which was fine for the amount of time we spent inside. Complimentary Breakfast was good, free Wi-Fi. Room rate was great. Walked from dawn to after midnight; no worries. Short walks to Empire State, Rockefeller, Central Park, Theaters, etc. Will definitely stay there again. We travel with backpacks so our cab driver recommended drop off/pick up on corner of 46th & 6th and walk 1/2 block to hotel. Saved us a longer and more expensive cab ride. Fabulous trip and one we'll always remember!!

This hotel was very convenient to everything we wanted to visit. This was our very first trip to New York. Great location, the rooms weren't big but who stays in the room in NYC. Hotel was clean and breakfast was good. Friendly and knowledgeable staff. Would stay again.
user_name:
Travis S
Clinton, Maryland, United States

review_body: Stayed for just one night....clean well appointed compact room and toilet...public areas look impressive...modern interior with bright colors....breakfast spread is standard...staff response pretty warm...wifi free... and of course....a block away from the Times Square..enjoyed my late evening walk ....will come back.

My wife and I had a reservation for a room at this hotel but when we arrived, we were told that there no rooms available. The hotel desk told us that they would find us another hotel to stay in but couldn't find anything for over an hour. When the desk agent finally said she found us another place, it was all the way across the bridge in Queens. This was not satisfactory as we were in NYC to do some sight seeing in Manhattan and enjoy staying near Times Square. So the search continued. Soon after that, a family of 3 came into the hotel and were given a room immediately. So much for having no rooms available. After this, I began to express my frustration in an appropriate but firm manner. Once I pushed on the desk agent a little bit, a room magically appeared for us and we stayed in the hotel. Once we were given a room, the stay was great. I just wish 1) the hotel would have warned us ahead of time if there were no rooms, 2) Given us the room that was clearly open before waiting for 2 hours.

Stayed at sister down the street and they were both clean and good sized rooms for nyc. 2 blocks from times square. Of course they breakfast was small, but very good to fill your void so you can have one meal that wouldn't cost 30 bucks. Was here for business with our attorneys, but will stay here when we are just in town for pleasure also. Front desk help much better here than down street.
user_name:
Dino G
New York City, New York

review_body: This was our first trip to New York and we found it daunting looking for a base camp from which to tackle the big city.We were lucky to have been recommended the Broadway@Times Square by our agent. The hotel did not disappoint and instead exceeded any expectations we had. On arrival we couldn't believe our luck when we found our hotel was literally on Times Square and could not be in a better place for exploring NewYork City. The rooms were spacious for its location as it appears many New York hotels have small rooms. The room couldn't have been cleaner and had everything we could have needed.We were pleasantly surprised by a few little add ons that we hadn't expected. Once we got to our room, we checked to see if there was Wi-Fi available and found it to be a free and open network. I have rarely found such a fast and reliable connection anywhere and found it to be more than adequate for streamingHD content, checking emails etc. the next big surprise was breakfast which wasn't advertised as being included. The selection was great and caters for any taste, the coffee was decent and free flowing and the staff were happy to help if your selection wasn't available.Overall the staff couldn't be more helpful and went out of their way to assist in making our holiday memorable. Whether it was directions, advice or helpful tips, they could not do enough for us.We are hoping to return to the hotel next year but really applaud them for a stand out service.Greig and Jemma

The Broadway @ Times Square hotel was a lovely stay. The bedrooms are simple, yet satisfactory. The bed itself, very comfortable, clean and hard to leave in the morning!I was disappointed at the breakfast on offer and the accessibility of it with the number of guests. It was simplistic, slightly stale & really just uninteresting. I know it's NYC, but paying $130 for one night, you'd hope the breakfast would be better.Otherwise, the people at the desk were polite, quick and a pleasure to interact with. The porter looking after the baggage storage did his job very well. All in all, a good stay, but dropped critical points in my rating.

Tried this hotel after staying in one of their sister properties last year. It was a great decision. The location is exceptional, the price great, and the amenities are plentiful. Free wifi, free breakfast and reduced fee parking right across the street. The rooms are small but manageable, actually you have room in front of the bed to move. The bed was queen size, very comfortable, great linens and lots of pillow. The bathroom was good size, with bathtub and hand held spray, but it was too short. Towels were thick and fluffy and changed daily. Liquid soap and shampoo, so if to do not like liquid, better bring a bar of soap. We requested a fridge and microwave which we had. Large flat screen TV with many channels including foreign. The lobby is clean and has seating area and 2 computers. The breakfast room is larger than normal and the selection of food was adequate to start your day, youghurt, breads, danish, eggs, cereals, coffee, and juices. 2 elevators and short wait time. There are 5 steps from the street so pulling bags is difficult, but they do have a wheelchair lift. If you are driving, as you pull into 46th st. from 7th ave, the parking garage is on your right. Do not pass it because you will have to go all around 3 blocks to get back. The hotel is on the left side of the street mid block. Have hotel stamp your parking ticket for a $26/day rate. Do not request top floor, 9th fl. as we did, because the air conditioning units are on the roof and they rattle on and off all night long. Also since the hotel is only 9 floors there is really no views other than other buildings next to you.

The best part of the hotel is its location...bang on Times Square...you just step out of hotel...20 steps and you are on times square ....rest everything is ok .... the size of the room are just ok..but u should consider u r at times square...where every sq ft counts...the staff is good......and very helpful....breakfast spread is ok...ok....nothing great about it....

Family had a 3 night stay, chose this hotel based on other reviews, location, price, and breakfast.We arrived early and they gladly accepted our bags. Check in was easy, desk staff was always pleasant. Room was on upper floor at back of building. We did hear music from adjacent bar at night, but we overcame that with our ipad white noise. Room was very clean, and was cleaned each day. AC worked great! Room is normal size for this type of hotel, a bit cramped with oversize tv cabinet.. Others mentioned slow elevator, not the case. it was fine.My only complaint was the breakfast, which I was depending on. It is very much carb loading. Not that big of a deal, but the pancakes and waffles are frozen, then heated by staff, then placed in warmer. Some then get cool and hard, some too soft. just was not good. Ended up going to Mc'D's each am. Some type of protein would be very welcome. Link or patty sausage please.We would stay here again, and recommend to others. One tip is that you should not expect a taxi to be available at the entrance. All the ones that drive past are occupied. Just go down to either corner.

My husband and I needed a place for a one-night stay in NYC to see a show--and Broadway at Times Square Hotel was the perfect choice. We like being able to walk to/from our locations--check (blocks from Grand Central, Times Square/theaters, restaurants--no need for the subway!). We like free WIFI--check. We like comfortable beds and clean, useful rooms--check. We like free breakfast--check. Our expectations were exceeded re: a peaceful night's sleep (even on the second floor of the hotel, not a sound from the street), a pleasant check-in experience (we got a free upgrade!), and a "Continental" breakfast that included yogurt, hard-boiled eggs, freshly toasted bagels, a variety of fruit and pastries, and plenty of coffee and juice. Best of all, the price is fantastic. Thank you, and we'll be back!

Great location clean rooms helpful staff nice breakfast found plenty to start thr day off What more do you need for a city break just a very short walk from times sq and a great base to visit all areas Did I say great location would recommend to all

Can't give enough praise for this neat little hotel one half block from Times Square which was a perfect location. We stayed for 4 nights in April post cruise to attend some shows and to sight see. The staff was very friendly and helpful. Upon our early arrival Jovanni noticed that my husband seemed extremely tired and he phoned housekeeping to request that our room be prepared next. The complimentary breakfast was good (included NY bagels!), the hotel was clean. smoke-free and very comfortable. The free computer time was a plus. Our room was on the 4th floor just past the elevators and was very quiet. There is a neat Irish pub directly across the street. We have stayed in other more expensive hotels in this area but this place served our needs very well and we plan to stay to stay here again next year.

Only 1/2 block from Times Square, easy walk to the theater district and great restaurants on restaurant row, and other attractions. This was a boutique hotel. We had a small room, with a king bed. It did not face W. 46th, so it was quiet, which was a respite in the evening when we returned from all the hectic sightseeing, etc. Very clean. The staff was very helpful, always nice. Small elevator, but it did it's job just fine. Free continental breakfast was mainly carb loading, if that's what you want (i.e. bagels, pastries, toast), yogurt, hard boiled eggs. But enough food to get one going for a full day of activity in this great city, and to save up to eat at one of the great eateries around the city. Easy walk to some great Brooklyn style pizza (John's Pizzeria) and IMHO the best cheesecake ever, Junior's. Free Wi-Fi. We would definitely return!

A clean and certainly well-located hotel, but the rooms are so small. Really small. But all the staff were very nice and accommodating and the location can't be beat. Breakfast was passable and gave one the basics. The price reflects the location and the size.

Recently stayed for a getaway weekend to see some Broadway shows. The location is GREAT and was just a minute walk to Times Square. This place caught my eye when booking because of the price and the reviews on its cleanliness. Our room wasn't ready early and before our first show in the afternoon, so they held our bags for us. The staff was great and so nice. They next day at checkout, we still had through the evening until we left the city, so they held our bags for us for the day. The hotel was clean (aside from some hair found in our bathroom and room) and felt safe. The room was also comfortable and didn't feel too small for NYC. The day I got home, I took their survey they sent me with just a few questions including best and worst experience. The hair was not a big deal, but I did mention it in the survey. Almost immediately, they sent me back an email regarding my concerns. I really appreciate a hotel that pays attention and assess situations right away. Definitely will stay here again and recommend that you do too!

My room was on the 8th floor & at the back of the hotel so although I didn't have a great view I did get a very good nights sleep because it was fairly quiet & really comfortable & once I had regulated the air con it was perfect. The bed was very comfy & the bathroom very clean. The room has a TV, coffee perculator & ipod docking station + free access to wifi. The hotel is literally just off Times Square & minutes walk away from lots of different theatres. I travelled alone to New York & got a taxi from JFK to the Hotel which cost $58 including tolls which I thought was very reasonable but on the way back the Hotel organised the shuttle bus for me which was half the price but of course takes a little longer due to other pick-ups. I felt totally safe walking around on my own & got to see everything I wanted to, would definately reccomend the open top bus tours. The hotel staff were all pleasant but I did think it odd that on several occasions I found myself sharing the one & only lift with housekeeping & a huge trolly of sheets & towels! Breakfast was a selection of bagels pancakes waffles, yogurts & all the usual but the only thing I felt let the whole place down slightly was the paper plates & cups with plastic cutlery which you deposit in a bin (Macdonalds style) when you have finished. It was great to be able to leave my luggage securely at the hotel after check-out & they kindly let me use the toilet to change in before departure. All in all a very good hotel in an excellant location at quite reasonable rates. Will definitely stay there again if I ever get the chance to revisit this amazing city.

Location is the most important point, Times Square is a 1 minute walk as soon as you exit the doors, Rockefeller centre is also close by. Room was good and comfy, lots of dining options nearby. Free breakfast and wifi. Only downside is the slow elevator but that could be as we were on level 8.

We stayed at this hotel for 3 nights last summer. We were less than 1/2 block from Times Square. The hotel was very clean and comfortable. We had a room with a king bed and it was very comfortable. Also was nice to have continental breakfast. Great location. Would definitely stay again

Liz from Apple Core Hotels - how many rooms did you have the flood in ?Because i had the same reason given to me by the front desk when i arrived in May 2015. When i asked for a better (or more than $150 / night) room FD guy said non left. I didn't care for the price because my business was paying for my stay in NYC. I was sent to a very bad hotel where i had the worst experience ever, no AC, no shower, sheets were used by previous guests. I paid $220 for another room and was promised reimbursement the difference $70 USD by a front desk gentleman. Haven't gotten my money yet from either "booking.com" not Hotel.

denied my reservation, because he sold my $250 room for more money !front desk staff awful - didn't care i was exhausted and sent me away !booked it for two rooms , did not have my room both days. Said there was a flood and they cant put me in a room because non left. I went out for a smoke and talked to the couple who walked-in and had a room for $375 ( probably my room)

Great location for Times Square and Broadway. All of Manhattan by taxi or subway. Clean facility, very friendly and helpful staff, and enough of what a hotel needs to be - shower, sleep and breakfast.

We have stayed at this location several times when it was under the Choice Hotels brand. Apple Core have upgraded the breakfast area although the free breakfast was nothing remarkable. Rooms are small but fine for a short stay and the location so close to Times Square is awesome. There was a problem with a second reservation when we arrived, but our friends were quickly accomodated at a sister property down the street where their room was larger and less expensive! The price has gone up a bit since our last stay but it is still a pretty good deal for the location.

This hotel is in s great location. In the center of it all. The staff were exceptionally friendly and very helpful. The free breakfast wasn't much but I enjoyed the toast and Oj. The room was small but perfect for 2 people. The restroom was a good size. Housekeeping was good. I enjoyed my 6 nights here and would definitely stay here again.

Big selling point was the free unlimited WIFI since I was there on a business trip. I arrived early so couldn't check in but left my luggage there. They offer a simple breakfast (bagels, coffee, etc) and there's a free mini gym. The elevator is tiny and a little old. Nothing fancy here, but great location, nice staff, and noise level was fine (given that you're so close to Times Square).

Broadway at Time Square made my life very simple. I went to NY by myself on a one day adventure to attend 3 Broadway shows, two on Saturday and one on Sunday, so I stayed just for one night. I arrived at the hotel around 10:00 am and a very polite attendant told me to come back close to 12:30 to try to have a room ready for me ( and they did had it when I came back). This is a very basic hotel, with nothing fancy to talk about but located on 46 street so close to all the Broadway theaters, Central Park, many restaurants, Bars etc, what made it totally easy for me because I didn't have to use the Metro or try to hazle with the taxis.The hotel room was normal size for New York, extremely clean, they have shampoo and body wash at the tube and body cream and hand wash on the sink, also a blow dryer and a safety box that worked perfectly. My room had a small refrigerator, coffee maker and the air conditioner that performed its duty with no problem also the bed was very comfortable. I was in room 702 facing 46 street, a little noisy but not uncomfortable, you are a few steps from Time Square but far enough to be able to sleep and rest.Breakfast is included and I might say that it can be improved with more variety but other than that, my experience at the hotel was great and I will definitely go back on my next Broadway "Marathon".

We totally enjoyed this hotel for its location, cleanliness, beds and nice showers. Staff were also friendly. The rooms are small - but then you are in New York - how much time are you going to spend there??! The location is close to everything- Times Square is a block, so many theaters also within walking distance. I had a sore knee but was able to walk everywhere we wanted to go- Empire State Building, Radio City Music Hall, Central Park, Intrepid, Museums. The breakfast was sufficient - bagels, cereal, yogurt, boiled eggs, milk, coffee, juice, fresh fruit- just perfect to start the day. We got there early and they kept our luggage till our room was ready. Will definitely recommend this hotel to our friends. And when we return will stay here, for sure!!

We spent one night in the midst of a weekend of Broadway shows and had a great experience. The room was clean and had all the needed amenities. On the ninth floor, our night was quiet and comfortable. The staff was helpful and friendly. Our request for a later check out was easily granted. We will go back on our next trip.

Great hotel, with very pleasant and polite staff that are happy to offer assistance. The hotel is situated a stones throw from Times Square, but despite that is really quite. Rooms are compact but have everything you need for an enjoyable stay, including a fridge, which was a nice touch. Breakfast is continental / buffet style and there is plenty of choice ranging from fresh fruit, yoghurts, cereal, pancakes, waffles, muffins and pastries, etc. If returning to New York, we would definitely look to stay in this little gem again :)

This hotel is such a great find. It's located about 1/2 a block away from all of the excitement of Time's Square, yet it's quiet (slept without waking up from cab noise), clean, has free wifii, breakfast, and national calls and it's reasonably priced for a NYC hotel.

Right in the center of all the action. Room was small but clean. Nice staff, sufficient breakfast and free wifi. Would have liked a king size bed but used Priceline so could not be picky. Hallways are narrow and only one elevator but we were on the second floor so we used the steps. Would use this hotel again!

Not able to check in early and a one small elevator were the only negatives. It was very clean, the workers were very nice, we were able to store our bags until check in which was great. Great location. Nice little breakfast. We only stayed a night, but very memorable.

Location, Location, Location! This little gem in Times Square had an excellent breakfast INCLUDED! OMG...WOULD SEND MY BFF THERE! Greatest show tickets from TKTS and it is next to TKTS, Broadway, TimesSquare, beautiful bedroom and bathroom, quiet inside and a location so perfect we walked to the West Side, East Side, Intrepid, Theatre, Macy's, Subway and Central Park!!! Price was so low I can't say it and they had PARKING FOR $26/24 HOUR PERIOD!!! We drove right up dropped the luggage, parked the car and hit the Big APPLE running....did not need a taxi and subway because this is the HEART OF THE CITY!

Great location in Times Square, superb (free!) breakfast, friendly staff. Rooms are small but well worth the price. Most have one queen-size bed, and most bathrooms have showers. Phone calls are free, and there's free WiFi.

A gem...half a block from Times Square. A small hotel but quiet and has everything you would need for a weekend visit. Room was small (but that is usual in NYC) but clean and comfortable. We had a room with two double beds, good size bathroom, in-room safe. There was a small area in lobby with two computers and a printer which was convenient to check-in with our airline and print out boarding passes. Breakfast included was a bonus! Would definitely stay here again.

We spent four days at the hotel over spring break. Traveling with two teens (13 and 16), it was a great location with wonderful night life. The staff was very attentive, the continental breakfast was what you would expect, price was affordable, very clean, and surprising very quiet. The church bells next door do ring each morning. We spent little time at the hotel, using it as a hub to change clothes and sleep. We would leave early every morning after breakfast, spend all day around the city, and returning each night around 11pm for great people watching. Walking distance to many attractions, and close to the subway. We felt very safe in and around the hotel. Parking across the street was discounted with validated ticket by hotel staff. A great visit to the city. Would definitely recommend Broadyway at Times Square for its convenience, affordability, and staff.

This hotel is quite small and the rooms are small as well, but still i really liked this hotel, the room was cozy and the beds where very good, and after long days with lots of experience and sightseeing in New york city, it was great to come back to a good bed for the night.The staff here was very helpful in helping us choose the right things to do / see, and they had lots of great tips and good knowing of the city.The location is amazing, it is just a rock trow away from the big awesome time square, it was like a dream, seeing this place in movies all these year and now be able to see it your self from a 2 min walking distance of the hotel, it was amazing.The hotel is pretty close to everything you would like to see, and the city is very easy to navigate through because of the grid layout. Be sure to take a night trip with one of the sightseeing buses, and take a day off if the weather is nice and visit central park.New york is a romantic and perfect city to visit as a couple, I will be sure to comeback, and I would love to pick the same hotel at the next trip.Only downside of the hotel would be the the breakfast, it was kinda simple.Great value hotel for the money, living in a hotel at Manhattan can be quite expensive,but this hotel give you a great stay for the money.Thank you for a wonderful stay at your hotel, best regards from Norway!

Located on 46th between Broadway and 6th the location is great. There is an ICON parking garage almost directly across the street that offers a nice discount for hotel guests, be sure to get your ticket stamped by the front desk. The hotel itself is on the small side like many in the city but we found it to be clean and comfortable. The lobby had ample seating and a separate restaurant that served a free continental breakfast until 10:00am. Closed the rest of the day.Our room was on the 6th floor in the back, the only noise we heard was the from the church bell next door. The room was small but larger than some others than I've stayed in in NY. There was enough room and it was what I expected. It was clean, well appointed and beds were comfortable with a choice of down or regular pillows. The bathroom was small but larger than most in NY. I like that they are being less wasteful using pump style soaps for the sink and lotion and shampoo, but wish they had provided a bar of soap for the shower. I would stay at this hotel again in a heart beat.

Just returned from NYC... Our stay started a little rough.. some problems getting price promised ....But with the help of Iovonne and Jovanni things were straightened up and they really helped make our stay a wonderful event The whole staff was great.. Will be back next year
user_name:
Ted N Linda M
New Iberia, Louisiana

review_body: This hotel is not safe. I was followed up to my floor and cornered in the hall by a man the staff later admitted was lurking in the lobby. Anyone can get into the elevator and go up to any floor without inserting a key card, and it's next to a church which has homeless men sleepoing in the pews.

An obliging desk clerk allowed us an early checkin and was very pleasant and obliging, as were all the staff we dealt with.As other reviewers have pointed out, front rooms get all the street noise, but it really didn't bother us. The hotel is surrounded by good eating places and about 100 yards from Times Square, close to the theatres, close to the hop on hop off buses, close to Rockefeller plaza and only 10 blocks from Central Park.Our room was what we expected for the price and location combination, not too flash but adequate. It has a fridge, microwave, iron, safe, bathtub, air conditioning and iPod dock.The wi-fi is super fast and reliable.Breakfast is available although it's only cereal,toast, waffles, yoghurt etc., but it's free and it's adequate. If you want more, there's plenty nearby.All in all, a pleasant experience and good value for a New York hotel in a great location.

Amazing atmosphere,friendly staff,spacious rooms,walking distance to most of attractions,free breakfast,tea,coffee and water.Saves u alot of money.lI stayed for 2 days in broadway hotel nd other 5 days in hotel night at same location bt there was a huge diffrence in staff attitude,room space.Although night hotel was more expensive bt it wasnt worth it nd i regretted my stay there after experiencing an amazing time in broadway hotel.

Little gem of a hotel just a block from the hub-bub of Times Square. Try to get a room that doesn't front on the street however the noise goes away late at night. Staff was great as was their service. I'd stay there again.

We happened to arrive in NYC during the heavy snow in February 2015. Upon arriving in the hotel, a member of staff greeted us and after asking if we wished to check in, helped us haul our bags up the steps to the hotel check in desk. We waited for a few minutes whilst another guest was being helped. The desk clerk was friendly and polite and made small talk with us whilst checking us in. We were inside our room within minutes and were pleasantly surprised how spacious it was as we'd read negative reviews about room sizes. Everything worked, the room was clean...look, we did the 'seasoned traveler' thing of peering upside down at the sink and the shower stall etc..and yes it wasn't 'brand new' looking, but it WAS clean and tidy and was cleaned every day whilst we were there. The hotel maids are polite and helpful too and replenished our coffee/tea etc daily too. I guess if you walk in like a hotel inspector then you can find fault if you keep looking for stuff but as a whole it was one of the cleanest hotels we've stayed in, and we've stayed in a heck of a lot of hotels. The breakfast room was open 24/7 and we wandered in at different times to grab a coffee or a free newspaper. It's a nice space to sit and relax if you don't want to be holed up in your room. The breakfast was okay too. Again we had seen some negative comments, but personally I feel this is harsh as the food offered (and there's plenty of it!) was of a very good standard. Again the staff on duty are helpful and polite. The free wifi never dropped out once in the week we stayed. The TV worked the whole time too. Only issue we had was our key which locked us out of our room one afternoon, but the cleaning lady and desk clerk sorted it between them and we were issued with fresh keys in minutes. Given the location, and having stayed at the hotel, I am even more amazed by the hotel, the price, the facilities, and the staff who helped us. They are a credit to the hotel and the company and helped us whenever called upon, right up to storing our bags safely for the day after we checked out. We used the free printing/internet on the computer in the lobby for printing our bus tickets to the airport, which was convenient for us. One other thing to note is that even though it is 2 minutes walk from times square, we had no issue with noise, either from the street or from other guests. On our next visit to NYC Times square area there is no doubt that we will stay at the Broadway at Times Square.

Stayed at this hotel for 2 nights just me and my son for his birthday...We had a good stay...we booked the Deluxe queen bed room at 139 a night with taxes it added up to 164 a night...It was exactly what the pictures looked like it was clean and all the amenities that was stated on the website was on point...the showers had a dispenser for shampoo and body soap which was great...For a mother and son stay we felt safe here and the location was so perfect for us just a short walk away from time square not even a block away...Close to subway on 49st...Breakfast in the morning was great had many different thing to choose from...I would recommend a stay here!!

This is a very good option when visiting New York: great location, very comfortable room and the continental breakfast is realy nice. We have already stayed there before and for sure will be there again in our next visit to New York.

Clean rooms and very helpful/friendly staff. A perfect location for kids. Enjoyed our stay and would go back again. Has a small workout room and decent breakfast. No fridge in room but I feel sure they would have delivered one if requested, we just didn't need it. Our other room had a fridge and microwave.

Room was clean, but a little dated. The front of house staff where very good, and very accommodating. Very good value for money considering the location. view was pretty bad from my room but thats to be expected here i suppose. the air con was also a little weak

Having stayed in NY 4 times now we have been looking for the perfect hotel both for location, cleanliness and most importantly value for money! We have finally found it :)Reception staff were very polite and friendly and allowed us to check in on arrival which was around 1:30pm. Gave us a high floor, back room (900) which was so lovely and quiet - exactly as per our request! Walls aren't very thick though so you can hear noise from the hallway and other rooms but we didn't have any issues with our neighbours. Room was of adequate size and extremely clean! They are by no means fancy or modern but that doesn't bother us - we only sleep there anyway! Breakfast was also great, continental with bagels, cereal, fruit, yogurts etc. free tea, coffee and water at any time too. Location was by far the best part of his hotel - just off Times Square! Perfect for us.

I stayed at the Broadway for one night in January, I have been to New York before and needed somewhere close to Times Square that was also comfortable after 3 weeks of camping and trekking. This hotel was it. I was within walking distance of all my favourite places, the room was the right size for just me and the bed super comfortable. Staff was friendly, welcoming and very helpful. They happily stored my luggage while I explored waiting for my flight home. It was a relaxing way to end a trip. I will definitely be back!

Just spent 5 nights at the Broadway at Times Square Hotel. I was there two years ago in the middle of remodeling, and still came back because I had liked it even then. The updates are very nice. The staff is welcoming and friendly, day and night, and, I mean, ALL staff. Breakfast is good enough that we ate there each morning. Although the hotel seemed to have plenty of guests, the breakfast room was only "crowded" one morning, and even then there was seating and not much of a wait to get to the toasters. The place is clean and comfortable, although the rooms are small. They are well-furnished, which does make for a bit less room to move around. Could probably do with smaller desk and TV cabinet. The location is terrific for attending theater, restaurants, shopping and subway. As two women traversing the streets after plays, we never felt the least bit inclined to need a taxi for safe passage. The areas around this hotel are well-traveled. Once again, I was in a room in the back, and it is so quiet! Don't know what it is like in a front room. This has been, and will remain, my top choice for NYC vacations.

We stayed here for 15 nights in Jan 2015. The location which is 100 metres from times square is ideal for basing yourself in Manhatten .Broadway shows are all within walking distance as are tour busses and the subway. The rooms are small but adequate if you don't want to spend all day in your room. our roomservice lady Christina was an angel. George the concierge was great and would do anything for us. All of the staff were friendly and efficient . We experienced blizzard Juno and my wife got sick but the staff were brilliant and our holiday which could have been a disaster turned out great thanks to the staff at Broadway@times square.

This hotel is so great for the price you pay. First of all, it's location is very central and perfect for travelers who are after the typical NYC experience. The hotel is less than 100 meters from Times Square which makes it very convenient. It is also only a street or two away from Rockefeller Centre and Fifth Ave. There are plenty of Subway stations close too, I can't really fault this hotel's location for my first trip to New York. The staff are extremely friendly and very helpful. They are more than happy to help with directions as well as booking airport shuttle services. The rooms are comfortable - nothing fancy but have everything you need for a comfortable NYC stay considering how much cheaper this hotel is in comparison to others in the area. The bed was large and comfortable, there's proper heating (a must in Winter), the TV has heaps of channels and the bathrooms are clean and functional. The only downfall of this hotel is the noise I experienced of a night. I know it's New York City - there's always things happening at all times of the day or night. However, a couple of nights it kept me awake at 3am (construction sounding noises, what sounded like garbage collection way too early in the morning) and this really frustrated me. Not sure if I would have the same experience at other NYC hotels as this was my first time in the city. Overall, a really pleasant experience and incredible value for money!

Awesome location right by everything. Beds was the nicest comfortablest bed I have slept in. Heating was great because of the cold snap we had in February. Free breakfast was nice. Free WIFI was Super Fast. Overall excellent. Only downfall was we was not aware we needed credit card to stay there we had to use our spending money as a deposit.

Large and comfortable bed with a warm blanket (not with bedsheet as in other hotels). It was very warm to sleep in february night. Clean room and beautiful design. The best location for New York - all the main attractions are within walking distance. Up to the observation deck "Top of the rock" 3 minutes on foot. Tasty breakfast. Free internet with good speed.Too small room. The hotel hold money on credit card even you pay by cash, it is very inconvenient.

I had a room reserved for three nights. After I booked this room I noticed there was a price change two times where lower rates were offered. I simply called the hotel and spoke with them and they gladly matched the lower rate without hassle.  My flight was cancelled after we were already on board the plane. This was due to an aircraft sliding off the runway at a New York airport. The airports were closed and there was no way to get to New York to honor our reservations. I immediately called the hotel to cancel the reservation. I was transferred and could not find anybody that had "access" to my reservation. My reservation was always available when they changed me to a lower rate. I finally was given a number to the manager and I left her a message. She promptly returned my call, but advised me there was nothing they could do because charges are made through the computer and nobody there had a way to override this. They charged me for the first night even though the airports were closed. The amount I was charged was approximately $25 more than they told me it would be.  Other attractions that I had non-refundable tickets for were glad to refund or reschedule me without cost even though those tickets were clearly non-refundable. They said they were aware of the airport situation and were glad to assist me. I had read several good reviews on this hotel and had plans on rebooking, but this kind of left me undecided. The airline and all other attractions that were prepaid understood and offered a refund or reschedule.

I have been lucky to sty in some amazing hotels with certain deals, allowing me to stay in hotels I would not normally consider. I booked this hotel without a deal but even at this price they exceeded expectations. People mention the lift is slow. Yes it is but that is the only issue. Given the location the room was spacious enough. You are in Manhattan, that is 7 hours sleep 1 hour for the shower etc in the morning and then get out there and shop, eat drink and see the world. The bed is comfy the room is quiet yet 1 minute walk to times square. The staff are helpful, nice and polite too. The breakfast is basic but at this price perfect. I stayed in hotels charging more offering no breakfast. No need to search any further book here.

Great location, couldn't do any better for the price. Yes, rooms are small, but perfectly adequate and clean. Bed very comfy. Breakfast was simple but Plentiful, you could have as much as you liked.Staff very helpful & friendly.I would definitely stay here again. We stayed for 5 days celebrating a friends 50th. There were plenty of bars and restaurants around. Would recommend Ruby Tuesdays for a simple American meal.We brought the metro card unlimited pass for 7 days which cost $31 each. It was worth every penny, you can use it on the underground and bus.Don't go to TGI Fridays for a meal it is very overpriced and not very good.

Hotel is very conveniently located in Times Square and 5 minutes walk from two subway stations, so very easy access to both downtown and uptown and within easy walking distance from Central Park. Room is nothing to write home about but at this price point it's more than enough. Staff are friendly and ready to help. Minus points are the bathroom, which feels like a portable toilet, breakfast is pretty basic and windows are draughty, which at minus 10 wasn't great and had to keep fan heater on at al times. Also, being first floor and directly on the road, it got pretty noisy in the afternoon/evening, with a rubbish track stationed outside for some heavy duty clearance two days in a row - so if you're planning to have a pre-evening pit stop, ask for a top floor room...

We stayed for three nights in January prior to leaving for a cruise. The location could not be better. For the price---it cannot be beat! The front desk staff were super friendly, helpful and quick to respond to all of our "tourist" questions. The bellman, George, was fantastic. As others have stated the included breakfast is basic but filling. Some have complained about the room size but I did not find them any smaller than the chain hotels in NY. The staff graciously allowed us to play cards in the afternoons and evenings in the "breakfast room." We would definitely stay here the next time in New York.

I just got back from a 5 night stay with my boyfriend and I've got to say, this hotel was perfect for what we needed. Hotel was very clean, staff were so polite and friendly and location was perfect. Breakfast won't win any awards but was definitely worth having in the mornings as was a nice selection and saves money for breakfast at least! The staff at the front desk were fantastic and even booked a taxi for our return journey to the airport when all we'd had was a passing conversation about it - was so helpful. Overall, we had an amazing time and would definitely recommend to anyone wanting to be at the heart of Manhattan whilst not paying a fortune. We would also stay here again when we return :)

I booked the hotel online based on the reviews i read. Some good, some bad.In my opinion is one of the best choices, within its rank, to stay in New York. Affordable , Clean, Excelent location ( 30 seconds walk to Times Square ), complementary breakfast ( simple yet enough - you would pay at least 15$ in the street to eat the same ), nice and polite staffThe room was spacious and clean.The only negative point it's the noise. Next to the hotel there was building in construction and they made noise always until midnight. The hotel was could have better soundproof windows.In my opinion it's a Very Nice Hotel.Recomend it!

We stayed one week in this hotel last year (20-27 March) and we loved the place! Just near of the famous red stairs of Times Square! The room was clean. The room isn't very big but the space was more than enough for us. The breakfast was Ok (we had already eat better but it wasn't the worse at all!).There are computers in the hall with a printer (very useful when you have to check-in online your flight and print the tickets). Very good experience!

big room, clean, great location, great staff. breakfast was too 'modest' but we had things to eat (it is not different from other hotels in NYC. we were in the heart of NYC. excellent wifi. I will for sure go back to that hotel and recommend warmly to stay there

this hotel was fabulous for a family of 5 .It is 2 mins walk from Times Square but in a very quiet street. It is 5 mins walk to subway, Rockefeller centre and to fifth ave. We had 2 rooms and although small, it was absolutely fine. The breakfast was adequate and it was actually great to stay in a small hotel. This is a great 3 star hotel and would thoroughly recommend to stay here.

My family of three stayed from December 26th through the 30th. The room was clean and comfortable. The location is perfect! The staff is very friendly and helpful. The breakfast is nothing to get excited about, but the coffee 24/7 is very good. We will be back.

We stayed for 3 nights in the middle of October and found staff helpful and friendly. We did have a problem in that the room was double booked and we had to go to another hotel around the corner for 1 night. Bit of pain as it was evening and we were tired after our long flight. But in their defence it was a holiday weekend and the city was jumping! We returned the next day and finally got our room which was fine with TV, fridge and coffee maker.Not much outlook but then that's NY! Bathroom was good, clean and always plenty of hot water from the shower. House keeping was great with room really well cleaned and fresh towels every day. Very good wifi in room. Breakfast was fine as well with cereal, toast, bagels, boiled eggs, pastries and croissants, tea, coffee and juice - nothing special but fresh, tasty and as much as you wanted. We would certainly stay here again. Location very good for Times Square and an easy walk to Central Park, Macy's and many other locations. Plenty of bars, restaurants, deli's and theatre district close by. Good value for money.

I was very very pleased with this hotel. I price scared me at first but we loved the hotel great value for money. We will always stay here. All the staff are friendly and helpful. Excellent location for Times Square and an easy walk to Central Park, Macy's and many other locations. Plenty of bars and restaurants.

My experience with "affordable" hotels in NYC has been spotty. However, this hotel will now be my preferred stay during my yearly visits. The location is unbeatable for theater-goers. My room was spotless and well appointed. Blazing fast free WiFi. All the staff are friendly and helpful. Prinkle at the front desk is a gem and accommodated my request for a specific room location.

My wife and I stayed for 4 nights at the end of November (25th to 29th) and found staff helpful and friendly. The room was small but adequate with TV, fridge and coffee maker. Bathroom was good and always plenty of hot water from the shower. House keeping was great with room really well cleaned and fresh towels every day. Breakfast was adequate with cereal, toast, bagels, boiled eggs, pastries and croissants, tea, coffee and juice - nothing special but fresh, tasty and as much as you wanted. I would certainly stay here again, just yards from Times Square and an easy walk to Central Park, Macy's and many other locations. Plenty of bars, restaurants, deli's and theatre land close by. Good value for money.

Pros: Excellent location - Helpful staff - Clean rooms - Normal Continental breakfast - Free Wi-Fi . Taxi service for $ 60 from hotel to JFK airport- Reliable driver .Cons: Narrow corridors - Furniture took almost all the floor space -TV at the side of the bed instead of at the front. - No heating in the bathroom.

For the price, it's a fantastic location. We were able to walk anywhere in the theater district. The biggest complaint is the noise. There was roadwork and scaffold banging starting at 7am each morning and would last until about 11pm! Had to sleep with ear plugs, not bc of TS noise either. Breakfast was yogurt, frozen waffles and apples/bananas. Coffee was gross. We ate out twice. Will stay somewhere else next time and a little further off TS.

With this hotel, you are definitely paying to be steps away from Times Square. The rooms are tiny (which is to be expected in NYC) but clean and our "view" was of a brick wall about two feet away. Our bed was always made but our sheets weren't changed in the 4 nights we were there. We always had clean towels. Our toilet got clogged several times...and it's not like we went overboard with TP or anything. (Perhaps just another expectation of NYC?) Breakfast was definitely lacking. Some pre-made baked goods and some yogurts and cereal. Meh. Staff was nice enough. Overall, with this place you're paying for the convenience of location.

Just got back from NY having stayed in this hotel.There was no hot water in the shower on our final morning before we returned to Ireland. When I phoned reception she seemed annoyed that I had called and casually suggested I use one of the showers in their other premises down the street. At $280 a night, I was not going to walk down to another hotel with all my belongings just to take a shower.When I went to check out, she said she could not offer me any discount on the room. Asked for the manager who had quite a righteous attitude and also didn't really feel any sense of responsibility for our situation. "The maximum I can give you is 10% ($28) off the last night" she said. I didn't have time to argue any further as I had a 7-hr flight to catch (unwashed!!!). Very poor attitude toward customer satisfaction. Had I stayed in a hostel I would have at least had a hot shower.The breakfast was also an abomination - all prepackaged synthetic crap - food-like factory products.The only positive thing about the hotel is that the beds are comfortable and its well-located. The male reception staff were generally helpful and friendly also. If thats enough and you don't encounter any issues that require you to interact with management then you will be ok. Jamie O' SullivanCork, Ireland

I booked the room in November, then saw the bad reviews here. I decided to keep my reservations and am very glad I did. The reception was great. We got in early, at 12:15pm, and got our room right away. The 5th floor, king room was fine. Facing the church next door. I was not expecting a room with a view so I was fine. Not as small as I expected. Very clean. The bed was comfortable. It was quiet, and there were no problems. Free Wifi. Continental breakfast was ok. Yogurt, cereal, toast, bagels, fruit, coffee, juice, hard boiled eggs, waffles. Nice eating area. A lot of guests eating, too. It was a good experience and I'd go back again and recommend it. Great location, just a half block from Times Square and short walk to Rockefeller Center!

Extremely reasonable, very friendly staff, clean rooms ... our anniversary/Christmas present to each other ... the only thing I'd change would be to add heat to the bathrooms ... other than that, I would recommend to anyone who doesn't want to spend a lot of money on a room in Manhattan ... walking distance to nearly everything in Midtown ... We thoroughly enjoyed our two-night stay ...

The Broadway at times square is a well located option to stay. The room is quite small but comfortable. Has a good standard breakfast and very near from Times Square. It's a quite difficult place to arrive by car due to the traffic jam on the area.

I was a little apprehensive prior to check-in not knowing exactly what I was walking into, but honestly almost everything was quite satisfactory for the price. I say "almost" because the breakfast was absolutely awful. Could the orange juice, at the very least, not taste disgusting? Wifi is complimentary and the location is fantastic. We didn't have to worry about catching a cab or taking the subway to any of the shows we saw during our week there. We easily walked to each of the theatres and were able to enjoy the tree lighting at Rockefeller Center. Sure, the room is small, but the room is clean and the location makes up for that shortcoming in my opinion. I've stayed in smaller rooms in London and Paris so I can't complain too much...but please, guys, fix that disgusting breakfast...

This has to be one of the worst hotels I have ever seen in new York ( my 6th hotel in new York) so i have seen a fewYes rooms are small in the city but this place takes the biscuit ....small isn't the word ..Yes you get free wifi but most places offer that too.. So don't let this sway you Breakfast ha ha what a joke .....free I know I would rather starve than eat that ..We checked in the only way to see what you get and checked straight out ..then went around the corner in crown plaza for the same price !!!! Different class totally3 hours we had our stuff in the room and they charged us for one night because we checked in how else do you see what the rooms really are like without checking in??????? and also our friends didn't even check in and they had to pay too 250 dollars each they robbed us out of the worst customer service ever Upon entering the hotel reception looked ok Just went down hill from there The room well even the porter said its small at least you won't lose each other you had to close the door to go into the bathroom .Went down to complain they upgraded us to a deluxe room what a joke it was bigger but that was all so then we decided we had standards we was not willing to slum it in this place and checked out the only thing in my eyes this hotel has going for it is location but if you have any standards at all don't stay here it's a dump

A small and friendly hotel serving a good continental breakfast, the hotel was right in the middle of the action with times square only half a block away, our room was adequate with coffee machine etc. the only down side was the lack of drawers so we just kept our clothes in the suit cases

We stayed at broadway hotel on 21st nov until 25th. Would definitely recomend this hotel. We were on the seventh floor, had a fridge in our room.Room was perfect, towels changed every day.We had a choice of complimentary breakfast, which we had twice on our stay.There was a good selection to choose from.Staff were very friendly and helpfull.George was lovely, we never got to say goodbye on our last day, as we were leaving before he came on his shift.Free wifi all over.We are thinking about coming back to nyc, and will definitely come back to this hotel. We have recomended to our friends and travel agents.Hotel is close to Times Square, great location.Jen and John Higgins

This was my first trip to New York for me and my 14 year old daughter. Stayed 3 nights. Great location, short walks to Times Square, Theater District, Rockefeller Center, Empire State Building, Central Park, shopping, restaurants, etc. Rooms are small but clean. Staff was always friendly and helpful. I would recommend this for anyone looking to spend most of their time out exploring the area, rather than those who like to relax in their room.

We stopped in this hotel on our first visit to New York. Very conveniently placed for sight seeing. Comfortable room, everything we needed. Staff were very helpful and polite. Breakfast good, once we got used to eating off paper plates and cups! Everything thrown in the bin, not good for the environment surely!. That aside, I would definitely stay in the hotel again.

excellent hotel,stayed for 4 nights,very welcoming,nothing to much trouble,very accomodating,lovely breakfasts,nice room beds comfy.only 1 minute from Times square ideal for our first visit and very close to all other attractions. will definately stay there again.......

recently (nov) stayed for 4 nights at this hotel, with family, brilliantly located, just off times square, the staff were excellent and very helpful. check in was quickly dealt with, even though we arrived late, we had a double and a twin room between us, beds were very comfortable, not much room though (too much furniture) but other than a bit dated, it was fine, lovely hot shower in bathroom. tv with lots of channels, coffee maker, phone dock, and good Wi-Fi.continental style breakfast very basic but it was all fresh and plentiful, yogurts, pastries, toast, fruit.George sent us off most days with a cheery quip, always left us smiling. for saying we were just off times square, we didn't find it noisy.for the price we paid, we would definitely return

This is the second time we have stayed here. Location is brilliant just around the corner from Times Square literally! The hotel is very clean and comfortable and all the staff are very polite and welcoming. Continental breakfast is included in the price and was excellent with a varied choice of food. Coffee is available all the time.

On Walking into reception its looks fresh and modern... But once the lift door opens onto your floor you will notice a difference. The corridors are narrow and well worn scruffy walls. Our room was supposed to be the best room of the hotel...I think not... the bed is large which makes moving around for two people difficult. the units were dirty, the sheets were stained, the towels smelly. The bathroom has two bottles fixed on the wall, shampoo and body wash (no nice toiletries) the rest of the bathroom was more like what I'd expect to see in a shared hostel or an old peoples home! Yes the location is good but there are much better hotels near by at little extra cost and with fab 4* rooms (as found because we didn't stay the night here.) I am a well travelled person and I understand budgets for holidays, but please don't think 'it will do' as we wont be in our room much, may I say this depends on the weather! So don't let cheap and dirty sway your normal standards. Oh and if you want breakfast you microwave it yourself as its kept in a locked fridge until morning.

We spent two nights at the hotel and found it great for the price we paid. We were on the 9th floor with a corner room, two double beds and an ensuite. The extra bed meant we could spread our gear out and it didn't feel poky. The location is superb being a short walk to Times Square and the Rockefeller Centre and Radio City Music Hall. Staff were truly helpful and cheerful - our favourite combination. The room was clean and we didn't have any trouble with noise as we were at the back. Continental breakfast was fine and being so close to the centre meant so many restaurants were on your doorstep. We recommend Ruby Foos for imaginative Asian cuisine. Great place to stay to be near the action of New York.

This hotel has great location in the heart of New York City. Some of the staff members were exceptionally friendly and helpful, while one was rude. The rooms are small, but clean. It was somewhat noisy from the rooftop bar next door, so try to stay away from higher floors.

The siting was very good, next to Times Square with easy access to restaurants and subways. Staff were knowledgeable and friendly. Hotel clean and well serviced. We had continental breakfast provided which was more than adequate.

Clean , very helpful staff, good breakfast included, around the corner from Times Square, a bit small but that's true of most NY hotels. I would stay there again.The bed was especially good.Desk clerks very nice. Comfortable place to stay

Stayed here with my husband for 5 nights from Oct 27th (from UK). Staff very friendly and helpful. Room was a decent size, so was the bathroom, both clean, REALLY comfy bed, not disturbed by street noise, aircon a godsend as it was really warm. Continental breakfast (which was included) was great, tea and coffee available anytime downstairs aswell as in the room with cups and lids available for guests to take out. Free wifi a definite bonus too! Only (minor) negatives: no view aa on the side, shower pressure not fantastic (we were on the 7th floor) and couldnt purchase any movies on the TV and the staff didnt know what to do either?Overall, we had a great stay and would definitely stay again.
A wonderful place to sty ,so central,close to metro ,times square theater district Can " t say enough about the freindly helpful staffIt was also handy to have breakfast included .saved a lot of time

The hotel is centrally located. It is a hop, skip and a jump to Times Square. The hotel staff are very friendly and helpful and the breakfast wasn't too bad.Free wifi but unfortunately our room was very small that you could hardly move and it was very dark.

Spent a week here. Location of the hotel is great and most major tourist attractions are within walking distance. Despite the bustle of Times Square our room was relatively quiet and opening the window did give a bit of fresh air (if not a lot of sunshine). A refrigerator in the room would have been nice though. Hotel is clearly on the budget side but everything was nice and clean. Hotel went through a major overhaul in recent years which has improved it significantly. Breakfast was not great but ok. Staff on the other side was very friendly and helpful!

I took my son to NYC for his bday and we stayed here for one night. It was half a block off 7th Ave and really prime location to everything we wanted to do. The staff was so friendly and we were able to check our bags into a storage room when we arrived early. We also could do the same when we checked out the next day and wanted to tour the city until the following evening. It was a huge convenience. The only problem was our room wasn't ready until 4:30 when we were told 2:00. So we had walked back at 3 to check in, then had to walk back out and just grabbed some lunch. Not a huge inconvenience but we had just really looked forward to getting off our feet for a bit as we had been walking for about 6 hours by the point. Breakfast was included, nothing spectacular, but good enough to get going for the day. The beds were so comfortable. I would definitely stay here again and would recommend it to others without question.

Just returned from a stay at the Broadway at Times Square.. Location is excellent seconds from Times Square, staff are friendly and helpful, breakfast which is included, was a welcome start to the day. Free coffee 24/7. Room was spotless and although small which is usual for New York it was comfortable enough..u won't go wrong with this hotel if you are looking for a comfortable stay in the heart of manhatten.

We stayed here for 3 nights in Sept. We arrived early before noon and within no time a room was ready for us. I believe we were in 603. All of the hotel staff were friendly and helpful. The breakfast was a great start to our day and the free wifi was perfect. We had a king bed and the room was more than spacious and offered 2 windows and was quiet. You are 1/2 block away from all the action of Times Square. The front desk staff helped us with tickets to the attractions we were interested in and booked a car for us to the airport. We have no complaints and would stay here again when I return, hopefully soon!

We know that New York is expensive, but I thought this place was hugely overpriced. We had a hard time finding it because the door looked like any other entrance to a living quarters. Once inside the hallways were tight and the maids and janitor used the same elevator. (One). We were moved out of our room because it was being painted. Our new room was tiny and the only window faced a brick wall. It was hard for my wife and I to move around the room and not get into each other's way. Some of the wall paper was pealing. It was close to Times Square and I did sleep well. It ended up costing in the high three hundreds with all of the taxes. I felt as though that was too high for a dark small room.

My wife and I stayed here in early Sept and found the rooms excellent ,and the service the same, the doorman went out of his way to be very helpful and his sense of humour was magic, the hotel is in a great position close to all things of interest, a little café diner called Evergreens is in the next street 47th street and is treat to have meals at great prices the breakfast is tops in all this was a pleasant stay and would recommend this hotel and will stay there on future trips

Our party of 5 stayed here for 4 nights in two separate rooms. Our reservation was made through New York, New York Travel and our voucher was accepted without a hitch. We arrived at 6pm and our rooms were ready and waiting. Staff greeted us warmly and made efforts throughout our stay to remember our names and preferences. One of our rooms was on the 6th floor and the other on the 3rd. We found the 3rd floor room to be quieter because it was to the back of the property. Our 6th floor room faced the front of the hotel and we heard a lot of street noise, but nothing we couldn't handle. The room were spacious by NYC standards, very clean, and well-equipped. Housekeeping came by daily and we never had any complaints. The free breakfast was typical and perfectly adequate for our morning start. Coffee was especially good! The best thing was the location: less than a block off Times Square on 46th street and an easy walk to most of our activities. The night staff was especially friendly and helpful. They arranged a car for us at a very reasonable price when we needed it, and became our information source for all things "New York". I loved the free Wi-Fi! Highly recommend this hotel!

After a long flight from the UK, and a long transfer from the airport, we arrived at the hotel and were checked in quickly. Our room wasn't ready but we were given another. We were put on floor 5, lovely room, right next to the lift which was handy. It was a small room, but enough room for the two of us. Unpacking may've been an issue but we didn't want to unpack. The bathroom had a shower cubicle and towels were changed most days. The bathrooms include shower gel and shampoo if you forget yours, smells great and appears to be skin sensitive. Breakfast was included in this visit. Help yourself buffet style, but there was plenty of it and a variety to choose from. I enjoyed breakfast every morning, and it was open for a few hours every day.Reception staff were very helpful and happy to book taxis and arrange airport transfers etc, and there are brochures in the entrance way should you need a map. Free Wi-Fi that was highly reliable should you need it.Location wise is fantastic. We ventured out in every direction outside the hotel. New York is easy to get lost in but we always found our way back to the hotel easily enough. Absolutely fantastic location. We really enjoyed our visit here. Highly recommend this hotel to anyone staying near times square.

I stayed here for one night only. The room was very comfortable and clean. The location is excellent if you want all the hustle and bustle of Times Square. The staff were very helpful and accommodating. My daughter was sick and I needed a heat pack warming in a microwave. I was told I could come down to the breakfast area and help myself to ice and use the microwave for warming the heat pack whenever I needed to. George the doorman was also very friendly and helpful.

My wife and I stayed here the past week for our anniversary. We arrived a little early and was told that our room wasn't ready so they switched us to a room on the second floor. I wish now that we had just waited for our original room. The room was clean and the cleaning lady was extremely nice and helpful. The problems started once we went to sleep. When my wife and I woke up we had bug bites all over our arms, hands and legs. I went to the front desk and told them about this issue and requested to be moved to a different room. I was told the hotel was booked and there were no rooms available. Every other hotel around the area was way more expensive. So my wife and I had to sleep in our jackets with the lights on for the next 5 days. I wasn't even offered a discount for the room. I have contacted the hotel chain and not received a response about this issue. The hotel seems like a really nice hotel. I just wish my wife and I could have had the same great experiences everyone else has seemed to have.

Not wanting to spend an arm and leg for a place to stay in NYC for 5 nights, I looked at all the chains in the area. Although this is a chain, it's a small one...unknown to me at the time. I booked our room at a decent rate for the area,after doing some research to make sure it got fairly decent reviews. It started out very well with the quick, friendly, efficient check in. It only got better. Since our room was quite small...not a problem because we were only in the room to sleep at night, we asked the bellman, George, if we could have an extra luggage rack. It was in our room when we returned from our first trip out of the hotel. George was always friendly, upbeat, and helpful. Indeed an asset to the hotel. There is another bellman who is equally as efficient and friendly, and an asset. The breakfast are quite routine, but hey...it's in the hotel and we didn't have to go hunt someplace else to eat. The Houseman handles the breakfast room, keeping it stocked, cleaned, and ready for all who take advantage of the meal. Another asset to the hotel.Our room was always cleaned spotlessly when we returned from our days outing. I can only say good things about all those who work at this hotel. We asked for suggestions for a restaurant a couple of times...got great ideas, and used them! This place is definitely a gem for the otherwise busy, very expensive, Times Square area. We walked to GCT and to our Broadway shows. It's in a perfect spot. I should say that anywhere you stay in NYC, you might want to have ear plugs just in case the noise bothers you. It's a busy, noisy city...no matter where your room might be. I am generally a light sleeper, but with earplugs I slept like a baby in the comfy bed. I've been to the city a few times before, and always stayed in one of the big chains on Broadway, never again....even though I might have free nights available. This is just a great place to feel 'at home' while on vacation. You are like one of their family while you're here. I saw them treat all their guests this way...so it wasn't just my husband and I.

Check in was very fast, even 2 hours earlier than the normal time; The rooms are small, but very clean and equipped will all you need for a short stay (nice queen size bed, nice size bathroom, coffee maker, safe, iron board, tv); breakfast is served near the lobby and there are plenty of seats available; staff is very friendly. Hotel located in Times Square, but 20 meters away, so the noise level is very low.

This hotel has the most comfortable beds you could ever wish for at the end of a sightseeing, shopping day in New York City. My family and I spent five nights in April 2014 at this home from home hotel.The hotel staff were friendly and courteous, nothing was a problem. A marvelous basic enjoyable breakfast awaits the traveller each morning. The location is perfect, so central, a stone's throw from Central Park and subways. Visit Bryant Park around the corner and have a coffee while savoring the essence,sounds and people of New York.This hotel is a gem, and shines bright with the New York City lights. Highly recommend. Go for it!

I was concerned this hotel was a little spendy but the location is worth it. It is half a block from 46th and 7 & Broadway. We walked less than 2 blocks to the Subway and within a 5 minute walk to everything around Midtown and Times Square. The desk people are very helpful. They even worked with our daughter before we checked in and flowers and a neighborhood diner gift certificate were waiting in our room. Great breakfast. Everything is very clean and well cared for. We would site see and have time to go to our room before the evening fun!

Location is unbeatable. We booked this recently as it was one of the cheaper options to stay and had good reviews. At half the price that other hotels in this area were charging, it was fantastic. Staff were friendly and helpful, breakfast was included and was nice. The room was very small and dark, but clean, comfortable and well appointed. Only metres from Times square and Broadway, it was walking distance to most places of interest. Would definitely stay there again.

We stayed here in March 2014. It was freezing weather (out first day had a top of -7 Celsius) but was lovely and warm. AMAZING LOCATION a 30 second walk and you are in the heart of Times Square. The rooms were small but very clean and comfortable. The size didn't matter, you don't go to NY to sit in a hotel room. The complementary breakfast was a good start to the day. The staff and the facilities were lovely, I will defiantly be back.

Very good hotel and a very pleasant stay. Don't judge a book by its cover like many buildings in New York looks a bit aged from the outside however very modern inside, staff extremely helpful and welcoming. The rooms have all the amenities and are very clean and well presented to a high standard. Rooms slightly on the small side however if visiting New York all you use room for is to sleep. Price includes a continental breakfast also with either scrambled or boiled eggs, waffles and pancakes very happy with.
