Located between 6th and 7th avenue on 46th street so is a 2 minute walk from Times Square whicH is very useful if visiting for holiday. Overall very happy with the price and the stay.

Me ,my wife and kids (21/22) stayed at Broadway at Times Square hotel during our trip to New York. We took 2 rooms and were very happy with the location of the hotel and the staff.The hotel is situated about 100 meters from Times Square and what else can you want.Though the rooms were small but that is New York for you, we did not mind as we were in the room for very little time. the hotel is not very big but the service was top notch,.The staff kept our luggage in the luggage room as we had a evening flight and allowed us to have coffee which is available round the clock to the guests even though we had checked out and really helped us with our taxi guy on our departure as he got late and it was nice to see the staff so involved in helping the guestsThe Hotel offers breakfast which was reasonable and considering the tariff and location I highly recommend the hotel

It is a great little boutique hotel. Although rooms are small, they are clean and comfortable and nicely decorated. The hotel staff was very helpful and the continental breakfast really added to the value. The one drawback, pay attention to the weight limits on the elevator to avoid being stuck. The location was very convenient to Times Square, NBC, Central Park, Macy's, and Broadway shows. I spent hours studying hotels before our trip, next time I won't need to - this place fit the bill.

This hotel recently renovated was a terrific find. In a great location value oriented for New York City a real gem. Great access to all New York City has to offer. Everything was just a train or bus ride away.

The hotel is steps away from the center of the universe (NYC in this case). Close to Time Square, Rockefeller Centers and major subway lines. Rooms are very outdated. Even though I know I paid for its location but i was very naive to expect the hotel would actually surprise me (in a good way). But for $300+ a night in the off-peak season, this is not what I'd expect to see.

Stayed with friends for 7 nights on a holidat form the UK. Small but comfortable rooms. Perfect location for Times Square and for walking to most places we wanted to see/visit. Staff helpful and basic breakfast a good to start to the day.

We stayed at the Broadway for 4 weekday nights. (See TIP at the end) The room was very clean, small and had trendy decor. It was just steps away from Times Square with all of its excitement and none of its noise. The bed was comfortable. The staff was very friendly. We enjoyed the Continental Breakfast which was a nice way to start the day and made the stay even more economical. The air conditioner was a bit noisy but that would not deter me from staying with them again or keep me from recommending the Broadway @ Times Square Hotel. TIP: book directly through their own reservation site or toll free # (not an internet booking site) as their listed price was cheaper than the .com site by about $25/day! (Sadly, we found this out the hard way!)

Quiet, clean and very accommodating. Very close to all Times Square activities, walked to popular theaters, easy to hail taxi. Breakfast served was very basic, but enough. Staff extremely friendly and confirmed our directions to our destinations.

Room was small, noisy air con, free wi-fi, breakfast so so.Easy access to times square and shops great bars across the road, friendly staff.Would recommend if only for the location, room was very small.

We stayed at the Broadway at Times Square Hotel last fall when we attended a concert at Radio City Music Hall. The location can't be beat. The hotel was close to everything. The hotel itself was recently renovated and very clean. The room was very small but the king sized bed was very comfortable. The complimentary breakfast was good with plenty of seating available. The staff were also friendly and eager to help with directions around the city. Have recommended the hotel many times since our stay.

We rented a 1 King room for $239/night. The price was reasonable considering we were only a half a block away from Times square. This hotel is in a great location for anything you want to do in Manhattan. The room was clean and decent size considering it is New York. My main complaint is tat there was no fridge or microwave. There was a cabinet clearly big enough for both. I'm not sure why we didn't have one but we didn't. This was disappointing as we ate at some great places in NYC but had to have our server throw out any leftovers since we had no way of keeping them.The front desk people were very nice and helpful. They arranged us a late check out, at no extra charge. They also held our bags for us after check out as we still had a few hours before we had to be at the airport. This was also a service provided to us at no extra charge.They also called a car service for us to carry us back to the airport. The car service was right on time and the driver was excellent.

A very comfortable hotel with the bonus of including breakfast.Very close to Times Square.We had a back bedroom, it didn't have a great view it was very quiet.Yvonne and Julio in reception were very helpful.

Breakfast basic and bad.The room was too noisy when opening the window if possible...and the badroom also when the lights ware on.Very friendly and helpfull.We'll go again for this price.Splendid location near metro and Times Square!

Great value for the location. Parking garage across the street and they give a discount. Stayed the weekend in a double room with a girlfriend and it was perfect for what we needed.. Clean good water pressure reasonable price. . Ask for a room away from the street. It's quieter.

Stayed two nights and it was great! We flew in early and had already been told by the hotel we could drop off our bags even though check-in wasn't until 3:00. When we got there our room was ready and they let us check in a couple hours early! It was unexpected and so nice for us weary travelers! The room was NYC small but more than adequate. It was clean and extremely comfortable. The staff was EXCELLENT!!! They were always so friendly. I will definitely stay again!

We (two couples) stayed here for a long weekend of theater going. The location is perfect for the Times Square area and the Broadway theaters. The hotel offers really no atmosphere, but is convenient and clean, with a very friendly and personable staff. Rooms are small but clean and comfortable. Continental breakfast, very adequate, is included in the rate, as are internet connections and phone calls. The rates are quite low for the NYC-Times Square area, and there are plenty of reasonably priced restaurants within a short distance from the hotel. We would certainly stay here again if we plan another theater adventure.

This hotel has an awesome location. It's located less than a block away from Times Square and other sites. It is an incredible value for the money. This is a smaller hotel with only 79 rooms or so, so it's not too overwhelming. As others have said, it makes a great base to do some NYC exploring. The hotel is near both the Orange Line and the Yellow line metro, which is nice, but you may have to walk a little ways (or transfer) if those lines aren't where you're wanting to go.The room itself in the hotel was adequately sized, with a queen bed, nightstand, slim dresser and table. It was also very clean. Nothing was outdated. Even the bathroom had ample space for the shower, sink (single sink) and towels. They have dispensers for soap, lotion by the sink and for shampoo and bath soap in the shower. The water pressure wasn't as high as what I'm used to perhaps, but nothing horrible. Also, the bed was not as firm as I'm used to (it seemed a little to "squishy") for me, but I slept okay in the room. Since this is a small hotel, you should know that it has narrow hallways. (I was glad I only had a backpack with me because I'm certain that anything more than a small carry-on luggage size suitcase would be difficult to fit width-wise in the hallways). The staff at the hotel was very nice and offered directions to anywhere we needed to go. Also, they told us about their free business center where you can make print-outs of tickets or reservations if needed. They also have free Wi-fi that worked great.The included breakfast was just okay for me. They had a variety of foods (mini-muffins, bagels, bread, pastries, a few cereals, yogurt, fruit, pancakes & eggs) but the pancakes were cold and the eggs were a little on the runny side. But...you can't beat it for something quick to eat before beginning your day. I guess if you don't expect that much for breakfast, then you'll be happy with what you get. Lastly, don't expect a view from your room, as this hotel is tucked in among other buildings, and there are only 9 floors, so my view was an office building (I was there to sightsee, so the view from my room wasn't important overall). At any rate, this was a wonderful spot for me to stay during my "getaway" to the city. I would stay here again.

The Broadway @ Times Squares is literally within walking distance of Times Square and given it's location, is an incredible value for money. I have stayed at three of the Applecore Hotels and they are all clean and comfortable. The Broadway has clean rooms that are small, but on a par with NY or European sizes, and everything is modern. The bathroom had good water pressure and standard amenities. The free breakfast is good for bagels, fruit and yogurt, but the coffee and eggs were below average. However, there is free coffee and tea in all the rooms. Wi-fi was fast and there was free copy the newspaper. I like these hotels because they are great for budget travelers who have outgrown hostels and require a bit of style.

A great location for the sights and sounds of time square. Our room was relatively big for NYC centre hotels. They have a nice free breakfast from 6.30 to 10 so no need to be up at the crack of dawn if you don't want to. A good spot if you're there to crash and go see some sights.

Location, location, location - the hotel has it. The hotel staff were courteous and helpful. The room price was OK. The rooms were OK, my only complaint was that I could clearly hear outside noise from a nearby club....but I still slept fine. The continental breakfast was OK....sorry, but please use real milk because what I tasted appeared to be watered down powdered milk! All that said, for the price and location....the hotel is acceptable.

My teen daughter and I stayed here last week for 4 nights. This hotel was wonderful!!! It is right off of Times Square but hidden away. The room was big enough for the 2 of us and was very quiet. If I was ever to visit NYC again I would definitely stay here. I would recommend this hotel to everyone.

When we arrived at the hotel at midnight, we were told that we were being upgraded into The Premier part of their hotel next door. We were skeptical but wee every pleasantly surprised.The room was large, we had complimentary wifi, continental breakfast and happy hour.The staff were friendly, helpful and professional.The location was excellent. We really couldn't have had a better experience and would return to the hotel next time we go to NYC.

The hotel is very near to square garden. But the hotel has very small rooms and olds. The hotel made reparations since 1am until 4am. Only stoped when I told rude With the workers. I can't sleep all nigth and the Manager was very unprofessional at that moment. She didn't care about the problem.

This is a wonderful hotel just a half block off of Time Square. You get the perfect location and atmosphere of TS without paying the huge price! The rooms were adequate size and clean, they also provided a free continental breakfast which is extremely rare in NYC-it was not fantastic, but certainly enough to get you out the door and on your way to the many sights the city has to offer. I visit NYC about every 2 years and will definitely make this my destination hotel!

Location, Location, Location, that is the over-riding draw for this hotel. That said it has much more going for it as well.The room was very nice and clean, not so big, but for the price was very good value we thought. Add to that a complimentary breakfast and free tea and coffee on tap 24hrs a day, this in a city where you pay over the odds for everything. We had a street facing room which was a little noisy, though it didn`t stop us sleeping after a busy day sight-seeing.The staff were superb and could not do enough, we were able leave our luggage safely on the last morning and also had access to a bathroom to get a wash and changed in before leaving for the airport. All together a wonderful trip to the Big Apple!

Just back from a stay at the broadway for my daughters 18th birthday present, and we had a fabulous time - all the staff were really friendly and helpful, couldn't do enough for you - the rooms were 'compact and bijoux' but clean and comfortable, with tea and coffee facilities and a free safe. This hotel is literally two trips and a stumble from Times Square, in saying that it's really quiet, we had no noise at night, though perhaps being at the back helped!Continental breakfast, toast, bagels, fruit, cereal etc as much as you want. Free wifi to upload your photos plus access to two macs in reception. It would have been nice to have a bar there, but there's a nice little Irish bar across the road and TGI Fridays two doors up so we coped!We booked via booking.com and everything went smoothly - did loads of checking on review sites and can honestly say there was nothing to worry about.We recommend it and would definitely go back again

This hotel was very accommodating, especially considering that I had booked the hotel online months ago with a credit card that had been hacked, and of course, cancelled. The reservation didn't go through because of this, but they still had a room for us, and they even gave us the same price! The room was very nice, and it was very quiet. I would highly recommend this place, especially considering it's proximity to Time Square.

Great little boutique hotel tucked away on a (relatively) quiet street in the middle of Tines Square. Small by comparison with less than 100 rooms, the feel is warm and personal. Fantastic staff who are polite and accommodating. The rooms are not huge, but not too small either. Lots of room to move about with desks, in room safes, small but workable bathrooms, nice beds and linens. Very clean! The daily breakfast is average, but probably saves $20 per person or more each day by eating in. I've stayed in numerous NYC hotels and for my next trip, I will be booking here again!

From the moment we walked into this close to Times Square location we were made to feel welcome. Everything is very clean and everything works. Morning breakfast is good and saves you lots of money compared to buying on the streets. Kind of limited offerings but includes the staples such as toast, bagels, sweet rolls, muffins, yogurt, coffee and juices. Room was spacious for NYC.Price was comparatively good.Great location.Probably the only negative I can think of is there is only one ice machine and it is on the first floor.

Our best hotel experience EVER. Seriously. Perfectly located less than a block from Times Square. Rooms are pristine. Comfy king size bed. Common sense things: Free wifi without even a password, no annoying minibar crap, amazingly helpful front desk staff to provide excellent advice on restaurants and things to see and do. This place is perfect in every way.

The staff was very helpful and pleasant.The rooms are tiny, but I guess that for these prices and location it's acceptable.The place was quite clean, even though in the corridor and room the general feeling was a bit shabby.Breakfast was horrible.the bagels were not fresh, hard boiled eggs were cooked to death a few days prior to serving ( I personally saw the plastic bag with the eggs two days before they were served), and all the other bread or pastries had also the feeling of yesterday's stuff.The location is great.you only take two steps and you're in Times Square. But still the hotel is not inside all the crowd.Nearby there are places to eat 24 hours a day, and all broadway shows are within a walking distance.

We just returned from a 3 night stay at this hotel. You can not beat the location. Just a half block from the center of Times Square. The hotel is very small, rooms are small, but this is how most hotels are in NYC, especially the older ones. If you are doing NYC right, you are never in your rooms though. The entrance to the hotel is very nice and clean. Breakfast area was nice as well, but the breakfast definitely left a lot to be desired. We were located in room 908, which is the top floor in the back of the building. There is a roof top bar at the back of the building and you can hear people talk and the music going to late into the night. Never really heard any noise from other rooms though, that is a plus. The only real complaint we had about our room was the damp musty smell. It hit you as soon as you walked into the room. You could see signs of moisture and mold in the bathroom. The window in the bedroom constantly had condensation on it. This definitely bothered my wife more then it did me. The water pressure was also terrible and our tub didn't drain well. I just chalked those up to being a really old building. I think 90% of this buildings/rooms problems could be fixed with new windows. I really think this would fix the moisture problem and the noise problem you have read in multiple reviews. Overall it wasn't terrible or great. I would probably look for a different location when we come back to the city. But you really can't beat the price and location of this hotel.

Location, location, location. Yes, the Broadway at Times Square occupies prime NYC real estate, and as mentioned in previous reviews, it is clean and quiet with friendly staff. Those are the plusses. Minuses - room size. My bff and travelling companion suffers from claustrophobia and was very uncomfortable. We seriously had to horizontally edge our way around the beds to reach the bathrooms; the beds were so close to the bureau that it was not possible to open the drawers more than a crack. The bathroom, however, was a decent size and there was a sufficiently sized closet. The business center was also a minus. It proved impossible to print up our boarding passes for our return flight - very non user friendly. A solo traveler would probably be fine at the Broadway at Times Square, but I cannot imagine more than two people sharing a room that size.

Stayed at Broadway. Great location just off Times Square. very central. Staff all very helpful and welcoming. Everywhere is spotlessly clean. We had room at the back it was unbelievably quiet considering the location. Rooms not huge but adequate and comfortable. Breakfast is a bonus. Help yourself and plenty of choice. I would recommend this hotel to friends.

We stayed at this hotel for two nights in January 2014. As we were on a budget we were a little worried about the quality of the accommodation, however we were pleasantly surprised with the comfort in the rooms. It was one of the coldest weekends in NY however the room, although small, was warm and comfortable. The location was great for both Times Square and Central Park and many other Manhattan attractions which, if you like walking, are all within walking distance. The breakfast was very basic and all on throw away plates and cups, but sufficient to satisfy and set us up for the day.

We are a family of 4 and stayed for 7 nights at this hotel in January 2014. The location is fantastic - so close to Times Square! We had a 2 queen bed room that was not much larger than the 2 beds and 2 draw units, however we managed to find space for everything. The room remained a bit too hot even after the staff had adjusted the temperature for us, however we still managed a good sleep each night after big days exploring NYC. Everything is easy to get to from this location. The hotel provided a great breakfast to get you going each morning, and the breakfast room was very comfortable and supplied were always kept up. The hotel is clean and the staff are helpful. Would definitely recommend this hotel to anyone looking for fantastic value and a great location. We would stay here again.

We stayed here May 30, 2014. This hotel has very small rooms. That's all you need because you are not in your room much when you visit NYC. It is clean and the front desk is personable. It is literally around the corner form THE Times Square. We were in room 608 and heard music and laughing from a nearby bar. The A/C hum helped to muffle the sound. Beds were fine. The breakfast consisted of yogurt, waffles to microwave, boiled eggs, bagels and more. The coffee is delicious. Check out at noon.

Stayed for 5 nights in May 2014.Perfect place when coming for Broadway shows /just behind the corner/ - no problem to get into bed very quickly.Good price.Perfect two double beds for two people.Close to the Central Park.Most of Manhattan attractions /museums, Empire State Building, St. Patrick´s Cathedal.../ are within the walking distance.Competent staff.Sufficient breakfast.

Just want you might want, it worked perfectly for us. A very comfortable and quiet hotel just seconds from the very heart of Times Square. You could be sat on those 'red steps' within a couple of minutes! So the rooms are small, its what we expected, the bed so so comfortable and that's a real bonus. As everyone says the staff are friendly and helpful, breakfast is very adequate and it's good that you can get some fresh fruit and yoghurt, or eggs and toast etc.. Coffee available during the day is really useful when you get in, also coffee making facilities in the room. Couple of bars opposite were very convenient for a drink. We were on the 8th floor, it was quiet and we never had to wait long for the lift, if at all. Spent 4 nights in May and would be happy to return.

this hotel has changed hands since my first visit but the standard is still excellent if anything it was even better than our first visit. The hotel is just yards from Times Square but very quiet, only 9 floors high so not long to wait for the lift. room was a reasonable size especially for the centre of Manhatten. Near all the attractions, Bed was so comfy you could not fail to sleep, although the aircon was quite noisy it may bother some people. Bedding and towels all lovely and clean and regularly changed. Complimentary breakfast was really good and was served from 6am to 10am and there were never any shortages no matter what time you went in, the breakfast room has been extended since our first visit so has room to accommodate all the guests. Staff pleasant and overall good value for a city centre I had no complaints at all and the location is absolutely brilliant with everything you need on the doorstep including a couple of bars and restaurants almost next door.

The rooms really are tiny (ever seen a stateroom cabin on a cruise ship?).However, they are clean and the beds are comfortable. Front staff was friendly. They overbooked the room we reserved, but accommodated us anyway. Breakfast was not very good. Frozen/microwaved eggs, frozen/microwaved pancakes, instant/powdered skim milk (blech), generic cereal... The apples and bananas were good. Free wifi was easy to connect to, fast, and reliable. Overall a good value at $100 less per night then the competitors. The savings was applied to a really nice dinner with lots of sangria!

We stayed here for 3 days and the staff were wonderful, room was nice, small but cosy, very close to timesquare, a minutes walk, breakfast here was lovely with complimentary paper to read, whenever we went out we were allowed to help ourselves to tea and coffee facilities when we arrived back to hotel, will stay here again next time we go back there again.

This hotel gives you everything you need. Not luxury but clean and for us it was all about the location, breakfast was also included. 1 minute walk from Times Square. They also have computers which are available free of charge - very handy. Staff were friendly and helpful.
user_name:
Karen P
Earls Colne, England, United Kingdom

review_body: As others have commented, this hotel is in a great location and overall was a good hotel. I had made a reservation last October for May 3rd (Sat) to May 6th. Because of airline changes to our flight we did not arrive until midnight on the Saturday- I emailed the hotel the week before our arrival re our late arrival (and received a confirmation back) and also phoned the hotel the day before and they confirmed they knew we would be arriving around midnight. As well I noticed that the first night's charge had been preauthorized on my credit card. Needless to say I was very unhappy when we arrived at midnight (after travelling over 12 hours) only to be told there was no room for us and that they would pay for our cab to a pre-arranged Chelsea hotel (and they paid for a cab back the next morning). I learned that 2 other couples arriving late that night had received the same treatment and that this policy of overbooking on weekends had been going on for months.This is not right and for this reason I will never stay at this hotel again, nor would I recommend it.

Our first trip to New York and this hotel is a great location, near time square. We had a little misunderstanding with our rooms, but Jovannie sorted it out quickly and was very helpful and gave great customer service. Thank you Jovannie! All staff were very friendly and helpful. The rooms are small and very clean, but you are in New York City with a great location with easy access to all attractions. Added bonus to this hotel is the breakfast of yoghurt, fruit, cereal, bagels, pastries eggs etc and plenty of coffee, tea and fruit juices. Would go back to this hotel. We stayed from 7th-10th May.

The hotel in a central area can get to many places by walking. Room is small could not open drawers all the way bed/ furniture in the way ,but very clean. Window view was brick wall across alley. breakfast was good eggs, yogurt , frozen waffles & pancakes with coffee & tea 24/7

A nice hotel in a quiet street just off Times Square.We stayed there 6th-9th May and were more than happy.The rooms were on the small side but clean and comfortable.The staff were pleasant & helpful and arranged airport transport when we left.This hotel is in a great location for all attractions,bus tours and the subway.Breakfast is basic but adequate with free tea & coffees 24 hours.I would recommend this hotel to anyone visiting New York for a few days.

When booking our first visit to New York my requirements for our hotel were that it was close to the tourist attractions, safe, clean and in budget. This hotel ticked all those boxes and we stayed here for five nights. The hotel location was perfect, straight into Times Square and close to the subway stations. We were on the 9th floor and never had a problem with waiting for the lift as some other reviews mentioned. Our room was a large king room with a spacious bathroom. We had a lot of luggage as we'd travelled from the UK and were then heading to Mexico but the room had a large storage cupboard which held our two large suitcases and backpacks as well as space to hang clothes. There was also a free to use safe in the room. The bed was huge and the room was very quiet considering how close to Times Square we were. The window in our room overlooked other buildings so we did not have a street view and I would imagine the rooms overlooking the street would have been much noisier. We didn't use the air con so can't comment on that.The reception was always staffed and they were very friendly and helpful.We had breakfast twice and it was OK, basic but served it's purpose when we had a couple of very early starts.I would recommend this hotel to family and friends and wouldn't hesitate to book here again.
user_location: Yorkshire Dales National Park, United Kingdom
user_name:
SGPW
Yorkshire Dales National Park, United Kingdom

review_body: Good hotel in an incredible location! The hotel is literally around the corner from Times Square, down a road which is quiet considering it's location close to the madness of Times Square.We stayed in a king size bed room at the back of the hotel. You don't get a view out of the window but when your in the room so little it's not a big deal!Our only problem we had was on our final night. We were woke up at 4am to two guys banging on our door. One american guy was helping a swedish guy who was drunk and completely out of it. Unfortunately the only information the drunk guy was able to give his new friend was the room number. The only problem was it being the wrong hotel and our whole corridor was woken up by someone who shouldn't of even got past reception. The receptionist was very apologetic and I understand they made a mistake but security over night is something they should take a bit more care with. Checking a name or even a guests key card is a simple measure of security.Regardless of this we had a wonderful stay at this hotel and the staff were very friendly, location excellent and rooms ideal for a city break.

Stayed at this hotel for 4 nights last week and I loved that it was just steps from everything at Times Square. The room was very small and we climbed over one bed to get into the bathroom as it was easier than trying to get by a big chest of drawers. The controls for the air conditioning were almost impossible to reach and you had to be really very flexible to get to it. A bare bones continental breakfast was included and most of the people staying there were European and by their standards this place was "gold!" The hotel across the street was $449 a night and our room was half of that! The front desk staff were very friendly and truthfully, we only slept there! The maid was very nice, the room clean and location perfect. There was a small store across the street with water, soda, wine and snacks. There is a beautiful Episcopal Church next door but sadly there were drug addicts laying on the steps 24/7 and you do have to pass by them to gain access to the hotel. The hotel has a car service which we took to JFK for the same price as a taxi. Use it, lots of room, great driver and fast service! Would I stay there again? Absolutely.

The property is only a block off of Times Square. This hotel has 9 floors and one elevator. I travel on business to NYC and like to find properties that offer good locations clean rooms and good amenities for prices below the branded hotels. The rooms are small like most NY hotels but very comfortable. Bathroom was small but very functional. Internet was free and worked well with a VPN connection. Breakfast is included and is average compared to other breakfast included hotels.

Great little hotel just off Times Square. Close to everything. Our room was very quiet - the air conditioner worked quietly. The staff was friendly and the continental breakfast was great and the room was spacious and kept clean and we'll stocked. There was only one elevator, but it is a small hotel.

This is a great hotel that offers great value. Yes the rooms are small. But it is honestly the best sleep at a hotel that I have had in awhile. Visted May 4-7th and the hotel was full. You would not know it though. It was quiet (I had asked for a room not facing the front street). They also made a great effort and had allowed me an early check in after a long overseas flight. Very good reception staff. I know there are other hotels that have larger rooms and more amenities but this was the best price out there and was good value. There are no fridges in the room which was mildly disappointing. They had an included breakfast but I didn't take part so can't give a review on that. Half a block from Times Square and felt very safe as a woman traveling alone.

Just got back from New York. Stayed seven nights, Had room on the sixth floor, staff are very welcoming. Wifi worked well, Hotel is just found the corner from Times Square wanted to near Times Square which was perfect. I would book here again.

We stayed as a couple in Feb 2014. This is a nice, small hotel right in the heart of Times Square. We were on the 7th floor at the front of the hotel and it was quite noisy from the traffic. Having said that, I would still stay here again! Wifi worked perfectly throughout the hotel and is free and the free breakfast is adequate and sets you up for the day. Overall a good hotel with friendly, helpful staff.

A three night stay at this hotel was epitomised by the friendly welcome by the staff. Located on W46th Street a couple of hundred yards from Times Square, the hotel's position could not be better for many of the attractions in and around Times Square and is opposite O'Brien's Irish Pub, a good watering hole. Our room on the sixth floor was small but, by New York standards, of average size. A comfortable queen bed and good sized TV, together with coffee maker and an ice bucket (ice available on the ground floor) were all provided, but no fridge. Free wi-fi was available throughout the hotel and two computers in the lobby, complete with printer, allowed us to check-in for our return flights and print our boarding passes before departure. The bathroom was of reasonable size and included a walk-in shower with glass door. Shower gel, shampoo and soap dispensers were provided and kept topped up.Breakfast was included and was an enhanced self service continental type with scrambled eggs available as well as the usual muffins, bagels, toast, cereal and yoghurt. All supplies were rapidly replaced with fresh produce as they became diminished. Coffee and tea is available 24/7 from the breakfast room.The best thing about the hotel was the staff. They could not have been more helpful and friendly passing on tips about transport and where to find various local amenities. The staff even advised us to purchase a phone card at $5 rather than use their own costly in-room telephones! We were also advised to take a minibus to Newark Airport on our departure at a cost of $25 per person rather, than a taxi at $90 plus tolls. This proved to be a great saving and was an excellent suggestion, the driver dropping us off at the correct level at the correct terminal.All-in-all this was an enjoyable stay made more so by the attitude of the staff. I would definitely recommend to others.

Having stayed in Times Sq previously I was hoping this hotel would live up to expectations and it certainly did . The hotel is 100 yrs away from Times Sq. The check in was smooth and room was spacious for NYC (807)unfortunately it was also about 20 yards away from a rooftop nightclub which given that it was bank holiday weekend wasn't good . However reception staff were very appreciative of my concerns and we were moved to a quieter room immediately. The breakfast is good value and adequate. The decor in the lobby and rooms is contemporary and the hotel was spotless during our stay. The reception staff were very helpful with advice and the free wifi was a great advantage for checking out and booking tours , shows etc, on line with the ability to print off tickets. Would definitely recommend to friends and family and would stay here again ..

We stayed in this hotel for 5 nights in April. The location of this hotel is fantastic. Just steps away from Times Square. We never had to use public transport once other than HOHO bus. Everywhere we went was walking distance. Complimentary breakfast was great, we had toast, cereal, pastries, yogurt and fruit with orange juice every morning. Tea and coffee is available from breakfast room 24 hrs to take away. Free WIFI was excellent and worked everywhere in the hotel. There is 2 computers in the lobby with a printer which was great for printing directions etc and was free also to use. Lobby is very nice and modern. Staff were helpful. We stayed in room 308 which had 2 queen beds. Beds were very comfortable.The room was small but we have stayed in smaller. It was clean. Bathroom was fine no problems with shower etc. has a good hairdryer.Plenty of fresh towels every day. Didn't hear any noise from our neighboring rooms. No noise from outside. Room has large flat screen TV which we would have had on for a total of about 10 mins on our whole trip! No view out of window but we weren't here to look out of the window! Overall no complaints, great value, great location and would definitely recommend to others.

Reserved for 8 nights. Party of 4 adults (one with walker) checked into room 208. Could barely get luggage into room. No where to unpack. Furniture took up almost all of floor space. Had to walk sideways past ends of beds to enter bathroom. Two large pieces of furniture with surface space but no drawers crowded the room but gave us no place to unpack clothing. Narrow hall led to room and had furniture from other rooms including mattresses obstructing our passage. Walker had to be lifted by bellman over furniture and handicapped guess had to walk without it to the room. Told staff of problems. Said they were remodeling and they offered no help. Found another hotel and checked out within 1 hour. Hotel refused to waive first night's fee. Left review on Booking.com (where we arranged the accommodation) four nights ago but they have not posted the review. Other reviews submitted after mine have been posted. Disappointed in both hotel and Booking.com.

I would recommend this hotel, a minutes walk to Times Square, other top attractions close by, staff were helpful & friendly, hotel was clean & well kept.The bed was out of this world! We will be back hopefully next year :)

Location is great. The entire hotel is very old. Room is small but Bed is comfortable . Bathroom needs rennovation. The breakfast is ok in NewYork standards. Overall you pay more than you get. You may find better hotels around Times Square and you pay less.

The hotel located just half a block off of the intersection of Broadway and 7th Ave, has many other advantages, Free Wi-Fi available in all areas including the room, the self-service continental breakfast simple but enough , the staff in general is kind and helpful specially the man at the front desk in the morning and it is clean.On the other hand rooms are ok but a little small like most NY hotels but it is enough for two and well heated except for the bathroom. The ST Mary church stairs next door are used as a shelter for cold by homeless people at night and may appear a little disappointing but they do not disturb, there is a luxury hotel just in front of the street. I was in the last floor which was ok for the view but there is only one elevator and it delays a little in the morning.I would definitely recommend this hotel and I would go back again.

Great location to Times Square. we stayed in room 505 we booked direct with hotel. The room was small, very dark, looked Out to a brick wall about 30cm away. prisons have more light in them. not a real issue if you don't care about such things. walls are wafer thin, so if your room next door has a shower or goes to the toilet...standby for noise. Breakfast is included and is just ok. Cereal, bread, pastries, pre cooked eggs, precooked waffles and pancakes. I ate the pancakes one day and never ate them again. apples and bananas and yoghurt available too. Hair dryer in room died first day, it was replaced immediately. Staff are friendly. Have to walk past some homeless people every time you go to Times Square but they don't hassle you. Some kind of mission/church next door. Good for price you pay. We stayed belvedere 3 years previously, rooms bigger there but no breaks and not as close to time square. Other rooms seem to be much bigger than ours at Broadway not sure why we got the room we had - we requested queen size and got it but we were close to lift so could hear people talking and doors slamming at various times of night but no traffic noise at all from outside.

Can't beat how helpful the staff is..first time staying overnight..brought my son..more than accommodating regarding all my directionally challenged questions..if I needed something - I was helped. Good location although the dumpsters on street are misleading but it's right across from a more expensive hotel

Very friendly and helpful staff. Good location, just off Times Square. Complementary continental breakfast is enough to prepare you for a day ahead in Manhattan; a merit to Antonio who tirelessly refills and fetches! We had a pleasant, clean and quiet room with a large comfortable bed. Everything in the room worked properly. 24 hour complementary coffee in the dining area, plus coffee machine in the room. A couple of good bars over the road. This was just what we wanted. Recommended.
user_name:
D V S S
Oslo, Norway

review_body: Myself and my fiancé stayed at this hotel in last week for St Patricks weekend and thought it was fabulous. It is literally steps from Times Square, and the staff couldn't have been nicer and more helpful. Would definatley stay in this hotel again. The rooms although small and basic, were comfortable and warm and just what you need after a long day in New York. The rooms were cleaned everyday, along with fresh towels.

Very clean and comfortable. Exceptionally nice staff. The rooms are rather small though.We had a queen room. Their sister hotel up the street room size is much better. The breakfast was very good.Quite a good spread in a small area.Ample sitting room for breakfast though!

I was surprised to find a reasonably priced hotel so extremely close to Time Square and Broadway shows. The hotel was clean and the staff was very friendly. The staff also let us know about some local discounts and for our trip back to the airport, they suggested a cheaper way to get there. The hotel offered free WIFI & continental breakfast. There is no restaurant in the hotel but there are many outside, within steps from the hotel. Like most New York hotels, rooms are small.

The location is unbelievable. Only steps away from Times Square. Very easy to get to the subway and all the tourist attractions. The hotel was very basic but clean. After all we didn't spent that much time at the hotel. The only negative thing was that we had a room facing the street an was woken up by the garbage truck two nights in a row. But the hotel was excellent and let us change to a room at the back of the hotel. The breakfast is ok. It's very basic bit you could have a piece of toast, bagel, a yoghurt or fruit. The staff was very nice and polite. Always greeted us with a smile. I will definitely stay here again next time I visit New York.

Stayed here for 5 nights, it was absolutely perfect for us. Clean and warm room, small but ample for us, the maid came in everyday to clean and left fresh towels. The breakfast was minimal, bagels, pastries and boiled eggs, but great for a quick bite before all of the sight seeing. Location was wonderful, right in the middle of everything we wanted to see. And all at a very reasonable price! Would highly recommend it to anybody using the hotel as somewhere to rest your head between all of the fabulous things to do and see in the city. Will definitely be back soon!
user_name:
Jenna H
Manchester, England, United Kingdom

review_body: We stayed for 5 nights, right after Super Bowl weekend (a very busy weekend in New York) and it was the perfect choice. The price was very convenient compared to similar hotels in the area and having breakfast and wi-fi included (which worked perfectly in out room) was another advantage.The location is great, just steps away from Times Square and close to many other main attractions in the city and the subway that brings you to/from the airports is 3-4 blocks from the hotel. It is a very crowded area, alive day and night, with lots of restaurants, shops and of course the theaters.The room was clean and comfortable, maybe a little bit small if you have a lot of luggage but good enough for a good night sleep after a long day. The only problem was that there was no heating in the bathroom and with all the snow outside it was really cold. All in all it was a great choice, I would definitely return and recommend it for a nice stay in NYC.

Excellent location, right on time square. Alot of restauarants in area. VERY friendly and helpful bell boy. Reception lady surly. Rooms a bit small if you have a lot of luggage, but the location makes up for it. Breakfast VERY average.

We had a reservation here for 2 nights last October as a stopover after a trip to Europe. We were arriving very late on the first day and leaving very early on the third so planned very little time at the hotel. The rate was about $300 per night including taxes. However, after arriving with our luggage (and walking past all the homeless people camped out for the night right outside the door), we were told there was an electrical problem with our room and they sent us to a sister hotel about a block away. Really? They had our phone number and could not have notified us of the change? The "doorman" didn't bother to open the door on our way in our out and just pointed down the street when we asked where we were going. After arriving at the Hotel@Times Square, we were told the rate was the same (even though I looked online at the time and the rate was significantly lower). The desk person said they couldn't change the rate given at a sister hotel and I could take it up with the manager. That policy makes no sense, especially since we'd booked a king room and ended up with a queen sized bed. Then they were going to send up back to the original hotel the 2nd night. I said we wouldn't move so we were given the room for 2 nights. Personally, I think that they sent us to the lower rate room so the higher rate room was available for last minute reservations. I will rate the Hotel@Times Square in a separate review. Both hotels have great locations, but are lacking other benefits. I think, with a little research, you can do better for your money. I rely on Tripadvisor reviews and do many of them myself......my research failed me on this one.

This is a fantastic budget hotel about half a block from Times Square. I found the staff very helpful - in fact one of the porters lent me his personal umbrella for the day. The free wifi was fantastic and the also the availability of the continental breakfast. The only slight downside was that my room faced directly onto 46th street and there was noise from roadworks and bars closing but wouldn't hesitate to stay here again.

We stayed here during Super Bowl weekend!! Great location, you are literally steps from Times Square!! Rooms were clean, cozy, with modern touches. The price for NYC near Times Square is unbeatable!! I've stayed at several places this was very nice, it's the W for those on a budget!! Friendly staff and very helpful!!

We stayed here for 4 nights in January and would definitely stay again. The service was great - we arrived at noon and our room was ready for us to check-in early, the front desk staff was always smiling and full of information, and they were able to hold our luggage on the last day as check-out was at noon but our flight was not leaving until evening. The room itself was small, but that is to be expected at a Midtown hotel. More importantly, the room was clean and quiet at night (it could get a little noisy in the mornings/afternoons as we could hear people moving around and talking in the hallways, but we weren't in the room too much during the day so it didn't bother us). As others have mentioned, the location of the hotel is fabulous if you are looking for a Midtown location as it is walking distance to the Times Square, Broadway theatres, any number of restaurants and bars, and the subway. The continental breakfast in the morning was nice - coffee/tea/juice, cereal, oatmeal, bagels, donuts and pastries, yogurt, apples and bananas, and boiled eggs.We were very happy with our stay here and would definitely consider staying here during our next trip to NYC.

This hotel offered a good breakfast very clean rooms and helpful staff.The room was a bit small and a bit to much furniture in it but you only need it to sleep in so it was fine.It had all the mod cons for a comfortable stay.

Just a half block from Times Square! (where 7th and Broadway meet)The room was small, but larger than most European rooms and the bed was really comfortable. The room was very clean and quiet. The continental breakfast was adequate and the coffee was pretty good. THe staff were all very friendly and accomodating. We arrived early and were allowed to check in right away.The only negative would be a mild mildewy ordor in the hallway and in our room on the 6th floor. Also, the room was so warm (it was freezing outside) that we had to turn the air conditioner so we could sleep. There is no way to control the temperature in the room.All in all, I would recommend the hotel. The price was great for the location and all you really need in NYC is a place to lay your head after a long day of fun in NYC

Just returned from a 4 night stay at this hotel.......I was so pleased with the location of the hotel. Honestly it's half a block to Times Square and all the action....super handy to hop on hop off stops too. Rockefeller Plaza etc is the other way. Rooms are small, but that's NYC, floor in the bathroom was heated which was nice. Air con was noisy (yes needed cool on as heat was too hot, even in the polar freeze). Could see out of or open windows. Breakfast it a bonus and a good variety. Staff were helpful. Beds were too soft for me and pillows weren't great either too hard or too soft, but you can't have everything. Would stay here again.

Stayed with my wife for six nights and must say we where very pleased with this hotel .  No matter what hotel you stay in whether 2*or 4* the thing thats makes it great is the staff and here at this hotel we found them always very good and keen to help , reception staff are very friendly and helpfull as where all the other staff in the hotel . We had a problem with our safe in the room and they moved us to another room without any fuss . The rooms have all you need for a hotel as you don't go to New York to stay in your room , beds where very comfortable and where made up everyday which we didn't really need done .We had a room witha bathroom that had a bath with overhead shower in it but some rooms are showers only . The ground floor reception and breakfast room where very modern and looked very good the bedrooms are more old fashioned but still nice rooms . With the hotel you get a buffet breakfast for free each morning that had a ample range of choice and without any waiting around , it was of a good standard and sets you up well for the day , you can also get tea and coffee atany time of day in this room .The location is fantastic just yards away from times square and there are plenty food options and bars all around the hotel .We have stayed three times in New York and this was the best yet even though it was the best value one . We traveled from Newark airport using the airport express bus that left you at either Bryant Park or Port Authority which are both only a few blocks away and it only has three drop offs so was very quick .Will definately return to this hotel as we where very pleased with it

Stayed at the hotel for 6 nights, the first night the heating was set to high we spoke to the reception staff and it was soon sorted. The staff are friendly and helpful, hotel is located within walking distance of Times Square The are two great Irish pubs on 45th so not to far to stagger home after a few beers, tube stations are within a few minutes walk. The rooms are of a good size for NYC, our room was spotlessly clean and furnished to a good standard. The only minus point for us was the shower it would got from boiling hot to extremely coldWe had a room on the front of the hotel, it was fairly noisy but you have to expect some noise when staying in the middle of NYC, I would suggest asking for a room at the rear of the hotel. Fantastic hotel one of the best I've stayed at NYC

just come back from a 4 night stay at this hotel... absolutely loved it. perfect location a stones throw away from times square . didn't hear any noise at the night time we stayed on the 8th floor.the rooms are yes small but all hotel rooms are in new York. you are never in your room so perfect for our needs. breakfast is average , toast, bagels , yogurts , fruit , eggs and tea and coffee and juice. great value for money and would definitely recommend to anyone and stay here myself again. wonderful and really helpful staff. I read in previous reviews about the lift being slow, yes it is slow but just take the stairs simple . wonderful !!!!!

Loved the location will b going back to this hotel in December. hotel was spotless .food was realy good.cant get over how close it was to time square defo will b coming back to this hotel  staff were freindly. Over all my daughter and I enjoyed are stay thankyou very much.
user_name:
Carol940
New York City, New York

review_body: This small hotel, which some years ago, was a Comfort Inn, is one of a group of Appelcore Hotels in Manhattan. The hotel is located on W. 46th St, just a half block from Times Square. Runs are small but clean and well appointed.. They have recently renovated the small lobby and the complimentary breakfast area. WiFi is free and computers are available at not cost in the lobby. The front desk crew are friendly and competent especially, Jovannie. He remembered that my wife and I had stayed frequently over the past 10 years. The cost of under $200 dollars for this location was an excellent value. Would definitely stay there again.

You could not wish for a better, more central location. Rooms were clean, if a bit on the small side. Excellent selection for breakfast & complimentary wifi was great.Nothing was too much trouble for the staff.

Excellently placed in the heart of Manhattan, you are in a walking distance to most of the objectives in the area. Clean, comfortable, stuff is polite and curteous. Breakfast a bit less rich (no vegetables) and gym room minimal, but overall a good place to stay!

This hotel was by far the better of the two I stayed in during my 2.5 week stay in NYC. I chose this hotel because of its proximity to Times Square (oh, and complimentary breakfast) and I'm not kidding, it is crazily close! It was great for us visiting Port Authority, Central Park, American Museum of Natural History, Rockefeller Centre/TOTR, Radio City Hall etc.Our room was located on 5th floor and had a view of W 46th street below which was great so we could dress for the weather. Ours came with a queen bed, had a cooler fan (which I reckon could use with an upgrade - it was noisy and the grill/cover was falling off), coffee maker, a bathroom with the usual shampoo and soap and shower/bathtub combo. There was no mini fridge in our room.The complimentary breakfast was also good, with offerings of donuts, pastries, oats, fruits, yogurt, eggs, tea/coffee etc. There is also a microwave here which was a bonus so we could heat up any leftover takeaway.If you're after yummy Chinese food, give John's Shanghai across the road a go. There are 2 computers in the lobby area as well where printing is complimentary. The gym room had a cold water machine which was great cos we filled our bottles each morning prior to our day out.Housekeeping didn't clean our room a couple of times after we had removed the 'Do not disturb' sign and there was one particular housekeeper who wasn't very friendly.There is a church next door and there were a few homeless people sleeping outside, but that did not affect my stay in any way.Majority of the staff were friendly and helpful. I would definitely choose to stay here again and recommend this to my friends thinking of visiting NYC.

I have stayed here 3 years ago. That time it was named Comfort Inn Times Square. The name has changed but many of the staff are still the same. This time I stayed 7 nights from 27 th Dec to 3 rd January with three if my grown up children, in 2 rooms. The hotel's location is right in the centre of Times Square. The Visitor's centre (where the Ball was displayed) is just round the corner so are many of the great theaters and shops. It is within walking distance from Central Park, Rockefeller's centre 5 th Avenue, grand Central. Even Empire State and Macy's are not that far away. We came for the count down but we didn't queue like many people since weather was freezing, but because of the location, we were still able to go out around 11.30 pm on New year eve and be part of the crowd for the New Year Count down and immersed ourselves in the spirits of joy,The staff are friendly and helpful especially those whom I have met before on my previous stay. The rooms are small but adequate and clean. The hotel provide a good breakfast with eggs, cereal, bread, yogurt, fruits, coffee tea and juices. Tea room is available to guests on a 24 hour basis where we could eat takeaway food and relax while watching CNN. Overall, a very good hotel and right in Times Square. I would not hesitate to stay here again on my next visit to New York.

This hotel was great! Very clean, great location, and everyone that worked there was friendly and helpful. Our room was very nice and the bathroom was clean. The location is awesome, half a block from Times Square. The complimentary breakfast was a nice extra, especially in NYC where meals are so expensive. They stored our luggage when we arrived early in the morning on the first day. We will definitely stay here again.

It has been two years since we stayed at the Broadway at Times Square Hotel. So between Christmas and New Year we were fortunate enough to get a king sized bed on the 9th Floor. Much of what I wrote about before still stands: Location, friendly service, parking facilities, cleanliness, home like features, fine breakfast. All there. Excellent. AND, AND they redecorated the place, made the public rooms on floor one larger, roomier. And the colors in our room 907 were great! The bathroom was redone. It was a fantastic surprise. They took a great little hotel and made it magnificent. And I kid you not one bit.

This hotel kept oming up with the best price for my week stay in nyc, i was a bit concerned why it was the cheapest thought there must be something wrong with it. I didnt find many thing wrong and would highly recommend. I had a room at the back so wasnt bothered with outside noise but there is abit of noise from the corridor. The doors slam and there was someone in the room next to me that kept going in and out about 10 times in the mornings and afternoons slamming the doors which was really annoying. The rooms are good size and had everything i needed. The shower ran cold though after only a couple of minutes so have to be quick. Having a room at the back was great for the winter as window is a view of a wall, i didnt open the windows so dont know if this will be good in summer when you would want fresh air. There isnt a fridge so i kept my drinks on the window sill with the curtain closed it kept my water very cold.I only had my room cleaned twice as travelling along and dont require services everyday, i put the private sign on the door and on two occassion housekeeping rang to see if i required cleaning, this both happened whilst having afternoon nap and on one occassion rang twice and then knocked on door which annoyed me as woke me up. Room was great size for one person bed kingsize but quite soft and pillows too soft for my personal liking.I only had breakfast one one occasion which was good and also like you can have tea and coffee during the day as and when you want.I kept myself to myself so didnt really ask reception for anything but they were polite when checking in and out. This is great for time square and metro links also great bar across the street. Lift very slow so you get fit walking upstairs.

This is our second night in a 5 night stay...If it wasn't for the location I don't think I would want to stay here again.The location is amazing and really one of the only positives about this hotel.The rooms are ridiculously hot!!!!! The windows aren't allowed to be opened so you are stuck with a loud air conditioner or sweating when it is minus 5 degrees outside. The hallways smell like weed- funny because it is a non smoking building.The cleaning staff only half finished their job- pillows left thrown on the side of the half made bed.The shower only stays hot for one person- a bit hard when there is two of us.The bathroom is unclean and has other peoples hair stuck to the walls (not sure if it was actually clean before we got here)The check in staff were a bit short with us, but they did store our stuff for us when we arrived a few hours before we could check in.The brochure says that vending machines are available- this is not true meaning you have to leave the hotel to get refreshments- no mini fridge either to keep stuff cool if you do want to stock up on beverages.Not having an issue with outside noise at this point- we are a fair way to the back of the hotel and up 7 floors.Elevator is slow- quicker to walk the 7 flights of stairs.The rooms are quite tiny which makes it a lot harder with the general heat of the room.All in all, you are paying for the location- which is fine, but the main point of your hotel room in NY is to shower and sleep- neither of which you can actually do comfortably here.I am not normally one to complain, but I don't think that the reviews here give the best overview of the hotel but more the location.location is definitely a 10.

We stayed at that hotel two years ago and I thought our room was somewhat cleaner back then.However, our stay this time was pretty nice.The location is the best!Times Square is a few steps away.The rooms were small with the furniture that is too big for the size of the room.But we didn't care as we came to see NYC at Christmas time and not to hang out in the hotel.The big plus is that you get a great breakfast at this hotel.The gentleman who runs the breakfast room is super nice and efficient. Don't forget to tip him, he surely deserves it. The staff at the hotel was very helpful and the renovated lobby looks very modern and neat. Overall, I would stay here again when I am in NYC again.

My husband and I stayed for two nights while in NYC for a pre Christmas getaway; this was our third stay at the Broadway at Times Square Hotel this year. Clean, comfortable rooms, yes small, but, we don't travel to NYC to sit in our room! Location is great, steps to Times Square, and an easy walk to the theaters, restaurants, Rockefeller Centre, Bryant Park. The staff are all friendly, and helpful. Don't hesitate to stay here!

We made our selection from Trip Adviser reviews and we certainly made the right choice.As stated in many of the reviews the location is perfect for exploring New York.We stayed 4 nights after a cruise and it topped of a wonderful 6 weeks holiday. The Hotel was everything we could have asked for. The staff was friendly and helpful, our room was large (7th Floor,at the back of the Hotel) and the continental breakfast was very good.The breakfast area has been recently renovated and the place was spotless.The service also was excellent and food replaced quickly if anything looked like running out. Could not fault the Hotel and would stay there again.We loved N.Y - used the Hop on Hop off bus but we found ourselves walking a lot more than we expected.Sites and Broadway shows (saw 3 ) were fantastic. Make sure you see Grand Central Station ( same street,just a block away). Times Square was amazing. There is a new Thank God its Friday restaurant between the Hotel and Times Square as well as a small supermarket just across the street.

We stayed 3 nights. The location is perfect...close to Times Square, Rockefeller Center, subway. The staff was helpful. Breakfast is included. The rooms are a bit small, but clean and well-furnished. We did not notice outside noise. We were able to store our luggage after checking out on the last day.

Don't stay here unless you don't mind very loud outside noise until at least 2:00 in the morning. The location is great, but don't expect to get to sleep until outside noise quiets down. To be fair, we didn't notice excessive noise our first night there, but the other two nights it was impossible to get to sleep until after 2:00 am. At first we were very pleased with the hotel because of the location but ended up very disappointed.

We stayed here for two nights. Check in time is 3.00 PM. We arrived quite early at about 11.00. They were happy to store our luggage and gave us early check in at 2.30.This hotel is all about location. It's literally 2 min walk to tines square/Broadway. There are numerous places to eat and drink in walking distance. Entrance lobby of the hotel is emaculate. It gives an impression of a very spacious building (which it isn't upstairs). But I suppose it's expected given its location.Room was on the smaller side but I have seen smaller rooms. Breakfast was descent. All in all wonderful stay!

The best thing about this hotel is its amazing location. situated just off times square, central to everything....amazing!!The hotel itself is very nice, the room was quite spacious and clean. daily maid service providing fresh towels etc.The bed was comfortable. The only downside is the noise level, from our room it was constant all through the night. We managed to sleep OK but other people may struggle (it may have been due to the location of the room!)A great place to stay when visiting New York!

Just back from a wonderful stay at this lovely hotel . Just steps away from all the action of Times Square area. A very warm and personal staff to assist you in all your needs. Hotel is very modern and spotlessly clean. Rooms are small but then again most hotel rooms in New York are on the small side. Buffet breakfast is also included in the room costs which are very reasonable for this prime area. You can avail of free tea or coffee facilities on a 24 hour basis . Definitely check this hotel out if you are visiting New York and looking for good quality reasonable accommodation right on Broadway.

We enjoyed a week long stay here for our first ever trip to NYC. Could not be happier with this hotel. The location is prime as it is within walking distance to Times Square, Rockefeller Centre, Central Park, several subway stations, many eateries and grocery stores. The entire hotel looked to have been recently renovated and was very clean and modern. The free continental breakfast was of a very good quality and all staff we encountered were very friendly and very helpful. We would happily stay at this hotel again

Perfect location close to times square and Bryant Park. Good room size given location we slept 5 in a room with 2 queen beds. The continental breakfast is good for kids and early risers; pastry, bread, hard boiled eggs, fruit, yogurts, coffee, juice and oatmeal. Tiny exercise room clean and functional. Great Price.

Excellent location. right on time square hotel. Near to everything you need for a fun trip to nyc. Hotel rooms cleaned every day, fresh food served for breakfast. Couple stayed for a week and would use this hotel again.

We stayed at this hotel on Saturday, November 23rd as a weekend get away in the city and had a very good experience. The hotel is in a great location to see a Broadway Show, to Times Square, and to Rockerfeller Plaza. There was only two of us so we found the size of the room adequate- believe me we have stayed in smaller rooms. We had a very comfortable bed, and plenty of pillows. The room had a flat screen TV and shampoo, soad and lotion were provided. The bathroom was clean and a water pressure was fine. We did have breakfast the next morning. It is typical continental breakfast foods. If you are a looking for a good place to sleep in a great location, then The Broadway Hotel at Times Square is the place to stay. If you have any questions please feel free to contact me.

Great location and for NYC well worth the money especially if you take advantage of the continental breakfast. Because of the great location we were able to walk to the hotel from the train station. We were also able to walk to theatre that we had show tickets for and there were many dinner and drink options also within walking distance.

Excellent hotel! Very comfortable.. And is just 1min from TIMESSQUEARE!!! The breakfast was prefect to start a new day. The people speak spanish too and are very friendly. Also have new facilities because was remodeled. The lobby and the breakfast area. Is open 24/7.

Just spent 4 nights here and have to say it was excellent value and very comfortable.Although the room was small it was very clean and comfortable.Two windows but they look out onto a wall so no view or natural light but as we were out all day that did not matter,Staff really nice ans as a bonus the breakfast is included and although basic set up the food was fresh and plentiful Would recommend this small neat little hotel thats right in the centre of all the action in Times Square.

Only in New York for 3 nights and not wanting to be dependent on subways or cabs, we had the perfect location and accommodations for our stay. The clean, bright, modern hotel was perfect for our needs even though the rooms were not as large as some of the other hotels in the area; however, the price was right and the "continental" breakfast offered each morning was certainly more than what most hotels offer. The friendly staff was always on hand to greet us and provide assistance with restaurant accommodations and transportation suggestions to the airport for a 7 AM Sunday morning flight. After a long day, it was so nice to only have a short walk to our hotel after the theater...the half price ticket box office was a hop, skip and a jump away, too!

Perfect location- we were within walking distances to Broadway, attractions, restraurants and plenty of shopping. We arrived early and our room was available which was great so we could go shopping right away. The staff was very helpful with tours and shuttle service to Newark Airport. The breakfast was continental...it hit the spot to start our day. There's a 24hr store across the street that has sandwhiches, hot food, drinks, etc that was very convient. The room was small but that's to be expected in NYC. The room was very clean and the bathroom was very roomy. The price was great given that otheres I spoke to in the shuttle spent much more and didn't have breakfast included.

Loved this clean, bright, modern, friendly hotel. Will definitely recommend and stay there again. Extremely friendly staff, great breakfast in help your self canteen. Perfect size room, great bathroom with hot shower. Cant fault it! Its a thirty second sprint to Times Square! PERFECT!!!!

I didn't have high expectations for our stay, as we booked the hotel based on location and affordability. However, we were delighted. The location was indeed ideal, half a block from Times Square. Our room was quiet, the beds very comfortable, and water pressure was good in the shower. The front desk staff were personable and helpful and we liked that they seemed to get to know us quickly. It was very handy having the little breakfast in the lobby. Even to grab a coffee, yogurt and a banana to go. It was a good place for our group to gather in the morning before heading out. There is a bar right across the street if you want late night drinks close by.All in, we were very pleased with the hotel.

the central location is just wonderfull, the metro stations are in 2 and 5 min walk. all broadways shows are just in 5 min walk, the MetOpera is just 2 metro stations ride. my favorite Junior's cafe is 2 min walk for their famous cheescakes!!! the hotel staff is very helpfull and nice. the breakfast which is included in price is simply continental breakfast but for free you weill find there cofee, tea, juice, different cornflakes and pastries, eggs and all kind of toasts and bagels with butter, cheesecream and jams. the hotel has only 9 floors, the rooms are quite big and very clean, tehy even provide shampoo and body lotions every day in quite good quality. you should not forget that this hotel is only 3 star hotel so i wopuld say that the hotel is very good for 3 star hotel in the middle of Times Square and for that value of money

Great location in the heart of Times Square and Broadway. Reasonably priced room, by New York standards anyway, with a great sized bed for the two of us. We were fortunate to get a room overlooking the dingy back yard, purely for the tranquility from the noise of the bustling city. Well soundproofed, as the only internal noise came from the banging of fellow residents' room doors, made heavy to ensure closure.Do not expect glamorous decor, as it is a functional hotel, with no bar or restaurant. (Although there is a breakfast area.). But hey, who needs these when you're located in a buzzing part of the "City that never sleeps"!The staff were very down to earth, and we experienced no problems with the customer service.Overall, I'd say the right sort of hotel for the area, where you would get a restful night's sleep@NY

Excellent if you want to stay in the center of NY, near Times Square and everything. Stayed in the same place some years ago. Now it's fully renovated and modern and a new name. But rooms are still very small, but clean and quiet (did not use the obsolete window air conditioner). Very good breakfast included in the priceHelpful staff, free internet.In short, if you can live with a small room - a nice places to stay

My husband and I stayed here for a 5 night trip to NYC. The location is amazingly central, round the corner from Times Square but also a short walk away from quieter areas and choice of restaurants. It's a boutique style hotel and the staff were always friendly and helpful. Our room was small but adequate as we were out all day and often in the evenings. It was cleaned every day with new towels and coffee refills. We were on the ninth floor and only had short waits for the lifts, but it was lovely and quiet and we slept well. There was a huge tv with news, current affairs and movies freely available. Breakfast was included and was a help-yourself selection of coffee, tea, cereals, yoghurt, bagels, bread (with options of jams, peanut butter and cream cheese spreads) muffins, pastries, doughnuts, boiled eggs and fruit, which was ample for us. If you want a more meaty breakfast then there are plenty of places available in the area. There was a small gym (didn't use). The free wifi in our room was fantastic and let us keep in touch with emails and family via skype/facetime. There was nothing fancy here, it did the job perfectly and we had a great trip.

My wife and I stayed here for 3 nights on our first trip to NYC. I was skeptical at first because the price was considerably lower than other hotels in Times Square, but my worries amounted to nothing as the hotel was perfect. The management was very helpful and the rooms were adequate for sleeping. With so much to do, you don't spend any time in the hotel either way. The location is perfect, half a block from Times Square. There is a deli and Cuban restaurant that are a must right down the street!!! Definitely the best deal in Times Square!!!

I ended up staying here after another Inn in New York didnt work out. The staff were friendly and awesome, always able to answer my queries. I was originally on a high level but asked to come to the lowest level and they granted my request with no hassles. Service was awesome! Rooms are really standard and small. I had a queen room and could only fit one of my suitcases, the other slept with me on my bed. Breakfast was good. I enjoyed it alot very basic but nice!!Location is prime!!! Best place to stay in New York if your on a budget, you walk out of the hotel, turn right and walk 2 mins and you are right in the middle of times square. Overall would definitely stay here again.

Great location for a NY break. Public areas nicely decorated; shame about the rooms which were seriously in need of a facelift. Having wifi was really good. Overall pretty good; rooms could do better.

Just stayed three nights at this hotel and we could not have been more satisfied with our experience. We knew the hotel was not a luxury hotel by the reasonable prices, but it was satisfactory in every way. The hotel was recently remodeled. The room was clean and well maintained. The hotel provides a free daily newspaper and breakfast, free Wi-Fi and business center, hair dryers, iron and ironing board. Best of all the hotel is just a half block from Times Square and very easy walking distance to many Broadway theaters and Rockefeller Center. There were several restaurants on the same block of 46th street including a TGI Fridays, an Irish Pub, a Cuban and a Brazilian restaurant. There was also a convenience store directly across the street. The staff was friendly and inviting and were happy to answer our questions about ground transportation and neighborhood attractions. We would definitely stay there the next we visit NYC.

We checked out this morning after a seven night stay. We booked this online from Australia. The location cannot be beaten. Times Square is on the next corner and there are plenty of dining options nearby. The room was small but it was adequate for the two of us. It was also very quiet and the breakfast room was great with enough options for us. Staff were friendly and helpful. We would recommend this hotel.

I actually stayed here last July 2012 with my mom, sister and nephew. We were staying in Connecticut and wanted to watch a broadway show. We were looking for one that was just a short distance to the theater and reasonably priced to stay overnight in. We found this gem. It was literally 100 steps to Times Square and another 100 steps to the theater. The hotel is old and the rooms are understandably small but they were clean, functional and comfortable. The bathroom was ok. Best of all it was reasonably priced -less than $200 a night , right by Times Square. We would just walk to Broadway and Times Square, buy hot dogs, sit in the benches and watch people go by then shop. At night, the same thing, with the addition of marveling at all the neon lights and people coming and going. Will come back here again.

Just stayed four days and appreciate the friendly staff and nice breakfast. The location was great and rooms clean. Would stay there again and recommend those looking for a place close to Times Square for very reasonable prices for NY area. Close to great shopping and sights within walking distance.Bob B

We stayed for four nights, Oct 12-15th 2013.....The staff was very helpful, especially JovanniRooms were clean and bed was very comfortable...the breakfast had good choices and nice eating area. Half a block from times square, close to everything. Would stay again.

I booked this hotel from Sept 12 to 16th. Our flight was to arrive from Cleveland to LaGuardia on the 12th, however, after waiting at the airport for repeated delays in our flight, it was finally cancelled at 4:30 p.m. and there were no flights on any airlines leaving Cleveland on the 12th due to weather conditions at LaGuardia.
