It was located right on the main broadway and timesquare attractions! although I think it was a little too expensive for me but i attribute that to the peak halloween and tourist season. my room costed me a total of $353 for one night (including tax)!well, i stayed there for a night. the staff at reception were friendly and warm, probably indian. they checked us in and a support staff took our enormous number of bags upstairs, the only elevator for the hotel, was a little old and slow and took long to come. The lobby was also small but clean and presentable. there were desktops and printer for use.the corridors were a bit congested but it was ok.the room was small but cozy and had all the necessities, washroom was clean with a good supply of towels and other stuff.we were going to niagara falls the next day for 2 days but didn't want to take the luggage, the hotel staff was so cooperative to keep our luggage FREE of cost and just gave us tags to collect them after coming back.wifi was free toothe breakfast served was also very reasonable.our overall stay was great and i would totally recommend this place and you are literally staying right at broadway!!kudos

A good hotel with a great location,convenient to restaurants, the theater and the subway.Rooms are clean and well-kept. And all of the staff is kind and helpful. The breakfast area is small but food is good and plentiful.I have my third stay there coming up soon.

my husband and my daughter and myself stayed in this hotel and we were all very happy with it, We were a litlle concerned with the lack of room in the bedroom as we had two double beds and fthree large and two small cases but there was a large wardrobe where we stored three of them so it worked out quite well. The staff at reception were great as was the cleaners and breakfast server, the breakfast room was clean at all times although quite small but they are renovating at the moment. This hotel was also very quiet, clean and comfortable, we would certainly stay there again as it is so close to everything and not too expensive compared to some of the other hotels in the area!!!!

we have stayd at the hotel 5 nights. Great location - near everyting! time square, 5th eve., broadway, resturants, bars, shopping.The subway is just 3-4 minutes from the hotel.The rooms are big and clean.The staff is very nice and helpful.The breakfast is a little bit poor and there is not eunogh tables for all the guests.Although' we defenitly will come back.

Hi. Good hotel, silence and location. But Be CAREFUL when you give them your credit card in the front desk for the deposit in case of any damage. They create a phisical voucher which of course show all the information of the credit card. I was there since november 1st to 5th. When I checked my credit card statement I was shocked. They charged it with 900 dollars of orders through Internet. This is the moment I´m still trying to get my money back with my Bank. Thanks.

After reading some reviews, I was concerned about room size, but both the room and the bathroom were more than adequate, and, yes, spotlessly clean. I was also concerned about street noise, but even being half a block from Time Square, there was none. The hotel is small but well-kept, renovated but maintaining a fifty's look. Hotel staff efficient and amiable. All in all, a very nice stay. Will probably return when in New York. Location is great!

This hotel is spotless clean!!!!! Very friendly front desk staff and bellman were terrific! Yes, rooms are small but the bathroom was large enough to move around in to get ready. Breakfast area clean and a nice perk. I would give $this hotel a 5 star but I can't... The beds we had were well slept in. They need to buy new beds. they are sagging and you can see it when bed is made. But the location was perfect... 2 blocks maybe to Times Square... When I come back to New York I will be staying here!!! Also, it was safe and the bellman made us feel like we were home... Can't remember his name but tall man who always laughed at me and my gal pal I was there with..

Before I begin, let me state that I have stayed in many hotels and have never been anywhere like here before.I stayed here with my partner, sisters and parents for 8 nights, in 3 different rooms.We each paid the same and got completely different sizing rooms.Upon arriving, the front desk said hello and within the first sentence asked us to pay upfront for all rooms. We found it to be a bit rude, but proceeded to pay and then went up to our rooms.We now knew why....The extremely small & stuffy room but was clean (which was at least ONE good thing about this hotel). We then decided to unpack and go to bed. Our heating started spitting out gas or something so we called up Maintenance. He 'fixed' the problem and went away. It didnt stop for the next 2 hours. It was SO loud so we called them up AGAIN. We tried to ask the maintenance man what was going on, but he couldn't speak English, so they just moved us to another room.The breakfast was cereals, stale doughnuts and juice - I wouldn't bother eating there at all. Go across the street to the cafe deli shop which is open 24 hours.The rooms have paper thin walls, and can hear everything next door. When next door opened their door, our door shook and sounded like someone was trying to come into our room. I even heard someone going to the bathroom one night!!!One morning we were heading down stairs to go out and put the 'do not disturb' sign on our door. We ran into the maid on the way out, and she asked if we wanted our room serviced. We said no thank you and went out. When we got downstairs I forgot something in my room and my partner went up stairs to get it... He finds the maid at our door with it open?!?!?! I found that disgusting & very rude. Glad he got up there when he did in case she stole anything.The days we didnt get our room serviced, the maids got VERY angry and rude. They were very pushy. I know that is their job, but Im not letting people in my room who I don't trust.One day she asked if we we're leaving and then started cheering in the elevator. She was SO rude!!!The LIFT/ELEVATOR - slowest lift in NYC. There were broken tiles which my sister tripped on. And you would think that it would have a sensor if someone was getting in, the door wouldn't close on them? I started to walk into the elevator and instead of opening back up, it rushed towards me and closed, and have a terrible bruise on my leg.The staff are very rude and unprofessional, and not friendly at ALL.On the last day that we were here, we found out they charged us an extra $5000 on our card, on top of what we already paid!!!!!!!! They said the computer automatically charged it and would try and fix it soon. How many other people has this happened too????The ONE thing I liked about this hotel was the location, but PLEASE pay a little bit extra and go somewhere nice and professional.I was so excited to stay here from the great reviews, but NEVER, EVER EVER AGAIN.We have been extremely disappointed with our stay in NYC and cannot wait to go home.

We were also caught in Hurricane Sandy, but outside of the city by 250 miles. Had to make a reservation because the airports had closed. When NYC closed we could not make it into the city and thus could not make the reservation. We notified the hotel. Were told that the manager also did not make it into the city. They charged the reservation fee of nearly $200, and will not refund it, even though the circumstances were totally out of our control...and their's as well. I find them totally cold and heartless.

I arrived at 1 am from a long flight and they had given my room away even though I had a confirmed reservation. They wanted to put me in one of their other properties down on 23rd St. which was not convenient for me as my 7 am meeting the next morning was on 52nd. I ended up at the EconoLodge - certainly not what I booked. I will never book with these people again. They didn't seem to care that I had a confirmed reservation. They just filled the hotel with whoever showed up. Sucks to arrive and find that you don't have a room and nearly every other hotel in the area is sold out.
user_name:
Gail S
New York City, New York

review_body: We ended up having an extended stay at this Hotel due to Hurricane Sandy -the staff were fantastic - extended our booking without a problem and really looked after us. The Hotel rooms are very comfortable, of a decent size and a bathroom with a tub. The Queen size bed is exceptionally comfy and afforded hubby and I really good sleep quality. Location wise, you could not ask for better - Times Square is a short walk away as are all the Broadway Theatres and 5th and 6th Avenue. Excellent Restaurants in the area - there is a great irish Pub across the road from the Hotel which provides top quality food and entertainment and is open till very late to cater for the night owls. Also nearby is a 24 Hr Deli which makes the most delicious sandwiches - if you have the midnight munchies this is the place to go. The Hotel provides free internet service and all rooms have WiFi. We would definitely stay here again and are happy to recommend the Hotel to fellow travellers looking for a good deal.

We recently stayed at this property for 6 nights. It truly lived up to our expectations based on previous reviews. Right in the heart of the Times Square area, it is very close to some good places to eat, the subway as well as some icons such as Top of the Rock and Central Station. Once we understood how the system worked we were very quickly able to head up and down town without any problems from this location. An older hotel, it still is very comfortable and we were happy to return there each evening. Our quiet room on the third floor was small but very clean. Whilst we had a window it faced looked down upon a very narrow alley, but we were hardly there so it did not matter. As far as price was concerned especially as it included breakfast, it could not be beaten. The staff at reception were very helpful and always very friendly.

This is not a big, glitzy showplace. It is a warm, comfortable place to stay while in New York. Literally (and truly) a mere hundred steps from the center of the world....Times Square. In the midst of the theater district (150 steps more or less to the TKS kiosk). Subway connections for up and downtown are within a block and a half. Next door to St. Mary the Virgin (Episcopal). And the rooms are more than adequate. The beds are really comfortable. The showers are hot. The staff members are friendly and helpful. The breakfast (6:30 to 10:00 AM) is more than adequate to see you on your way. We have stayed there a dozen times. And we shall return.

We stayed six nights with our 7 year old daughter . When we arrived we were greeted with a warm and friendly welcome. The hotel is a older hotel in a good location 1/2 block from times square and 3 blocks from the rockerfeller in the other direction. whilst the rooms were compact we were comfortable with large tv with various channels (mainly Disney for my daughter ) , iron , coffee machine , ipod docking station , nintendo , in room safeWe had a room at the back which did not have a view but was very quite.The breakfast room was small although they are increasing it in size soon . The breakfast itself was basic but adequate bagels , waffles , toast , eggs , sausage patty.The lift was slow as mentioned by others but not that badAcross the road was a 24hr store for snacks , drinks etc The hotel arranged a taxi back to kennedy for a flat $60For the price , location and facilities we think this hotel is perfect and would highly recommendand will use on our next visit to nyc

This was our first time in New York so was a little apprehensive about being in a safe area near to all the major sites but we needn't have worried,the hotel was about a one minute walk away from times square.It was clean and tidy with an excellent choice of food for breakfast the staff were all friendly and let us keep our bags in a safe place for several hours after we checked out.If every we were to come back to NY this would be our first choice.

Stayed six nights and everything promised was as advertised, clean, comfortable rooms, friendly staff, breakfast was good. Wifi was good, on 3 rd floor, the noise levels were low.We would return here, the location is excellent. Organized a flat fare ride to LGA. Herd to fault.Deli / food store across the road was handy. Close to Carmine's Italian restaurant, it was great. Havana Central bar / restaurant is close by and has $1.00 Empenadas on Tuesday from 4 -7pm.

This was our second time to New York City and this time we wanted something that would be a little bit closer to everything and accommodate four people. This is one of the only hotels in New York City that allows up to four people in one room, most will only allow up to three people.Well the location of the hotel is fantastic. It is just mere seconds away from the heart of Times Square and because there was four of us this was the best price for what we needed.The staff were very friendly and helpful. The rooms were not big but not too small either, just enough room for us all, it was what we expected it to be for a New York hotel.Each morning there was complimentary breakfast which had a great range of food. It definitely filled us up. It was great having that to start us off each morning. Tea and coffee were available all day long, so when we had come back from our adventures we could easily pick up a hot drink without having to buy one from a store. There was always a man standing in the lobby greeting everyone who walked in and helping them if they needed it.Our only concern while we were there was the elevator. It has a limit of five people at one time and as there was four of us there could only be room for one more person each time we used it. One day we were on our way to the lobby and two other people got in and then it the doors closed and it got stuck half way down. We only had to wait for about three minutes before one of the staff opened the door for us. They do have one sign stating that there is a limit of five people but if the elevator is full no one can see it because it isn't that big. My only suggestion would be is to put a bigger sign on the outside of each level so people can read it before they enter. We used the stairs from then on.The day we were leaving the staff organized a car service to pick us up for a flat fee, which was great.We would definitely stay here again.

Stayed here for a week in October. Having looked around and compared to other hotels in this area, this hotel provides great value for dollar. It isn't exactly cheap but nothing is in NYC. You'll have to adjust your expectations of a $300 per night hotel.Clean, nicely furnished. Rooms are a bit small but not as small as I had expected. Really accommodating staff. Helpful, cheerful. Some rooms at the front of the hotel are noisy but air conditioning provides a white noise that blocks out the other street sounds. Bed was too soft for our tastes. Breakfast was just OK and the breakfast room was always hot. They are, however, expanding this area and the lobby and improvements will be most welcome. Half lock. Of Times Square - well located, if that's the area you want to be in. Would use this hotel again if we were to return to New York.

At the first night we got small room with windows to big wallafter i talk with the front desk they change my room to better and larger room but a little noisy.the staff are very helpfulOverall not bad choice

Just stayed a few days at this nice 'boutique' hotel in the center of it all. Just a few steps from Times Square and our favorite theaters. Staff was very friendly and helpful. Would absolutely stay here again.

This hotel is in the center of it all. Now I'll be honest we did so much in the city that besides sleeping and breakfast, we did not really spend a lot of time in the hotel. But the breakfast was good and the staff was nice. I do think the room could have been cleaner. But really you can not beat the location!

This hotel located just off Times Sq is perfect location for theatre buffs being right in the heart of the show district but quiet at night due to the windows facing inward to the adjacent building. Rooms are tiny but very well appointed. Breakfast is offered by an outside caterer and not that inspiring, paper plates and coffee/tea in a paper cup was average. Would definately stay here again.

We are all very happy how wonderful the service and very closed to time square about 2 minutes closed to everything. The room are very clean and clean bed and we were totally amazed. We sure will be coming back to this hotel.

This hotel has a truly excellent location -a 1 minute walk from Times Square and about 7-8 minutes away from the Rockefeller Center. It ıs located at about a 1 hour distance from JFK Airport and about 40 minutes from Laguardia. But its not only about the location: the hotel offers free internet usage in the lobby and a very good breakfast. The rooms, while typically NYC small, are comfortable and well-decorated. You have a coffee maker in the room and a largish TV with all major channels.But for me what stood out about this hotel was the staff-they were genuinely welcoming and helpful at all times (not always the case in NYC hotels). Ivonne and Juan on the reception desk were outstanding in terms of the level of assistance and interest they gave us. Some minor complaints: there is only one elevator (bear that in mind when checking out and at breakfast) . The breakfast room does get very, very crowded at times and is not air-conditioned. As far as I understood it, gradual redecoration and remodelling is ongoing around the hotel and so hoperfully these minor issues will be dealt with.Overall, I cannot recommend this hotel enough.Ifully intend to stay there again.

Just returned from three days in the Big Apple. The Broadway at Times Square was the perfect spot for us.Just one block from Times Square, two blocks from the subway and short walking distance from theatres and good restaurants.Our room was clean, the bed comfortable and the free breakfast was more than adequate for a quick start to the day.Our AAA discount made it all the better.We will return.

Easy to find; so convenient to Times Square/Broadway! Arrived early(before noon) hoping to just be able to stow our luggage until check-in only to find our room was ready! Clean, comfortable and quiet room (6th floor). Very pleasant and helpful staff. Good breakfast offering. Definitely will be our choice when we return to NYC!

Great location and great price! However when we went to our room, it was being painted....so back down the elevator with all of our luggage we went. Waited about an hour in total in the very hot lobby to get a new room. New room had been painted earlier that day and paint was still sticky to the touch and the bathroom smelled terrible. Back down to the desk where we asked to speak to the manager. Rajini, the manager, was not very nice. We were only looking for a bit of good customer service so we could feel better about our stay. She made excuses, argued with us and was defensive and ultimately agreed she would rather lose our business than to make up our inconvienence in any way. Very poor customer service and had it not been for Jack, the concierge, we most certainly would have gone down the street to the Doubletree and paid more. Thank you Jack! You deserve a raise and/or promotion because you truly understand customer service. The room was small but cute and all we really needed for our short stay in NYC. This hotel could do very well under better management.
user_name:
Rachelle E
Pendleton, Indiana, United States
